loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales menores que luego engorda y los vende en su misma casa, además compra quesos que vende en su barrio.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Cori Ayllu community bank, which means Familia de Oro ("Family of Gold") in Quechua. She is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children. Felicitas travels to different regional markets where she buys small livestock to fatten and sell. She also buys cheese to sell in her neighborhood. Felicitas needs a loan of 1,500 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her dream is for her children to have professional careers, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia is a 45-year-old woman from La Unión, Cartago, located near the central valley of Costa Rica. She lives with her husband; they have no children together.

Although she did not finish high school, Ligia has managed to open a profitable sewing business and employs six young women (her nieces). She and her nieces make and sell sports clothing, casual clothing, children’s clothing and pajamas. The women work forty-eight hours a week on average.

Ligia started her business with an initial investment of 75,000 colons fourteen years ago. In a good month, her business can earn 2,000,000 colons; in a bad month only 1,200,000.

Ligia’s main client is a store that contracts Ligia’s business to produce clothing, which is then sold in the store. Her main obstacle in life as well as in business is her health. As a diabetic, she has many migraines and these have prevented her from effectively performing the duties of regular jobs. Ligia has created her own business so she can work in an environment that is flexible to her needs as a diabetic woman.

Ligia hopes she will continue to generate enough income from her business so that she won’t have to look for work elsewhere. Her goal is for her business to grow. She intends to use this loan to seek out new clients and to offer a more diverse range of products such as handmade blouses and vests. Her long term goal is to own a clothing store or boutique in order to sell clothes she has designed herself.

With this loan, Ligia will buy the raw materials necessary for her sewing business such as spools of thread, cloth, and sewing machines. The loan will also be used to hire more women to help her increase the output of her business. In this way she is not only providing work for herself and members of her family, but also for members of the community.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her sewing business and to hire more women

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos Eduardo C. M., tiene la edad de 42 años. El Labora como encargado de la limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Cinco hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 10 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Perlines, y mano de obra. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del techo de su casa de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Carlos dijo que los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación y que ahora sus hijos al igual que su esposa están mas seguros.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo C. M. is 42 years old and works as a custodian at Oriental de Managua market. He has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. He is married and has worked with CEPRODEL for 8 years. At this point in time he has invested 10 loans in the improvement of his home, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used to buy construction materials such as iron sheets, beams, and manual labor, which will be used to remodel the roof of his house. This will provide better security and quality of life for his children. Carlos said that the loans given by CEPRODEL have helped him improve his house a lot, and now his children and wife feel safer.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leslie Aime

texts.es:
La Sra. Leslie, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que son independientes.

Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de Mercería. Se inicio con un capital de 
S/. 700.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando mas su negocio, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias, quincenales y mensuales, son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mercería, como: relojes, lámparas, adornos con cerámica, floreros. Es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. 

Manifiesta su más gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Leslie belongs to the community banking group "El Breo," in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department (state) of San Martín. She's single, 28 years old and is the mother of 2 children, who are self-reliant. For 5 years she's worked selling small decorative merchandise. She began with 700 soles and little by little, she's built her business, thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement. She's already very well known by her clients in the neighborhood where she lives, and her daily, bi-monthly and monthly sales are very good. Nowadays she is still in the same business located in her same house in a location that is very well set up to attend to her clients. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy small decorative merchandise like: clocks, lamps, ceramic decorations, and vases. She's a woman who wants very much to get ahead for the well being of her family and for herself. She would like to express her kind thanks to the Manuela Ramos movement for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a woman and for supporting other women who also want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small decorative merchandise.

loans.name: Ruth Evelina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth Evelina O. M. es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el sector Santa Dominguita distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en edad escolar. Cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual es conducido por ella misma. Su esposo en la actualidad está realizando labores de obrero de campo en parcelas de un vecino de la zona en donde vive. No posee endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Son personas muy trabajadoras que han construido parte de su vivienda de material noble. Sus excedentes los han derivado en arreglos de su casa y educación de su hijo. Requieren de un financiamiento para inversión en su negocio ya que pretenden comprar una congeladora para aprovechar la temporada de verano porque tienen mayor demanda de bebidas. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y lograr construir totalmente su vivienda. La Sra. O. y su esposo agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de financiamientos y logar mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth Evelina O. M. lives with her husband and her school aged son in their own house in the Santa Dominguita area, district of Santiago. She runs a grocery store and her husband is doing some contracted agricultural work for a neighbor in the area where they live. They do not have any open loan with any financial institution, they are hard working people who have taken particularly care of their home. They invested their savings in house improvements and in the education of their son. They are now requesting a loan to invest in their business, as they want to buy a refrigerator for the upcoming summer season, when the request of beverages increases. Their dream is to see their business growing and to be able to finalize the construction of their house. Mrs. O. and her husband are very grateful for the support they are receiving with this loan that will allow them to improve the quality of their life.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente  tiene a su cargo dos hijos, estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos  créditos en  mejorar  las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de su vivienda en que habita por lo que antes se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba y el pago de la mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Silvio dijo que con los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una mejor casa.
texts.en:
This client is raising two schoolage children and is married. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for two years. During that time he has invested two loans from CEPRODEL in improving his housing conditions. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of materials for remodeling the roof of the home where he lives and paying the labor costs. It was in very bad condition and in winter the water would leak through. This is to give his children a better quality of life. Silvio says that with the financing given to him by CEPRODEL he has been helped a lot and now has a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVEMENT OF HOUSING AND ENLARGMENT

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y es madre de  05 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Motivada por ella misma emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, bebidas gasificadas y ropas, hace 03 años que se dedica de lleno al negocio  con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 se implemento mucho mas obteniendo buenos resultados desde un inicio, por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores , agua mineral , ropas para damas , caballeros y niños ,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Salvadora , se siente una Mujer fuerte, con ganas de salir adelante , agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Salvadora belongs to the community banking group "El Breo," in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department (state) Departamento of San Martín. She's a live-in partner who is 50 years old. She's the mother of 5 children, all of whom are self-reliant. Self-motiviated, she began a little business selling groceries, soda and clothes. Three years ago she began working full-time at her business with her first loan of 300 soles. She worked hard, and got good results from the start due to the the quality of her products, her reasonable prices and her good attention to the customer. Nowadays she's still working in the same business, located in her own home, where her best clients are the neighbors in her neighborhood. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more products to supply her business like: kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, packages of different flavors of soda, mineral water, women's, men's and children's clothing, supplies for personal hygiene and cleaning the home, candies and other products to keep her customers happy. Salvadora feels that she's a strong woman, with desires to get ahead. She's thankful to the Manual Ramos movement, for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they continue in this manner for a long time, helping many families and entreprenurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Geny

texts.es:
La señora Geny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva 4 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Por su buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas, sus  ventas le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Geny, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Geny is a member of the Commuanl Bank “El Breo”, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children.

Hoping to see her children become professionals who can earn their own income, Geny decided to establish her own business. She has experienced several highs and lows in her life, but the enterprising spirit she is always known for has allowed her to succeed. Geny started selling prepared meals and has been in business now for four years. She sells the food out of her home, which is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. Geny gradually developed a good reputation among neighbors, friends, and relatives who became her customers. Sales have done well because her food is very flavorful.

With this loan of 2500 soles, Geny will buy supplies needed for preparing meals such as sacks of rice and sugar, cases of chickens and eggs, bananas by the bunch, noodles and oil by the dozen, as well as cooking utensils. This will enable her to provide quality service. Geny still feels strongly about continuing her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Roberto Antonio Áreas Larga espada, tiene la edad de 42 años, Labora como vigilante en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene  dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es papa soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en el mejoramiento de su  vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Roberto dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa por lo que ahora sus hijos y el cuenta con mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio Áreas L. is 42. He works as a security guard at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is raising two school age children. He is a single father. For four years he has worked with loans with Ceprodel. During this period of time he has invested three loans in improving his house, thanks to Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials, which he will use to remodel the floor of his house. His objective is to provide better security and better living conditions to his children. Roberto said that thanks to the loans from Ceprodel he has been able to improve his house. Now he and his children have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and expand his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
La Sra. Kathy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”,  Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijos  que aun dependen de ella. 

Kathy, lleva 12 años dedicándose al negocio, motivada por ella misma y buscando alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de helados, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una muy buena acogida y sobretodo, son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los helados, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Kathy, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Kathy belongs to the El Breo Communal Bank, Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of Martín. She lives with a partner, is 31 years old, and has two children that still depend on her.

For 12 years, Kathy has been in business, motivating herself and looking for alternative ways of generating sources of income. Her character as a hardworking and enterprising woman helped her to begin in the sale of ice cream. She tells us that this is selling very well and little by little she has been gaining customers. Currently, she is continuing with the same business and is enjoying a very good reception and, above all, her customers are served with the kindness that characterizes her.

With this loan of 3000 soles she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her products such as kilos of sugar, boxes of milk, and fruits that she needs daily in order to prepare her ice cream. Every day, she plans on having her products in stock in order to achieve a bigger customer base.

Kathy feels great enthusiasm for continuing her business and is persevering day-by-day. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping women like her to develop themselves by providing the means for them to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for the production of ice cream

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos: Yaquelin de 15, Katerin de 11, Arnol de 6, Maricielo de 4 y Alexander de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
La creciente demanda por las llamadas por celular, le han dado a Isabel la oportunidad para ejercer un trabajo con el que se siente cómoda. Ella trabaja todos los días ofreciendo llamadas a celular de forma ambulatoria, su llamativo chaleco verde y la alegría que tiene, han hecho que sea una de las más solicitadas y que su negocio marche muy bien.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y ayudarlos a comunicarse con las personas que desean, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada en espera de clientes, lo cual le es muy cansado y agotador. Para el futuro, anhela tener un local para su centro de llamadas y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Isabel con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también; en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo celular para así poder atender a más gente a la vez.
texts.en:
Isabel, 35, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her five children; Yaquelin is 15, Katerin is 11, Arnol is 6, Maricielo is 4, and Alexander is 2. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. The growing demand for cell phone calls gave Isabel the opportunity to do work she is comfortable with. She works everyday offering cell phone calls as a street vendor. Her eye-catching green vest and the joy that she has have made her one of the most popular, and her business is going very well. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers and helping them communicate with the people to whom they want to talk. She has been doing this for eight years. The most difficult part is having to stand all day waiting for customers, which is very tiring and grueling. In the future she wants to have a location for her call center. That way she would be able to improve her earnings. This is Isabel’s third loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loans, and she expects to do the same now as well. She is much loved in her communal bank because her happiness is contagious to the rest of the members. She will use the 500 PEN she is requesting to buy a new cell phone to be able to take care of more people at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cell phone

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 58 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus dos hijos, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
En su pequeño puesto de periódicos Lucia pasa sus días, ella tiene su puesto en una de las plazas principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde con mucha amabilidad y carisma atiende a todas las personas que asisten a su puesto a informarse y a comprarle un periódico.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuál es el periódico que tiene las mejores noticias, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto. 
Para más adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una bodega.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucia con MFP y espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar su puesto, ya que por el paso del tiempo su infraestructura se esta deteriorando.
texts.en:
Lucia, 58, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in her own house with her two children. What she wants most is to succeed in life. Lucia spends her days in a small newspaper stand. She has her stand in one of the main plazas in the city of Juliaca. With much friendliness and charisma she waits on the people who go to her stand to inform themselves and buy a newspaper. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about which newspaper has the best news. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is having to stay at her stand all day. Later, she hopes to get together enough money to set up a convenience store. This is Lucia’s first loan with MFP. She expects to be punctual with her payments because she does not want to harm the other members of her communal bank. She is much loved and respected in her communal bank. The l,000 PEN she is requesting is to improve her stand because the infrastructure has deteriorated with the passage of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her stand

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 5 hijos: Yony de 18, Hernán de 15, Vilma de 13, Norma de 9 y Roger de 6 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. 
En la mina La Rinconada, a más de 5400 m.s.n.m. se encuentra ubicado el negocio de Nicolasa, su principal actividad es la venta de golosinas, pero también desempeña muchas otras actividades como la venta de triciclos, la cual realiza los días domingos en la feria. 
Asimismo, algunas noches brinda el servicio de transporte en motocarro, actividad que realiza solo esporádicamente por el frío tan intenso que hace en esta zona minera.
Lo que más le gusta a Nicolasa es que con sus actividades puede brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades que necesitan, lleva 3 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la mina. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nicolasa con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 38, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her five children; Yony is 18, Hernán is 15, Vilma is 13, Norma is 9, and Roger is 6. She wants to give them a good post high school education. Nicolasa’s business is located at the La Rinconada mine, which is at more the 5,400 meters above sea level. Her main activity is selling sweets. However, she also does other activities like selling tricycles on Sundays at the fair. Some nights she offers transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). She only does this sporadically because of the intense cold in this mining area. What Nicolasa likes best about her activities is being able to give her children all of the amenities that they need. She has been doing this work for three years. The most difficult part is having to withstand the intense cold in the mine. Later, she hopes to have a grocery store where she could sell more peacefully. This is Nicolasa’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time so she does not hurt the members of her communal bank. She is very respected in her communal bank for the responsibility that she shows. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more sweets to better stock her sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 26 años, es una mujer muy alegre y colaboradora, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Cuando Rebeca dejé su pueblo natal, hace unos 10 años, se propuso trabajar muy duro para tener una vida más digna. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de habas, mana, fideos dulces, etc.; también elabora yogurt natural y aprovecha para venderlo, lo cual le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es conversar con sus clientes y así hacerse más amena la jornada de trabajo. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto en espera de clientes. 
Con el tiempo, espera implementar una tienda de comestibles donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Es el primer préstamo de Rebeca con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar para pagarlo mensualmente. Ella es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fideo y maíz para elaborar los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 26, is a very happy and cooperative woman. She lives in her relatives’ house, and she wants to succeed in life most of all. When Rebeca left her native town ten years ago, she decided to work very hard to have a more decent life. She currently sells beans, marzipan, noodles, and sweets, etc. She also makes natural yogurt and sells it, which has helped her increase her sales. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. That makes the day’s work more amenable. She has been doing this activity for 13 years. The most difficult part is having to stay at her stand all day waiting for customers. In time, she hopes to set up a grocery store where she would be able to give her customers better service. This is Rebeca’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time, and she is prepared to save in order to pay it monthly. She is a happy member of her communal bank, and she is much loved by her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy noodles and corn to make the products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 28 años, siempre ha trabajado muy duro por mejorar su vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo, Elías de 8 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
En la comodidad de su hogar Rebeca pasa sus días tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc. Sus tejidos los vende en el puesto que tiene en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahí son comprados rápidamente, ya que las prendas que elabora son muy coloridas y llamativas. Rebeca tiene gran demanda de sus prendas, por eso trabaja mucho para satisfacerla, ya que sabe que es un muy buen ingreso para su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que teje, pues deber ser muy detallista.
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus tejidos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rebeca con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 28, has always worked very hard to improve her life. She lives in her own house with her small son, eight year old Elías. He is the motivation for all of her efforts. In the comfort of her home, Rebeca spends her days knitting sweaters, scarves, and gloves, etc. She sells what she knits in a stand that she has in one of the most important markets in the city of Juliaca. They are bought rapidly there because the items she makes are very colorful and eye-catching. There is great demand for Rebeca’s items, and she works a lot to satisfy the demand. She knows that it is very good income for her business. What she likes most about her work is knitting, and she does it with great ability. She has been doing this for one year. The most difficult part is making the finishings on the items that she knits; you need to be very detailed. In time, she hopes to have a clothing store where she can sell her knitted items more comfortably. This is Rebeca’s second loan with MFP. She is saving to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She is very happy in her communal bank. She will use the 300 PEN she requested to buy more wool to make new handmade articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida.
En la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Juliaca se encuentra el puesto de anticuchos (brochetas) de Sandra, todas las noches sale con su carrito a vender su delicioso platillo a todas las personas que desean saborearlos en las frías noches juliaqueñas. Ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva por eso siempre convence a sus clientes de comerse más de un solo anticucho.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer hasta altas horas de la noche en la calle, ya que tiene que acabar con todo lo que preparó en el día. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener un local donde pueda vender sus anticuchos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Sandra con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo; en su banco comunal es una de las socias más participativas y responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne para elaborar más anticuchos al día.
texts.en:
Sandra, 26, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her two beloved children. She is prepared to work very hard in order to succeed in life. You can find Sandra’s kebob stand in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Juliaca. Every night she leaves with her cart to sell her delicious dish to everyone who wants to savor them on the cold Juliacan nights. She is a very persuasive seller, and she always convinces her customers to buy more than one kebab. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been doing this activity for four years. The most difficult part is having to stay on the street until late at night because she has to exhaust all that she made for the day. In time, she hopes to have a location where she can sell her kebabs more peacefully. This is Sandra’s first loan with MFP. She is happy to have the opportunity of the loan, and she expects to be able to pay it on time. She participates a lot in her communal bank, and she is a very responsible member. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more meat to make more kebabs each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Edwin de 16, Clemencia de 13 y José de 8 años, a quienes desea dar una buna calidad de vida.
El negocio de venta de ropa de Simona está ubicado en la explanada laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende casacas, y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas de dicho mercado, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en stock y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho muy conocida.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedarán, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto de venta todo el día. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda tener una tienda de ropa, donde pueda a tender a sus clientes con más comodidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Simona con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también; en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más casacas para implementar mejor el stock de su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Simona, 35, is a very sincere and happy woman. She lives in her own house with her three children; Edwin is 16, Clemencia is 13, and José is 8. She wants to give them a good quality of life. Simona’s clothes selling business is located in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (place where markets are held in the city of Juliaca). She sells jackets, and she is one of the most sought after merchants in the market because of the new styles that she has in stock and the accessible prices she offers her customers. These things have made her very well known. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about the styles that fit them best. She has been doing this activity for two years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her sales stand all day. Later, she hopes that her business grows, and that she can have a clothing store where she can wait on her customers more comfortably. This is Simona’s second loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with her payments, and she expects to do the same now. She is very loved by the other members of her communal bank because she is very happy. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more jackets to better stock her sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jackets

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
Sixta, D. 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su puesto D. venta D. ropa está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca). Pero ella no sólo venD. ropa, sino también muñecos D. peluche y casacas, y es muy buena vendedora, puesto que siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprarle más D. un prenda.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir.
Para más adelante, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda D. ropa.

Este es el primer préstamo D. Sixta con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Sixta, 54 years old, is a woman who is very cheerful and hardworking. She lives in her own home and what she most desires is to succeed in life. She has a stall where she sells clothing in the San Jose market (the most important market in the city of Juliaca.) In addition to clothing, she also sells stuffed animals and warm jackets. She is a very good saleswoman, since she can always convince her customers to buy more than one garment. What she likes the most about her work is chatting with the neighboring tradespeople. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years, and what she finds most difficult is having to stay in her stall all day without being able to leave. For the future, she hopes to gather together enough money to establish a clothing store. This is Sixta's first loan with MFP. She knows that she must make the payments on time so as to avoid having problems with the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked. With the 1,000 Pervuvian soles requested she will buy more clothing in order to better stock her clothing stall.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto, de 41 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su negocio está ubicado en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca. Él se dedica a la venta de joyas, y su tienda es una de las más concurridas, ya que los artículos que ofrece son muy bonitos y de muy buen calidad, motivo por el cual poco a poco su negocio está creciendo.
Lo que más le gusta a Sixto de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus joyas, ya que siempre hay personas que quieren robarle. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, para poder vender más joyas.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y participativo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más joyas para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sixto, 41, is a cheerful, hard-working man; he lives with his wife in his own house and what he most wants is to improve his standard of living. His business is in a shopping mall in Juliaca. He sells jewelry and his store is one of the most popular because he offers beautiful, high-quality items; this has led to the growth in his business. What Sixto likes best about his work is chatting with his customers; he has been in this line of work for 3 years. What he considers to be the most difficult part of the job is guarding his jewels because there are always those around who would like to rob him. For later in the future, he expects to enlarge his site so that he can sell more items. This is his first loan with MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a very responsible and participative member of his communal bank. He will use the 1000 new sol loan to buy more jewelry items to better stock his store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel, in Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a retail store. She sells products for daily use, such as shampoo, toothpaste, bath soap, laundry soap, candy, some snack foods, sugar (white and brown), and salt in the local community. Zenaida has had this business for over 3 years, and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month this way.

In 2009, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used as working capital, and to purchase additional inventory. This will be the third loan Zenaida has taken out through GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva, and then edited manually.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Stella Mae

texts.en:
Stella Mae L. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 27 years old. Stella Mae is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Stella Mae owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means of revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling guisadong sotanghon, fried eggplant and other foods in the local community. Stella Mae has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Stella Mae joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the second loan Stella has taken out from GDMPC. Stella Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Stella Mae is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella J. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Annabella is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Annabella owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products such as repacked "ginataang langka" or green jack fruit with coconut milk in the local community. Annabella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Annabella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Annabella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Epripras

texts.en:
Epripras L. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Epripras is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Epripras owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, noodles, coffee, shampoo, candies, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Epripras has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Epripras joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epripras has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Epripras is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Epripras from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely D. J. is currently residing at Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ely owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over seven years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month for these activities.

In 2001, Ely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 14,900 from PMPC. Ely is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the thirteenth loan taken out by her from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura T. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Laura is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Laura has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase breeding livestock. Laura is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell and to purchase feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell and to purchase feed.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie M. is from the village of Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Nerie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nerie owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services (habal-habal) to local community members. Nerie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Nerie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for his business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nerie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene S. is from the village of Ospital Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Eugene is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eugene owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cologne, powder, napkins, facial cleanser, cottons, etc. in the local community. Eugene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eugene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eugene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel is married with two sons and a daughter. His family of five lives in Vodyanoye. Pavel used to have a greenhouse, where he would grow tomatoes, radishes, parsley, etc. He’s had it for nine years. One winter night, heavy snow and strong winds blew it away and ruined its framework. This is why Pavel now needs to reconstruct his greenhouse for the upcoming farming season. 

Pavel has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. He spends 10,000 to 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. Pavel is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to construct a bigger, durable greenhouse to ensure better, richer harvests and additional income as a result. 

Note: In the photo, Pavel is standing in front of his ruined greenhouse.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives with her grown son in Vodyanoye. Valentina owns two big and spacious greenhouses and two smaller ones. She grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this farming business for 12 years. Currently, she has 50,000 grivnyas invested in this venture. She usually spends about 20,000 – 25,000 grivnyas on seeds and plastic film every year.  

Valentina is seeking a 10,000-grivnya loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She is very excited to see her business grow and provide a stable income for her family. Profits generated have helped them make enough savings to purchase a new house. Valentina is hoping to further expand her business and eventually finish all the remodeling in her recently purchased house.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment such as plates, containers etc for the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Maricel Manalang Group

texts.en: Maricel M. is from the village of Antonino, Alicia, Isabela. She is 40 years old. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Maricel is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP every week. In 2007, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Jenneth's Group

texts.en: Jenneth B. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jenneth is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP monthly. In 2008, Jenneth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some bags of hog feed to sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of hog feed to sell

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.en: Benita L. is from the village of Villa C., Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Benita is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Benita is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business selling bananas and vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a week. In 2008, Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring accessories in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Edwin  vive en la calle Caupolican zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive en alquiler junto a su familia. El señor trabaja con movilidad propia en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, linea de colectivos 2; mantiene a su familia con los ingresos que percibe de su movilidad.

El crédito lo destinará al arreglo y mantenimiento de su movilidad.

Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO; el análisis socio-económico le permite acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Edwin lives on Caupolican street, which is in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. He and his family rent their home. He owns a bus which is associated with the Eduardo Avaroa transportation union, bus route #2. He supports his family with the income he earns from his bus. The funding will be used to service his unit. This is his first loan with IMPRO; the results of his socio-economic evaluation qualify him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service his bus.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 69 years old and lives on Talim Island, Binangonan, in the attractive province of Rizal. She is married to Sopronio, a 66-year-old kaing-maker (a kaing is a small bamboo basket) and a supportive husband. She and her husband have eight children. The couple is working hard to raise their big family. 

In 2006, Amalia joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a micro-finance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. Amalia makes and sells kaing products and has been in business for more than fifteen years.

Amalia believes that her proposed loan of Php 25,000 will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loan funds to buy bamboo, bamboo strips and other supplies. She also plans to start a fishing business for additional income.

Amalia dreams of sending her children to school and hopes they will complete a degree in college. She believes her big family needs support from ASHI-Kiva so that they can improve their standard of living and build a beautiful house for her family to live in.

Amelia is a positive and optimistic mother who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. The couple is still dreaming of the best in life and is a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase of bamboo, bamboo strips and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Dionicio Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Dionisio es un hombre muy esforzado, tiene 53 años de edad, y su trabajo es de taxista por el cual lo ha ejercido desde hace veinte años, su esposa vende ropa, zapatos y junto a ella han logrado criar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son mayores  y dos menores, su objetivo es poder seguir mejorando su pequeña vivienda el cual solo mediante el crédito ha podido hacer esta obra , ya que las carreras están bajas debido ala alza de combustible que esta sufriendo el país y por tal razones los clientes no quieren pagar el costo alto, y la opción que toman es la mas barata la ruta, lo cual solo la alimentación y los gastos necesario cubre. Y con esta solicitud de crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un muro a lado para mayor seguridad de propiedad, como la misma seguridad de su familia ya que solo su cerco esta cerrado con pequeños pedazos de zinc viejo el cual espera mejorar pronto y poco a poco ir cerrando todo, así como, hacer un sumidero para mejor higiene. Para poder ofrecer  a sus hijos un techo digno.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 53, is a hard-working man who has worked as a taxi driver for 20 years. His wife sells clothing and shoes and, together, they have managed to raise their four children, two of whom are adults and two are still minors. His goal is to continue to make improvements to his small house which, up to now, he has only been able to do thanks to these loans because the recent hikes in fuel costs in the country have made transportation costs for people much higher. Therefore, passengers tend to forego taxi rides and opt for the less expensive choice, the bus. He is making barely enough to cover basic needs like food. With this loan request he will buy building materials like: stone, sand, cement and iron to build a wall so that his property and his family will be more secure since his current fencing is merely small, old pieces of zinc metal sheeting which he hopes to improve soon and bit by bit close everything off. He would also like to install a sewer drain for better hygiene so that his children can have a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron, to build a wall.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille C. is a 30-year-old mother of an only son, Razzel C.. She is married to Randy, a 37 year-old driver and a construction worker and lives in Talim Island, Rizal Province in the Philippines. Cecille is strong and full of courage to lift her family out of poverty.

Cecille operates a passenger tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) and tends to a business making peanut butter at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to acquire a loan. The businesses are a big help for her family in covering their expenses and in being able to set aside savings for the future.

Cecille is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to fully pay the balance remaining on her tricycle. She hopes that her business will become successful someday.

Cecille also hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her dreams in life: sending her only son to school until he finds a job, expanding her business, and even plans to have fishing business someday. Now, she said, my dreams are almost within reach.

loans.use: To fully pay the balance remaining on her tricycle

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 33 años, es conviviente  y tiene dos hijos: Fernando tiene 5 años y Jhon Andre tiene 5 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en el poblado de Rarcchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Rarcchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
  
Sonia compra verduras, cebollas, maíz y papa del poblado de Rarcchí y después los lleva a la ciudad del Cusco donde los distribuye a las vendedoras del mercado “Virgen Asunta”. Sonia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes. Sonia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más chanchos. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia, 33, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RARCCHI” communal bank. She has two sons: Fernando, 5, and Jhon Andre, 5 months. They live in Rarcchí, which is in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Rarcchí is 45 minutes away from Cusco. Sonia buys vegetables like onions, corn and potatoes in Rarcchí and then takes them to Cusco where she distributes them to merchants in the "Virgen Asunta" market. She also raises small farm animals like chickens, pigs, and guinea-pigs. Sonia is a hard-working, enterprising mother who needs financing to buy more pigs. She has been in this line of work for several years and she has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene  32 años y tiene dos hijos.  
 
Jhon se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco. Jhon nos cuenta que alquilar un taxi cuesta aproximadamente treinta nuevos soles por día. Jhon y Sonia son esposos que tienen un pequeño negocio de crianza de chanchos. Jhon es un padre responsable que apoya en el negocio de su esposa. Jhon requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jhon is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta de Racchi”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 32 years old and has two children.

Jhon provides taxi services in the city of Cusco. He says that it costs him 30 soles per day to rent a taxi. Jhon and his wife Sonia also have a small business raising pigs. He is a responsible father who supports his wife’s business. Jhon is requesting a loan to buy pigs.

Jhon is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for his wife's business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 35 años, es conviviente  y tiene cinco hijos: Alexander tiene 13 años, Maria tiene 10 años, Ana Susana tiene 9 años, Roland tiene 7 años y Sayli tiene 5 años. Ellos viven en el poblado de Rarcchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Rarcchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
  
Susana vende artesanía en el mirador de Rarcchí desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Susana tiene una chacra donde cosecha papa y cebada y también cría animales como vacas, toros chanchos, gallinas y conejos. 
Susana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles y desea comprar artesanía y insecticida. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta de Racchi”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children: Alexander (age 13), Maria (age 10), Ana Susana (age 9), Roland (age 7), and Sayli (age 5). They live in the town of Rarcchí in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. Rarcchí is 45 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Susana sells handicrafts from a location overlooking the town of Rarcchí, where she works from 7am to 5pm. In addition, she has a field where she grows potatoes and barley. She also raises cows, bulls, pigs, chickens, and rabbits.

Susana is a working mother and entrepreneur who is requesting a loan of 500 soles so that she can purchase handicrafts and insecticides. She has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of her hard work.

Susana is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to sell and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Estela Maras

texts.es:
Estela pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA D. RACCHI” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 35 años, es madre soltera    y tiene un hijo llamado José Antonio D.  8 años D. edad. Ellos viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco.
  
Estela se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su  menor hijo y después tiene que atender su restaurante “MARACINITA”. Estela nos cuenta que trabaja desD. las 5 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. 
Susana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más  insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azucar, fideos vegetales y carne. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta D. Racchi”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 35 years old and a single mother with an eight year old son named José Antonio. They live in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Estela wakes up early to perform her household duties, such as preparing breakfast for her son. Afterwards, she manages her restaurant called “Maracinita”. Estela tells us that she works from 5am until 8pm. This working mother and entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, and meat. She has been in business for several years and has done very well because of her hard work.

Estela is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Jerónimo

texts.es:
Jerónimo pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  El vive en el poblado de Rarcchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Rarcchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Jerónimo es agricultor y ganadero. El socio nos cuenta que se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes. El socio vende sus animales en las ferias agropecuarias. Jerónimo y su familia cosechan productos como papas, cebollas, zanahorias y muchas más. El socio requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar y para comprar semillas.        

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jerónimo is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” communal bank. He lives in Rarcchí, which is in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Rarcchí is 45 minutes away from Cusco. Jerónimo is a farmer and cattleman. He tells us that he raises animals like: pigs, chickens and guinea-pigs. He sells the animals at various livestock fairs. Jerónimo and his family also farm products like: potatoes, onions, carrots, and many others. He needs funding to meet household expenses and to buy seed. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and to pay household expenses.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos: Julisssa tiene 12 años, Yelsin tiene 9 años, Boris tiene 7 años y Jerónimo tiene cinco años. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco.
  
Nieves vende productos secos como cebada, trigo y maíz. Nieves nos cuenta que tiene que llevar sus productos a vender, los días viernes al mercado de Urubamba, los días sábados al mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco y los domingos a la ciudad de Calca. 

Nieves es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas, abono y para fumigar sus chacras. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nieves, 42, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children: Julissa, 12, Yelsin, 9, Boris, 7 and Jerónimo, 5. They live in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Nieves sells dry products like: barley, wheat and corn. She tells us that she has to transport her products every Friday to sell in Urubamba's market, on Saturdays to the market in Huancaro in Cusco, and on Sundays to the city of Calca. Nieves is a hard-working, enterprising mother who needs funding to buy more seed, natural fertilizer, and to fumigate her farmlands. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, natural fertilizer and to fumigate her farmlands.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia A. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada.
