Al negocio le esta haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión del negocio, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así tener variedad de inventario. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias, ya que es madre soltera y tiene una hija adolescente bajo su responsabilidad y quiere darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia A. has sold used clothing for over three years now. She lacks enough stock and doesn't have the funds to invest in more varied inventory, thus the need to seek funding. She plans to repay using part of her profits because she is a single mother of a teen-age daughter and she wants to provide her with the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier H. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito, el cual le ayudo adquirí su vivienda sus familia ya tiene un lugar seguro donde vivir. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación para este préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta algunos muebles a su casa, lo que más le interesa es poner los muebles de la cocina, ya que por el momento no cuenta con ellos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja en una compañía de limpieza. Desea que su familia tenga comodidad en su casa. 
La persona que aparece en la foto la señora Lucero Sánchez y su pequeño hijo, familia del señor Francisco. Ya que el día de la visita se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier H. is very grateful for the help he got with his previous loan, which helped him buy his own home; his family now has a safe place to live. He is asking for funding again because his house lacks furniture; what he's most interested in is kitchen furniture since he doesn't have any at present. He intends to repay the loan with earnings from his work for a cleaning company. He wants his family to be comfortable at home. The person in the photo is Lucero Sánchez and their son, Francisco's family; on home visit day he was away at work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Manen

texts.es:
El señor Manaen I. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo colocar el vitropiso en toda la casa. 
Está solicitando nuevamente otro crédito y su cooperación ya que desea poner el piso de concreto y la barda en el patio trasero de la casa. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para comprar el material que necesita para la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que percibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía de trasportes. Ya que su esposa la señora Martha Marlinez se encargara de los gastos de la familia. 
Desea que sus hijos tengan un lugar mas seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Manaen I. is very grateful for the help provided by his previous loan which allowed him to install tile flooring in the entire house. He is asking for new funding because he wants to install a concrete floor and rear walls in his back yard. However, at present, he lacks funds to buy the necessary supplies to do so. He plans to repay using his salary from his work as a security guard at a transportation company since his wife, Martha Marlinez, takes covers household expenses. He hopes that his children will have a safer place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay concrete flooring in the yard and to build rear walls.

loans.name: Miguel Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Roberto G. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior préstamo el cual pudo comprar el equipo de cocer y rentar un lugar donde poner el negocio.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para invertir en telas y material para la elaboración de trajes y de vestidos de noche para damas. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Solicita su cooperación para poder compara la tela que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Roberto G. is grateful for the help obtained through his previous loan, which he used to buy sewing equipment and to rent a place for his business. He is asking for new funding to buy fabric and materials needed to make suits and ladies' evening gowns. However, at present, he lacks funds to do so. He is asking for help to buy fabric that he is being offered at a very good price but he does not want to decapitalize his business to buy it. He plans to repay the loan with part of his profits from his business, which is his family's sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 37años, es casada y tiene dos hijos: Ronal tiene 10 años y  Maribell tiene 5 años. Ellos viven en el poblado de Racchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Racchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Maria vende cereales, hortalizas y tubérculos como papa, cebada, trigo, maíz, tarwi y muchos más productos. Maria nos cuenta sus productos los vende los días viernes y miércoles en el mercado de Urubamba, los días sábados en el mercado de Huancaro del Cusco y los domingos en el mercado de Calca. Maria tiene ganado como por ejemplo 2 toros, 15 chanchos y 30 cuyes que después de alimentarlos y hacer crecer los vende.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Maria es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas de cebada, maíz, papa, cebolla, zanahorias, etc. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María, 37, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” communal bank. She is married and has two children: Ronal, 10 and Maribell, 5. They live in Racchí, Urubamba province, Cusco department; Racchí is 45 minutes away from Cusco. María sells cereals, vegetables, and tubers like: potato, barley, wheat, corn, tarwi (an ancient food crop of the Incas, that has been used for centuries in traditional Andean crop rotations. Tarwi seeds are high in protein, 40%, as much as peas, beans, soybeans and peanuts), among many others. María sells her products in Urubamba's market on Wednesdays and Fridays. On Saturdays she sells in the Huancaro market in Cusco, and on Sundays, in Calca's market. María also raises farm animals for sale. For example, she has 2 bulls, 15 pigs and 30 guinea-pigs. She has been in this line of work for several years now and does quite well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. María is a hard-working, enterprising mother who needs funding to buy barley, corn, potato, onion, carrot seed. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barley, corn, potato, onion, carrot seed.

loans.name: Kadith

texts.es:
La Sra. Kadith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años, 01 hijo que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Kadith, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y confección de vestidos. Y con su primer préstamo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, telas en metros de diferentes colores , utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Kadith, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Kadith belongs to the Las Lameñas Communal Bank, in the Lamas District, Lamas Province, San Martín Department. She is single, 41 years old, and has one child who still studies and depends on her. Kadith is a hard-working woman who feels quite capable of realizing her goals and dreams. For several years, she has dedicated herself to selling groceries and sewing dresses. Since her first loan with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, her business has been helped greatly. It is located in her own house, in an ideal location. Today, she can count on more experience in this type of activity. She is well known and loved among her customers. At present, she has a faithful clientèle who daily make purchases at her store, where everything that a home maker needs is available. And it is Kadith who attends to them personally, with the charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 3,000 New Sols, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, beans in packets, milk and preserved fish in boxes in a variety of brands, cloth of different colors in meters, and cleaning utensils for home and personal hygiene, in order to continue offering her customers better attention. Kadith, as she says lovingly, feels like an accomplished woman today, with a greater desire to continue forward and make her dreams a reality. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her initiate her business as well as those of many other women who wish to grew as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES TO SUSTAIN HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Licialan

texts.es:
La Sra. Licialan, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.   

Licialan, como le dicen de cariño se dedica a la venta de chorizo y cecina, lleva 15 años realizando este tipo de actividad,  su trabajo diario lo realiza por las mañanas en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad y con su carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza, sus clientes vuelven contentos y satisfechos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos, para la preparación de sus cecinas, chorizos y rellenos. Parte del dinero, también lo invertira, para comprar materiales que utiliza en su negocio (cuchillos y balanza, etc), además para tener bien conservados la carne tendrá que comprar un congelador.

Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Licialan belongs to the communal bank "Las Lameñas." which is located in the Lamas province in the San Martín department. She is 49 years old, lives with a partner, and is the mother of 4 children who are all independent. Licialan, as they call her fondly, has been selling sausage and smoked meat for 15 years. She carries out this work daily in the mornings in the central market in her city, and with her characteristic charm and good service her customers come back content and satisfied. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy supplies used in the preparation of her dried smoked meats, sausages and meat fillings. She will use part of the money to buy materials that she needs for her business (knives and a scale), and part to buy a freezer to store her meat. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead; she hopes that they will continue to help enterprising women for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of her smoked dried meats, sausages and other meat products

loans.name: Simith

texts.es:
La Sra. Simith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes.

Simith, lleva  20 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo y que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Simith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Simith, 55, is a member of the “Las Lameñas” communal bank, which is in the Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has two adult children. Simith has been a seamstress for 20 years. Bit by bit she produced her own income and, saving her money to equip her small sewing shop and having the skills to engage in this kind of work, she did not hesitate to do so and, thanks to support from the Manuela Ramos Movement, managed to set it up in her own home in a space adapted to take care of customers. She tells us that her sales are good; she works on order. She is still engaged in this work and she has regular customers that come by her house daily to place their orders. She, herself, takes care of them with the kindness that so characterizes her. With this 3000 sol loan she will buy lengths of various kinds of fabric and tools like scissors, sewing needles (both manual and machine), pins, and buttons. Simith feels very fulfilled with a still stronger desire to succeed and see her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her set up her business as well as helping many other women that want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lengths of various fabrics.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 22 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: Maycol tiene tres años y  Gina tiene dos años. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Nilda trabaja como ambulante y vende choclo con queso en el paradero de carros que se dirigen a la ciudad de Quillabamba. La socia nos cuenta que desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. trabaja. La socia a las siete de la mañana se sienta en una esquina y prende una pequeña cocina y en una olla hace hervir el choclo y después el choclo lo vende cocinado. Ya son 11 años que se dedica a la negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Nilda es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más choclo y queso. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta de Racchi" of the Arariwa Association. She is 22 years old and lives with her common law partner and 2 children. Maycol is 3 years old and Gina is 2. They live in the Urubamba province in the state of Cuzco. Urubamba is an hour and a half from the city of Cuzco. Nilda works as an ambulatory vendor and sells corn with cheese at a bus stop heading towards the city of Quillabamba. She tells us that she works from 7am until 9pm. At 7am she sits down at the corner and lights a small cook top. She boils the sweet corn in a pot and then sells the cooked corn. She has been in this business for 11 years and it has gone very well thanks to her hard work. Nilda is a working mother and entrepreneur who requires a loan to purchase more corn and cheese. She is thankful for the opportunity that this loan provides and is committed to making her scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nilda requires a loan to purchase more corn and cheese.

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es:
La Sra. Zarela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 54 años y es madre de 07 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras como: (papa, yuca, plátano, maíz molido), se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes fijos, que ya conocen del trabajo que realiza. 

Zarela, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su puesto diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará verduras como: racimos de plátanos, sacos de yucas, fréjoles en diferentes variedades, kilos de maíz. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas mercaderas, así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Zarela, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven
texts.en:
Zarela, 54, is a member of the “Las Lameñas” communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and is the mother of 7 adult children. Her desire and will to make her dreams come true motivated her to start her own vegetable sales business. She sells such things as: potato, yucca, banana, ground corn in her district's central market from a well-adapted space where she can care for her regular customers, who are well-aware of the work she does. Zarela has acquired many regular customers to date who come to her stall every day to buy because they find with her all the vegetables that a housewife would need and because she, herself, takes care of them with her characteristic charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy vegetables like: bunches of bananas, sacks of yucca, various varieties of kidney beans, kilograms of corn. She will also use part of the funds to buy shopping bags for her customers. Zarela feels strong still to continue working and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities for development in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
La señora Charito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la fabricación de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse al servicio de carpintería, negocio que lo desarrolla en un local muy bien acondicionado, con el apoyo de su pareja, atendiendo pedidos de sus clientes mas importantes de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Charito, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que le sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres, que como ella quieren salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Charito, 32, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has one dependent son. Wood is an important ingredient in furniture-making and she saw the opportunity to work in carpentry, a skill that she exercises, together with her spouse, in a well-equipped shop where they fulfill orders for their most important customers from the city and the region. She is well-known among her customers for the high quality of the woods she sells and for the good customer service she offers. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy cuartones (a beam sixteen feet long of 3"x3" wood) of woods like: tornillo (a tropical hardwood, also referred to as cedrorana, grows in the Loreton Huanuco provinces of Peru and in the humid terra firma of the Brazilian Amazon region), cedar, mahogany, ishpingo (a tropical wood, ishpingo can be found in the humid tropical forests growing mostly on sandy, deep and well drained soils. It is a member of the high forest vegetation group. Grows to 40 m tall.) among other varieties that are especially valued in making living-room, dining-room, kitchen and office furniture. Charito is a very persevering and enterprising woman, qualities that serve as examples for other women who, like her, want to get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and to meeting her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various kinds of wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Dalia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 01 hijo, ya independiente.

Dalia, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y regalos, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en local alquilado, muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y hoy que le esta yendo muy bien. Cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de regalos, para toda ocasión.

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Dalia, 38, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is single and the mother of one son, who is independent. Dalia is a persevering and capable woman. She sells clothing and gift items in a rented, well-equipped space where she tends to her customers; to date, she has done very well. She has regular customers that know her and her business. Her characteristic strength and perseverance helped her to grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of what she has accomplished. With this 1700 sol loan she will buy more clothing items like, pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, short-sleeve shirts and dresses for girls and adults to stock her store. Part of the funds will be used to buy gift items for all occasions. She feels that she is an established and hard-working woman and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the opportunity it has given her to develop both as a woman and as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and gift items to stock her store.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  El vive en el poblado de Racchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Racchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Toribio tiene 36 años y trabaja como albañil. Actualmente esta trabajando en la construcción del Centro Educativo de Racchí. 
El socio requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar y para su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras de su esposa. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Toribio, 36, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” communal bank. He lives in Racchí, Urubamba province, Cusco department; Racchí is 45 minutes away from Cusco. He works as a bricklayer, currently working on the Racchí Educational Center construction project. He needs funding to meet household expenses and for his wife's small, vegetable sales business. He is grateful for the opportunity offered and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To meet household expenses and for his wife's small, vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito Lamas, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva 35 años en la venta D. uvas, las ganas D. salir adelante y cumplir parte D. sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico D. su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a  su casa y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará insecticidas y vitaminas, abonos, tierras especiales, para mejorar el crecimiento D. sus parrales D. uva, D. esta manera dar un buen sabor y así satisfacer y complacer, el paladar D. sus clientes.

Edith, se siente con muchas ganas D. continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Edith, 55, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in the Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has 5 adult children. She has been a grape merchant for 35 years. Her desire to get ahead in life and fulfill part of her dreams, motivated her to start her own business whose earnings would contribute to meeting household expenses. Today, she has regular customers who come by her house to be taken care of by herself personally with her characteristic charisma. This 2000 sol loan will be used to buy insecticides, vitamins, natural fertilizers, and special soil that will improve the growth of her grape vines so that the grapes will have better flavor and thus be more satisfying to her customers. Edith feels strong to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides, vitamins and natural fertilizers for her grape crop.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 57 años y 04 hijos, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Gladis, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital, así de esta manera decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el que en la actualidad continua, pero ya siendo de ella misma y contando con un local propio muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que día a día van a su local.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea Avon.

Gladis, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Gladis, 57, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is divorced and has 4 children, one of whom is still dependent on her and is a student; he is her pride and joy and the reason to continue working. Gladis is a woman who has surpassed many difficulties that have arisen in her life; she feels happy to have accomplished this. Little by little she was able to set aside some savings and generate her own capital. She decided to use it to set up her own beauty supply sales business. She is still in this line of work but it is her own business now and she has her own, well-equipped locale in which to tend to her customers that visit her daily. This 1000 sol loan will be used to buy stock beauty items like: perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, creams, compact powders, lipsticks, nail polish. In addition, she will continue to establish her own team of Avon representatives. Gladis, with her maturity, is an example for many other women who are starting out in business who, with perseverance, manage to reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business as well as helping other women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos,  que aun dependen de ella.

Luz Elena, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, como: juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes y tiene muy buena acogida, nos cuenta que se inicio por ella misma y con un capital de S/. 200.00. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos en kilos y huevos en javas, aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente muy bien, para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Elena, 49, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has two dependent children. Luz Elena sells snacks like: juanes (grated and boiled yucca mixed with rice and either chicken or beef jerky wrapped in a banana leaf and steamed), little tamales, Chinese-style rice with chicken, in her city's central market. She has a well set-up area were her customers can enjoy her preparations daily. She is well-received. She tells us that she started out investing her own 200 soles. Now, she continues in the same line of work and she tells us that she does very well. With this 2500 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her dishes like: sacks of rice and sugar, kilos of chicken, crates of eggs, cooking oil by the dozen as well as some kitchen utensils to provide better customer service. She feels good to continue selling snacks and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and to reaching her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  El vive en el poblado de Racchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Racchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Antonio tiene 42 años y trabaja como albañil. Actualmente esta trabajando en la construcción del Centro Educativo de Racchí. 
El socio requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar. El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja como albañil y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.   
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonio is a member of the Ascended Virgin of Racchí communal bank (Arariwa Association). He lives in Racchí (Urubamba province, department of Cuzco). Racchí is 45 minutes from Cuzco. Antonio is 42 years old and works as a bricklayer, currently engaged in building the Racchí Educational Center. He needs the loan for family expenses. He is a devoted father who has worked a number of years in masonry. He has done well thanks to his hard work on the job. This association member is grateful for the opportunity offered here, and commits to repaying the loan per the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Family expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Selvith

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Selvith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  ya independiente.

Luz Selvith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva 02 años en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad, le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 200.00 y se inicio con 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Luz Selvith, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Luz Selvith, 26, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has a son, who is independent. Luz Selvith is a woman who has been able to surpass many difficulties in her life; her desire to get ahead in life had good results: she has sold carbonated beverages for two years and, as of today, it is producing well; she is happy to have accomplished this. She has set up a well-equipped area of her house from which to take care of her customers with her characteristic kindness and charisma. She runs her own business; she has no boss or set schedule. She tells us that she began with a 200 sol investment in 5 cases of soft-drinks. As she did well, she invested a bit more each time. Now, with this 1700 sol loan she will buy more beverages like: cases of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands, as well as still and sparkling mineral water. Luz Selvith is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help; she is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito Lamas, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva 25 años en la venta D. plantas, las ganas D. salir adelante y cumplir parte D. sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico D. su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a  su casa a comprar sus plantas y es ella quien, personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, comprará plantas como: Llama plata, rosas, los dólares, las begonias, girasoles, Adán y Eva y palmeras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. insecticidas y vitaminas, abonos, tierras especiales, para mejorar el crecimiento D. sus plantas. 

Otilia, se siente con muchas ganas D. continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Otilia, 55, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are independent. She has sold plants for 25 years. Her desire to get ahead in life and fulfill part of her dreams motivated her to start her own business whose profits would contribute to meeting household expenses. Today, she has regular customers who come by her house to buy plants from her; it is she, herself, who tends to the customer with her characteristic charisma. With this 1200 sol loan she will buy plants like: Llama plata (a popular ornamental plant; they're good luck plants believed to 'call the money'), roses, begonias, sun flowers, palm trees, among others. Part of the money will be used to buy insecticides, vitamins, natural fertilizers, special soils to improve her plant growth. Otilia has a lot of push to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plants and flowers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.es:
La Sra. Edna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Unión”,  Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 53 años y es madre de 03 hijos; todos independientes.

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva 02 años en este negocio y empezó vendiendo huevos y galletas, poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Edna, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Edna, 53, is a member of the “La Unión” communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is divorced and has three children, all of whom are independent. She has always been noted for her fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead motivated her to open her own grocery store. She has had it for two years; she began selling eggs and cookies. Little by little she gained more experience and became better known and well-liked among her customers. Currently, she has regular customers that visit her store daily to buy everything a housewife might need. She, herself, tends to her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this 800 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, cases of milk and preserved fish in a variety of brands, house cleaning products and personal hygiene items to continue providing the best customer service. Edna is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her meet her goals and making her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre de 04 hijos, ya independientes.

Modesta, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y gelatinas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 150.00 y empezó comprando 04 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Modesta, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Modesta, 64, is a member of the "Mi Sueño" communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is married and has 4 independent children. Modesta is a hard-working, tenacious woman, who decided to set up her own soft-drink and gelatin snacks business from an area in her house specially set aside for this purpose. She runs her own business without a boss or a set schedule. She tells us that she began with 150 soles that was enough for 4 cases of soft-drinks to see how she'd do. As she saw that she did well and that she needed more stock, she invested a little more. Currently, she continues in this line of work and she's known to her customers, who are her neighbors, family members and acquaintances. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy more stock beverages like: soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes, and brands as well as still and sparkling mineral water. Modesta has many goals still to reach and she is very motivated to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help; she is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Adela, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace 10 años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, siempre contando con el apoyo de su esposo. Y con su primer préstamo que Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Adela, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to the Sarita Colonia Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 54, married, and has three children. One is still in school and dependent upon her. Adela is a hard-working woman who feels capable of reaching her goals and dreams. For ten years she has been selling groceries. She has always had her husband’s support. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos she was better able to set up her business . The business is in a very well equipped area of her house, where she waits on her customers. She now has a lot of experience with this type of work. She is very well known and much loved by her customers. She currently has loyal customers who go to her store daily, and they find everything a housewife needs. She personally waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, boxes of milk and preserved fish of various brands, home cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene items in order to offer better customer service. Adela feels herself to be a fulfilled woman, and she has a great desire to keep going forward to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping other women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her business

loans.name: Juana Dominga

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene un hijo llamado Jhon William, tiene 23 años y es docente. Juana vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Juana se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos cuenta que manda verduras ínter diario a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a su clienta Olimpia. Ya son cuatro años que vende verduras y le esta yendo muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su negocio. 
La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer trabajar la chacra donde siembra las semillas de las verduras de lechuga, asnapa, flor amarilla, choclo y muchas verduras más. Juana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia y el préstamo de 2500 soles es una buena ayuda para seguir haciendo trabajar la chacra. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Palccaraqui”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 45 years old, married, and has a son named Jhon William. He is 23 years old and works as a teacher. Juana lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is 1½ hours away from the city of Cusco.

Juana sells vegetables. Her vegetables are shipped daily to the city of Puerto Maldonado by Olimpia, one of her customers. Juana has been selling vegetables for four years and has done very well as a result of her hard work.

She needs a loan so that she can begin planting crops on her farm. Juana will acquire seeds for growing lettuce, snap peas, sunflowers, corn, and other vegetables. She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who wants her family to get ahead. This loan of 2500 soles will allow the work on her farm to continue.

Juan is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
La señora Gladiz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03, que aún depende de ella.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 250.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará aves de corral como gallinas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Gladiz, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladiz belongs to the Sarita Colonia Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 42, in a common law marriage, and has three dependent children. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and energy and the necessity to get her children ahead, she decided to start her own business selling live hens. With 250 PEN in capital she started selling little by little. She was making herself more known by her customers, who now know the work she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy poultry like hens. She will use part of the money to buy balanced food and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free from illness. Gladiz feels very satisfied with the work she does. In spite of it being hard work and having to get up early, she believes it is worth the sacrifice to make her dreams come true and to reach the goals she has designed for her life. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry like hens

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Juliana, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado “Pomarosa”, nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

Juliana, poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio.
Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el tipo de actividad que realiza. En su negocio, sus clientes encuentra lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con amabilidad y regalando siempre una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Juliana, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse mejor como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Juliana belongs to the Sarita Colonia Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has two dependent children. Juliana is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She feels capable of getting ahead and working with great desire to have her children become professionals. She is very happy with the work she does. She sells fruit in the Pomarosa Market. She tells us that her sales are going very well because she is well known by her customers. Juliana was saving, little by little, in order to set up her own business. She currently continues with the same business, and she is happy with this type of work. In her business her customers can find what they need to make salads and juices. She personally waits on them with kindness, and she always rewards them with a smile. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy sacks of oranges, tangerines, lemons, citrons, taperebás (a native fruit of the Amazon region), and other varieties of fruits from the region and different parts of the country so that she can provide better service to her customers and give them what they need. Juliana says that she has been able to complete some of the goals she set for herself. Thanks to the help of Manuela Ramos, she was able to start her business and develop personally as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit to stock her business

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora María Yolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

María Yolanda, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Comidas y lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada cerca del paradero “Huallaga Central”- Juanjui, y cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
. María Yolanda, 40, is a member of the "Sarita Colonia" communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín province. She is separated and the mother of two dependent children. María Yolanda sells prepared meals; she has done this for several years now. She is located near the "Huallaga Central" - Juanjui bus stop and she has a well-set-up location from which to care for her customers and guests. She tells us that her daily sales are good because she prepares tasty dishes; she is well-known and well-received. Currently, she continues in the same line of work and she is very happy with the daily work she does. It is she, herself, who tends to her customers with her characteristic good humor. With this 800 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her dishes like: kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chickens, vegetables and some utensils to provide better customer service. She feels full of life and wants to continue forging ahead; she has many dreams and goals still to reach such as setting up her own, very well-stocked, grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 28 años, es conviviente y tiene cinco hijos: Josmel tiene 9 años, Alexander tiene 7 años, Maria Fernanda tiene 4 años, Maria Cristina tiene 4 años (son gemelas) y Aderly tiene 2 años. Zenaida vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Zenaida se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y llevar al colegio a sus hijos y después prepara comida para los asistentes del taller de capacitación de artesanos. La socia nos cuenta que este taller se realiza en las ciudades de Pisaq o chicheros inter diario entonces tiene que llevar la comida a esos lugares. La socia los días viernes lleva ganado a la ciudad de incalpata donde vende ovejas a 100 soles. La ciudad de incalpata esta a 2 horas de la ciudad de Urubamba.  

Zenaida requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como arroz, carnes y verduras para preparar mas platos de comida. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Communal Bank “Palccaraqui”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children: Josmel (age 9), Alexander (age 7), Maria Fernanda and Maria Cristina (4 year old twins), and Aderly (age 2). Zenaida lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is 1½ hours away from the city of Cusco.

Zenaida wakes up early to perform her household chores, such as preparing breakfast, before taking her children to school. Afterwards, she prepares food for those attending an artisan training workshop. She says that this workshop is conducted in the cities of Pisaq and Chineros every day, so she must deliver food to these places. Every Friday, sells sheep in the city of Incalpata where she earns 100 soles per head. The city of Incalpata is two hours away from the city of Urubamba.

Zenaida is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, meat, and vegetables for preparing her dishes. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam, son of J. K., is an educated man with a great deal of experience. He has a retail shop where he works, and he has been in the business for a long time and has many regular customers. 

When he got his first cycle loan to complete his stock, Rustam's business was small.  He continued his business with more success, and he is still working. 

Now Rustam has requested a second-cycle loan of 40,000 AFN to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in this business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, especially for the son who works with him. He is sure that he can further his business with even greater success.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Oftab Faroozan Group

texts.en:
This is Oftab Faroozan group.Faroozan is the leader of oftab faroozan group and married with 2 childern.One son and on daughter.They are students at school. She is a hard working woman who always supports her husband and childern. She wants to receive a loan for the business of carpet weaving.She has experience in this business for more than 10 years.The beaustiful carpets that she weaves is quite popular in her area and she sells them with high price. By this loan she would like to buy a new carpet frame for her work. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to send her childern in better private schools. 
She would like to extend her gratitude to all Kiva lenders who really support people around the world.

loans.use: purchasing a new carpet frame

loans.name: Rangeen Kaman Group

texts.en:
Rangeen Kaman group is made up of six members.Akram is the leader of the group. He is 35, married with three childern.Two of his childern are students and the other is three years old.Akram has got a shop in which he sells parts of motorcycle such as, tires whell caps and so on,besides, he repairs them as well. He is a hard working man and all the family members benefit through the income he generates. By the loan he receives he would like to purchase necessary tools for his shop.He would like to expand his business to incease his income because he knows that nowadays the cost of commodities, paricularly wheat and other ingredients for making bread and pastries is climbing up considerably.Also, he hopes to give his childern good education.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is an effecitve process which can support all entreprenurs
to go a head and progerss their businesses.

loans.use: buying tools and parts of motorcycle

loans.name: Badar

texts.en:
Badar is the son of M. G.. He is a married man with six children, and he lives in district 1 of Kabul in Afghanistan. His children are students and go to school. 

Badar requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN for his general store business. He wants to expand and develop his business in order to provide for his family.  

He is very happy with this loan in Afghanistan that can help him support his family and his business. He would like to thank the Kiva process.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette D. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Janette is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janette owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling poultry meat in the market. Janette is just starting this business.

In 2009, Janette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Janette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to broaden her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to broaden her product offering

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad K. is 54 years old and the father of three daughters and four sons. He owns and runs a supermarket in Ramallah as a source of living. Two of his sons who work with him at the supermarket are married and responsible for their own families.

Mohammad's wife and sons work with him to help and support the three families. Therefore, he applied for his first loan from FATEN to expand the business and buy more goods which will, he hopes, increase the families' income and improve their situation.

Mohammad and his son Tamer appear in the photo.

loans.use: To make store improvements and to buy more goods

loans.name: Annagi

texts.en:
Annagi J. is 22 but he has kept his business since he was 18. He rents a place where he sells building and repair materials. He is continuing the business of his father. Annagi started to help his father when he was 16 and since that time, he gained enough experience to run this business alone now. 

Annagi requested 1,600 Azerbaijani New Manat  to increase the number of items he sells. Annagi's dream is to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz K. is 28 years old young and a very enthusiastic man. He has owned a plastic door manufacturing company for the last four years. He likes his job very much. That’s why he is very friendly and polite with every single client, He says that to be a successful entrepreneur you have to be excellent at your job. He is busy every single minute and works from early morning until late night. Bahruz applied for 1600 AZN to improve his working conditions and purchase more materials.

loans.use: To improve working conditions and purchase materials

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif A. is a 22-year-old man who breeds poultry in the small village of Imishli.  He has four years of experience in this business. He works in the local factory. When he was starting his poultry breeding it was an additional source of income but over the years it became his principal income. Asif sells geese to the local restaurant owners and sometimes to the local people.  Asif lives with his parents and tries his best to work and save money for his future wedding. Asif requested 1600 AZN in case to build a place to keep his poultry safe and warm and to buy more geese.

loans.use: To build a place to keep his poultry and to buy more geese

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en:
KH. H. is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband is pictured here in the photo.

H. is employed in a local garment factory in the town, and she is able to earn an income of USD 2.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been working there since 2005. Her husband sells shoes in the city, earning an income of USD 6.60 per day.

H. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, H. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase equipment to produce shoes for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy equipment to produce shoes

loans.name: Bih

texts.en: Bih P., 60, is a widow who lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She has been a rice farmer since 1979 and is able to make about US$2 each day. She is also aided by two of her children who are garment workers. Bih P. told a loan officer that she typically spends around US$50 on food monthly, US$8 on utility and US$15 on other expenses. To make more money to improve her standard of living, she is asking for a loan to make a new investment. She would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to build a stand and sell fruit at the local market.

loans.use: To build a stand to sell fruit.

loans.name: En

texts.en: En R., 42, is married and lives with his three children in Dangkao, Cambodia. R. is a skillful blacksmith in his village. He is able to earn an income of USD $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. He has been engaged in this business since 2000. His wife (pictured here) works at home to prepare fabrics with her children, earning an income of USD $1 per day. R. and his wife try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting a loan of US $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to buy metal to make roofs for his customers. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy metal to make roofs

loans.name: Chi Vorn

texts.en: Mr. Chi Vorn S. lives in Ampil Rieng village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chea Lin Na, are grocers in the local market. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it so Mr. Chi Vorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell. Mr. Chi Vorn S. is a father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries to re-sell.

loans.name: Samreth

texts.en:
Samreth N. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in Takeo province. Three of her children are in school.

To earn a living, Samreth N. has raised pigs and has also sold chicken manure to local farmers since 2001. On average, she is able to make about US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a businessman providing services trucking dirt to refill the land of clients’ houses. He typically makes about US$3 each day.

Samreth N. is asking for a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her chicken manure business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her chicken manure business

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon Y. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in different businesses while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Phon Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Y. Yoeurn, makes big pots. He is shown on her left in the photo.

Although they try to work hard the couple still earns less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Phon Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport salt to sell door to door.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport salt to sell door to door

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong M., 37, is a widow and lives with her two school-aged children in Dangkao, Cambodia.

M. is involved in the business of selling groceries and she is able to earn an income of US$10 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has engaged in this business since 2007.

M. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, M. is requesting for a loan of US$1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Mr. Rotha O. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is the father of two children: one is enrolled in the local public school while the other is too young to go to school or to work.

Mr. Rotha O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Sreylak Chhen, is a worker in a garment factory. She is on the right in the photo.

However the couple tries to work hard they still earn less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Rotha O. decided to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike to commute to the garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to the garment factory

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou I., 60, is a widow who lives with one of her children in Takeo province. She sells silk scarves at the local market and is able to make about US$2 of profit every day. She is aided by her son who is a motor-taxi driver.

Nou I. is asking for a loan of US$400 to increase her stock of scarves.

loans.use: To increase her stock of scarves

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun M., who lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province, is 43 years old. She is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in the local public school.

Mrs. Aun M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Khiev, sells salt. He is shown on the right of the photo.

This family tries to work hard with their businesses but they earn less income because they do not have enough money to support their businesses. Thus, Mrs. Aun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy salt to sell door to door.

loans.use: To buy salt to sell door to door

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk S., 54, is married and lives with her two children in Dangkao, Cambodia.

S. is involved in the business of selling groceries at her home in the village and she is able to earn an income of US$3.75 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2004. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of US$5 per day.

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Nop C., 56, and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $1 each day. They live with two of their children in Takeo province. Besides farming, her husband also sells natural medicine. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nop C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mrs. Nhor M., who is 43 years old, lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Touch Chan, is a duck breeder. This family has a problem because many of their ducks died and they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Nhor M. decided to ask for a loan to buy additional ducks. She is a mother of two children, one of whom farms to help his parents while the other one is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy additional ducks

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor B.'s main source of income comes from selling household products like soap, toilet cleaner and more in her community. She is 25 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Flor has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vang

texts.en: Mr. Vang S. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to breed. His wife, Mrs. Nim Nak, helps him with the duck breeding. Mr. Vang S. is a father of five children, two of whom help their parents with the duck breeding while the others are attending the local school. His wife is on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Bein

texts.en: Bein C. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo province. She is a silk scarf weaver who is able to make about US$3.50 of profit a day. In one day, she is able to weave about five to ten scarves. Her husband stays at home and helps her to weave scarves, too. Three of the children are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Bein C. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase silk and materials so that she can make more scarves to sell at the market every day. (Bein C. is pictured with her husband and one of her daughters.)

loans.use: To buy materials to make silk scarves for sale

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pot N. is a skillful tailor in her city. She is married and lives with her only child in Dangkao, Cambodia. She is able to earn US $3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has had this business since 2006. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning US $5 per day. 

N. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. N. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more metal for her husband to expand his business as a blacksmith. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more metal to expand a blacksmith business

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Orm P., 68, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a rice farmer who works for less than US $1 a day, while her husband is a village chief with a US $60 monthly salary. This couple has one married daughter who lives with them. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and makes US $3 a day. 

Orm P. would like to take out a loan of US $600 for her son-in-law. He needs to purchase a motorbike to operate a moto-taxi. 

Orm P. is in the photo between her daughter and her son-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Koem Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Seng P. is a villager in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Khun Sophal, is a primary school director in the local village. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Koem Seng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows to start a new breeding business. Mrs. Koem Seng P. is a mother of two children who attend the local school.
