loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
T. Marusya is a 50-year-old single mother of one teenage son. She lives in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. Her son is a student at a university, and Marusya operates a dairy retail business in her local market. 

She began her business in 1999 with a working capital of 100,000 MNT and in the eleven years of being in business, she has managed to increase her working capital to 3,100,000 MNT. She plans to continue to grow her business so that she can help her son in the future as he gets married and eventually starts his own family. 

Marusya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large variety of wholesale dairy products which she can sell from her stand for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Munkhorgil

texts.en:
Munkhorgil used to live in Erdenet city, but moved to Ulaanbaatar city five years ago to find work as a driver. He lives with his wife and grandmother. He bought a highly insulated Ger blanket to survive and stay warm in the harsh Mongolian winters, while at the same time saving money on fuel. He said of the product, “Personally, I really appreciate the energy efficient Ger covering for helping to decrease the air pollution – even if it is just by a small amount.”  

Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Baldorj

texts.en:
D. Baldorj is 31 year old and lives with his wife and five children in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. The family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
Baldorj and his wife run a retail dairy business from a stand at the local market. Baldorj began his business in 2006 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. In operating his business, he purchases dairy products in the Ugiinuur soum and sells them both in the province center and in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Due to his dependable suppliers and good business sense, today his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Baldorj would like to save money for the future to ensure that his family has security and that he and his wife can continue to pay their children's education fees. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large variety of dairy products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of dairy products

loans.name: Sallie

texts.en: Sallie is a 27-year-old woman from Agusan Del Sur. She is married to Wilfredo and they have two children, the eldest of whom is only nine years old. Sallie invested in rice farming in 2000 and is thankful for the income she generates from her farm. She hopes to double her harvest in order to earn a better income for her family. Sallie has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner CEVI to assist her financially. She will use this loan to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla Y. is from the village of Polo. She is 48 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling nipa hut products to local community members. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2006, Rosevilla joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase farm supplies and materials to manufacture nipa hut products. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture nipa hut products. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC, and this is the second time she is being published in Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to manufacture nipa hut products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has been married to her husband, Isabelo, for nine years. She is 32 years old and has three children. Her oldest is now age 14. She is involved in rice farming. She works hard to meet her family’s needs. 

In her years of farming, she says that she and her husband have experienced difficulties, especially during times when they lacked financially. Even so, she has done her best to make the farm productive. She also joined CEVI to gain access to its financial service. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use this loan to fund her farm. She will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela was a little disappointed with her last harvest. She said that it was due to the weather that she was not able to achieve the harvest she aimed for. A 27-year-old married woman with three children, she works hard to ensure her farm will be productive at the next harvest.

Estela applied for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Giving up is not an option for 41-year-old Evangeline. A rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur, she works hard despite the many challenges she experiences in farming. She wants to double her harvest so she will be able to pay her obligations and still have income for herself.

Evangeline joined CEVI and applied for a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to fund her farm. She will buy certified seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Climate plays a big role in a farmer’s life. In Vilma’s experience, her last harvest was not that good because of the weather. A 37-year-old married woman, she is determined to give her best again to achieve an abundant harvest. Her six children are what motivate her to work hard.

Vilma also sought the help of CEVI, a micro-finance institution in the Philippines, to support her business financially. She applied for a loan of Php 8,000. This loan will go far in buying seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is a 30-year-old rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is now preparing her land for planting and needs seeds, fertilizers and farm inputs to be able to have an abundant harvest. According to her, she really needs to earn because her children are going to school.

Baby Jane applied for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to fund her farm: she will be able to purchase the necessary inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza N., 30, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Richienel N. and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Together they have been selling electronic gadgets for ten years.

Eliza has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed solely to buy assorted electronic gadgets.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 17,400 per month.

Now, with your help, Eliza would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more electronic gadgets and appliances.

Eliza dreams that her business will continue to grow so that her family will have better living conditions in the future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more electronic gadgets for her business

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo L. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. He is 48 years old, is married, and has three adult children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Twegatte Association, Jinja Group

texts.en:
I. Paul is 28 years old and the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with three children aged 6, 4, and 2 years and he helps to care for his sister who is in school.

Paul is a businessman dealing in the sale of clothes, maize, beans and coffee from Namulesa; for eight years he has been dealing in all these businesses. The main challenge that he faces, especially with his clothes business, is that some customers take the goods on credit and fail to pay, hence having a bad effect on his cash flow.

On average, Paul makes 90,000/= as weekly profits and one of his strong points is that he is a hardworking man with a strong drive to invest more in his businesses. He needs a loan to help him restock all his businesses with more goods and produce.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce to sell and more new clothes for his shop

Eduviges owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Eduviges joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
60-year-old Dometila is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has two children. Her business provides income for her family and that’s why she gives her best to make her rice farm productive.

Dometila is now preparing her land for planting. She will need seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs for her farm. She applied for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to acquire the farm inputs she needs. Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Dometila and her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been married to Salvador for twenty-two years already and she is the mother of five children. Their oldest child is now nineteen years old.

Lorna is into rice farming which is one of the major livelihoods in her province. She said that the income she generates from the farm is truly a big help to her family’s finances. She applied to loan Php 8,000 from CEVI which she will use to fund her farm. With this loan, she will be able to buy farm inputs like seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia M. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Fernando B., a machine operator, and they are blessed with eight children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for several years now.

Teresa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy grocery items as added stock for her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 27,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Teresa would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying grocery items like condiments, canned goods, soft drinks and charcoal.

Teresa dreams that her store will continue to expand and become a grocery someday. She also prays that God will continue to help them surpass the different challenges in life.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en: Gerel is a nurse and a native citizen of Ulaanbaatar city. She and her 25-year-old daughter live in separate yurts on the same plot of land.  She heard about the benefit of an energy efficient stove from her co-worker and wanted to try it for herself. It’s been about eight days since she started using the stove. “I noticed that the Eco stove really keeps warm longer than the regular one. When we get up in the early morning, it’s warmer than before,” she said. As a native citizen of Ulaanbaatar, she is also worried about the dramatic increase of air pollution, and has recommended Eco products to her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: an energy efficient heating stove

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie D., 27, is making sure that his family has enough supplies for their daily needs. He is married to Marie D., and they live in Caloocan, Metro Manila. Both of them have been managing their variety store business for six years. 

Jessie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he has been able to borrow four times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he uses the money he borrows to buy assorted grocery items and beverages as added stock for his store. 

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for his expanding business to buy more grocery items and beverages for his store.

He dreams that his variety store will someday become a grocery so that he will have an improved quality of life with his family. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and beverages for his store.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita T. is from the village of Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Paquita is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Paquita owns and operates a business selling specialty food products from a small food stall/mini carenderia (restaurant) in the local community. Paquita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $136 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Paquita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Paquita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Paquita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling biscuits,sugar,salt,shampoo, coffee,milo, soap(laundry and bath) and candies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Namizzi Central Farmer's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
G. Peter is 30 years old and married with six children aged 12 to 2 years. He also takes care of his mother.

Peter is a businessman dealing in the sale of molasses that is used to distill alcohol. He says that his business is good except for the scarcity of limited raw materials hence making them expensive.

Peter has been in business for four years and he is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week and this is also mainly attributed to his good customer care and the high quality of his raw materials.

Peter’s business goal is to be able to buy more sugarcane for his business as well as educating his children for a brighter future. He needs a loan to be able to increase his business capital to buy more molasses.

loans.use: To buy more molasses to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina A. is from the village of Bandera. She is 59 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Agustina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP. In 2006, Agustina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to cover the cost of farm cultivation and to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Agustina is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her daily expenses and to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

texts.fr: Khady CLOY est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants, Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis neuf ans et a eu à y bénéficier de dix huit prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. loans.name: Zivamuntuuyo Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Rose Nabiryo is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 39 years old and married with six children. She has had a tailoring business as well as a clothes-selling business in Wairaka, Jinja, for 10 years. From her transactions, she is able to make about 100,000 Ugandan shillings in profits every week. These help her in expanding and recapitalizing her business as well as in taking care of her family. 

Rose knows how to handle her customers and this has kept them coming to her business. Rose hopes to expand her business by having more clothes for resale as well as ensuring that more customers give her tailoring jobs. Rose is such a hardworking lady. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials and to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying more tailoring materials and clothes for resale

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Koné est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni ((troisième région administrative du Mali)
Après l’école coranique  qu’il  fréquenta pendant des années, il  tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus mais cela sans réussite. Il décida alors d’apprendre auprès de son père l’achat et la vente  de céréales. Avec une experience de 5 années, il maîttise  cette activité.
Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, il décide, après avoir correctement remboursé ses trois premiers prêts, de prendre un  quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des tonnes de céréales. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants. La vente  de ses articles se fait dans le grand marché de Torakabougou et une partie est vendue dans les différents villages le jour de foire.
Monsieur Adama Koné envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Koné is 30 years old, married and father of three children. He lives - along with his wife and children - at his father’s home in the Torakabougou area of the town of Bougouni (in Mali’s third administrative region). After attending a coranic school for several years, he tried his hand at several revenue-generating activities - in particular shoe wear and fabric sales - but without success. He then decided to learn from his father the business of buying and selling cereals. After five years experience, he now masters this activity. To increase his business he decided, after correctly reimbursing his three previous loans, to request a fourth loan from Soro Yiriwaso to buy tons of cereal. His supplies come from Bougouni and villages in the vicinity. He sells his products at the great market in Torakabougou, and also on market day in the villages. Mr. Adama Koné expects his monthly earnings to reach 70,000 F CFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Dembélé est un homme marié de 33 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers qu’il appris auprès de son oncle.  Avec une expérience de 4 ans, il maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité.
 Pour le renforcement de ses activités, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte acheter, une grande quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à une clientèlle composée de la toute la population locale.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 62 500 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Dembélé is 33 years old, married and father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in the North Hérémakono area of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Without formal education, he quickly began commercial activities, in particular selling various products in a shop, trade learned from his uncle. After four years of experience, he masters rather well this activity and is in high demand. To reinforce his business, he decided to cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where is is now requesting a second loan. The first loan was correctly reimbursed. With this second loan he intends to buy a large quantity of various products for his shop. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sells to the local population customer base. With this loan, he expects his monthly earnings to reach 62,500 FCFA, and with the benefits, he is considering buying a house.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products for the shop

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Madame Adiara Samaké est une femme mariée de 38 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit avec son époux, ses enfants et ses coépouses dans une famille polygame au  quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni, région de Sikasso République du Mali. 
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, elle abandonne les études et décida ainsi de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des habits, des pagnes, des chaussures. Elle a appris cette activité auprès  d’une de ses parentes. Avec une expérience de 8 ans elle maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce consistant Madame Adiara Samaké décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 12  prêts solidaires, elle est passée au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, des pièces de pagnes wax et autres tisuus. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossites. La vente de ses articles  se fait au marché de Bougouni et dans son quartier de résidance. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA. Avec se bénéfice elle compte payer les intérêts du prêt et  agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiara Samaké is a married 38 year old lady and mother to 5 children. She lives with her husband, children and her co-wives in a polygamous family in the Faraba quarter of the town of Bougouni in the Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali. As her parents were poor, she left school and decided to work to earn money, notably by buying and selling clothes, lengths of material and shoes. She learned this trade from one of her female relatives. With 8 years' experience, she is a master of her trade. Mrs. Adiara Samaké decided to work with a local group loan association in order to obtain a consistent working capital. After 12 group loans she has progressed to an individual loan. All of the previous loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan she plans to buy pieces of waxed material and other fabrics. She buys her goods in Bamako at the wholesalers and sells them at the Bougouni market and in her local area. Her customers are mainly women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA. With this she plans on paying the interest due on the loan and growing her business.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes, fabric and shoes to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père, dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougouni, dans le quartier Dougounina (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Après  13 ans de fabrication et de vente de marmites, sans succès, il opta  finalement d’entreprendre depuis maintenant 8 ans les activités d’ achat et de vente des appareils electroniques. Il a commencé l’apprentissage cette activité auprès de son ami.  De nos jours qu’il maîtrise bien ce domaine dans lequel il est très sollicité et apprécié à Bougouni.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client, il décida,  afin d’agrandir son entreprise de collaborer avec l’institution pour acheter des appareils electroniques. 
Il est à première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                                                                                                    Il s’aprovisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). La vente de ses articles se fait au marché de Bougouni et une partie dans les marchés hebdomadaires des  villages environnants.
Monsieur Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les échéances du prêts et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr.Adama D. is 36 years old, married and father of three children. He lives - together with his wife and children – in a traditional extended family at his father’s home, in the Dougounina area of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). As he did not benefit from modern education, he began revenue-generating activities from a very early age. After 13 years of unsuccessful buying and selling of cooking pots, he eventually decided over the past eight years to buy and sell electronic products. He learned the business as an apprentice with a friend. Now that he has sufficiently mastered this activity, he is in high demand and well appreciated in Bougouni. He became acquainted with Soro Yiriwaso through one of his customers, decided to cooperate with the institution, and buy more electronic equipment to increase the size of his business. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies from Bougouni and Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells his products in the Bougouni market and in the weekly markets of nearby villages. Mr. Adama D. hopes to reach monthly earnings of 32,000 FCFA, which will be used to reimburse his loan and take care of his family’s needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Lassana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassana C. est âgé de 42 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant chez son père dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, il commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des produits de beauté, de fêtes etc. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de 17 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité. 
Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Pour renforcer son commerce, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  pour acheter une grande quantité de mèches, crèmes, pommades, déodorants et parfums.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de Bougouni.
Les périodes propices de ses ventes sont surtout les fêtes réligeuses et les fêtes de fin d’années. Sa clientèle est composée surtout de femmes.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52 5 00 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt, et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassana C. is 42 years old and is father to one child. He lives with his wife and child at his father's house in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni (the third largest region in Mali). As he didn't go to modern school, he began earning money very early, notably through buying and selling beauty and party products etc. He learned this business from a friend and with 17 years' experience, he is good at his job and is very sought after. This is his first time working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. In order to strengthen his business he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme so that he could buy large quantities of highlights, creams, pommades, deodorants and perfumes. He buys his goods in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers and sells them in his boutique located in the main market in Bougouni. He makes the most sales around religious festivals and New Year parties. His customers are mostly women. With this loan he plans on earning a monthly profit of 52,500 FCFA. With this income he plans on extending his boutique, paying the interest on the loan and covering other necessities.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata B. est une femme mariée de 33 et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus de toutes sortes sans réussite. Finalement elle opte pour l’achat  vente de produits céréaliers. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son époux. Elle mène son activité au marché de Torakabougou de Bougouni. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, elle maîttise bien son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, elle décida d’intégrer le progamme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième prêt pour acheter des sacs de céréales. Le prêt prècedent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni ville et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs.
La vente de ses articles se fait au marché de Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni à des revendeurs et aux consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata B. is a 33 year old married woman and mother to 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Torakabougou quarter of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school early, she began various types of money making ventures without much success. Finally she opted to buy and sell cereals. She learned this business from her husband. She runs her business in the Torakabougou market in Bougouni. With 5 years' experience, she is good at her job. In order to grow her business she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme. This is her second loan from them to buy sacks of cereals. The last loan was correctly repaid. She buys her produce in Bougouni town and in the surrounding villages from the producers. She sells her goods at the Torakabougou market in the town of Bougouni to retailers and consumers. With this loan she plans on earning a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA that will serve to pay the interest due on the loan and provide for the family.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Broulaye Samaké est un homme de 28 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille nucléaire dans le  quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales, il décida d’abandonner l’école coranique pour commencer les activités génératrices de revenus auprès d’un de ses  ami. Il a appris l’achat et la vente des peaux de vaches.
 Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Broulaye Samaké maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, il décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter une grande quantité de peaux de vaches.
Il est à sa première expérience avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les localités environnantes. Sa clientèle est composée de coordonniers et de revendeurs de la sous région.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui servira à subvenir aux besoins et agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Broulaye Samaké is a 28 year old father of one who lives with his wife and child in a nuclear family in the Massablacoura quarter of Bougouni (the third region of Mali). Due to social reasons he decided to leave Koranic school studies to start earning money from a friend of his. He learnt to buy and sell cowhides. With 8 years' experience, Mr. Broulaye Samaké is very good at his job. In order to access a reliable working capital he decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme to buy a large amount of cowhides. This is his first time with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He buys his stock in Bougouni and in the local area. His customer base is made up of shoemakers and retailers in the subregion. With this loan he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA which will meet his needs and grow his business.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cowhides

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Traoré est un célibataire de 29 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit  chez ses parents dans le  quartier Niébala de  la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mlai)
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants de la place. Après des années expériences dans le domaine du commerce il décida de s’installer à son propre compte en ménant l’activité d’achat et de vente des articles d’alimentation. Il a sa boutique sise au grand marché de Bougouni.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique d’alimentaion.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 67 000 FCFA  qui sera utiliser pour agrandir le commerce et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr, Mohamed Traoré is a single, 29-year-old man and father of one child. He lives with his parents in the Niébala quarter of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been to school, he very quickly started trying to make money, notably working every day with traders in the square. After gaining several years' experience of this, he decided to start buying and selling food items himself. His little shop is located in the large Bougouni market. Whilst looking for extra financial resources, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan programme. This is his first time with the programme. With this loan he is planning to buy various food items. He buys his produce from wholesalers in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). His customers are members of the local population. With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 67,000 FCFA which will be used to grow his business and cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various food items to sell

loans.name: Budumbuli East Group, Jinja

texts.en:
K. Glades is 38 years old and the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a friendly and hardworking lady and married with five children aged 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years.

Glades has a restaurant business in Bugembe that has been in existence for ten years. Her biggest business challenge is the scarcity of foodstuffs but she works so hard to ensure that she has enough for her customers.

Every week, Glades is able to make 140,000/= as profits and these help to take good care of her family and provide for business recapitalization. She hopes to build a house out of the profits and savings made from her business.

Glades hopes to use the loan to improve her customer base by changing the face of her restaurant through renovations and buying more utensils as well as buying more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant, buy more utensils and more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer and soda for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. Nazira works diligently caring for cows at a facility in her home, animals which she then sells at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children and in a short amount of time, the animal sales have provided her with excellent earnings. Nazira is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Birungi Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
K. Scovia is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 40 years old and married with nine children, ages 25 to 4 years.  Her first two children are married while the others are still in school, and she takes care of two orphans. 

Scovia has a business which deals in charcoal sales and her main challenge in business is the unpredictable means of transportation.  Her business has been located in Wakitaka for five years and she is able to make 40,000 UGX as profit per week. Her charcoal is mostly used by her customers for cooking at home, hence she is able to make sales every day. She hopes to start trading in goats as well as build a poultry house as another business. Scovia needs a loan to help buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She is such a hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza E. is 33 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Dilfuza is involved in breeding cattle and raising small cattle. She buys the small cattle from the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. 

Her husband also attends to this business. Dilfuza works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family. Today Dilfuza is planning to purchase three cattle for her household for raising and future selling. For this purpose she requests $1500 USD.  Dilfuza would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
H. Mukarram is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all of her courage. She is married and has two children. 

Mukarram works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. Mukarram wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of $1500 USD to buy small cattle. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Makhsatoy

texts.en:
Makhsatoy is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Eight years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. 

Makhsatoy is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan. You can be an important part of the growth of Makhsatoy’s business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Рустам проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 40. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдурахмонов Рустам имеет среднее образование. Работает на своей собственной земле более чем 22 года. Он сажает и вырашивает растения. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en:
A. Rustam lives in the Yavan region. He's forty years old, married, has four children and a high school education. Rustam has been working on his own land for more than twenty-two years, growing different plants. He is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant a crop

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.en:
B. Pardaboy is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his grandchildren, whom he adores. Pardaboy is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. 

He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he must purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He needs working capital of $800 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money and he is requesting this loan. Pardaboy hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Abdel Kathem

texts.en:
Abdel Kathem is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Abdel Kathem has owned a grocery store since 2006. He sells chips, candies, soft drinks, chewing gum, food supplies and lots more. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise. 

Abdel Kathem is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is welcoming. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he has some financial issues to purchase all the needed merchandise. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in trading. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is a married man and he has three children. His wife has a high degree and she works as a teacher in high school. Naimjon started his business of goods transportation with his truck. He does that already for more than three years and earns enough only for living. So he decided to get this loan to purchase another gas cylinder and thus save on road expenses. Also Naimjon wants to get some spare parts for his truck. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a gas cylinder and spare parts for a truck.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a man who lives in southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Moustafa has been working as a mason since 1999. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and electrical wires for his work. This is the first time that Moustafa has requested a loan. 

Moustafa is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have experience so it wasn’t easy for him to build networking, as well as he had learn the new techniques in order to face the competition. Moustafa decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electrical wires for his work

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been working as a car repairer and painter since 2004. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues to buy all the required tools for his garage. Hussein decided on doing his business because of his experience. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase an air compressor, tools and car oil for his work. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. Hussein is special in his work because he does it well. He always does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his work performance. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor, tools and car oil for his work

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.en:
K. Homidjon is 53 years old and is married with two children. Since 2004 he has been raising and selling animals. He has his own cattle and, little by little over time, he has been improving and expanding his business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living and continuing to pay for his children’s education. His wife (pictured) actively helps him with the business.

IMON International has been a fundamental part of Homidjon´s business, having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and cows. Today, once again, Homidjon faces this need but he trusts that his loan will be granted to that he can help his business and his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.ru: Холиков Абдузоир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Холиков Абдузоир имеет высшее образование. В области животноводства работает 4 года. Холиков Абдузоир откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abduzoir H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Abduzoir H. has a higher education. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for 4 years. Abduzoir H. raises and sells livestock. He is obtaining this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 39-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hamzeh has been working since 1996 as a builder. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. He is special in his work because he does it well and is committed to it. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors, but also people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Hamzeh decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
R. Abdukayum is 42 years old. He is married with three children. Abdukayum is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market. 

Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Abdukayum is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 4,000 Somoni (TJS) in his business. In order to receive this amount, Abdukayum has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en:
Haisam is a 37 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their eight children. Haisam has been working as a taxi driver since 2000. He transports his customers in a van where he does long distance trips, from one village to another. 

When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Haisam is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and also because of his punctuality. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan allowed him to pay for his car expenses. 

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 38 year old man who lives in Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has been working as a construction worker since 1997. Mouhamad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.  In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 38 year old man who lives in southern Lebanon with his wife. Jamal has been working as a blacksmith since 1991. When he first started his work, he had some financial issues and faced difficulties in building networks. He decided on doing his business because of his experience and because he likes his work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work, like an electrical arc welding tool and an abrasive. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Benadera S. is 47 years old, married and has one son who is 23.  For two years, Benadera has owned and operated a used woman's clothing sales business. Twice a month she travels to Nairobi, Kenya, to purchase clothing and bring it back for sale in Dar es Salaam. Benadera works 8 hours a day and currently earns 400,000 Tanzanian shillings a month (~$298 USD).

This will be Benadera’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to obtain this loan to increase the frequency of her trips to Nairobi from twice a month to three times a month and, as a result of her increased inventory, improve her business.

Benadera will share this loan with her loan group, comprised of five other women from her community who work in food and clothing sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Benadera is in the middle with the red blouse.

loans.use: To Increase her clothing inventory

loans.name: Tubhuke Group

texts.en:
Bhoke J. is 27 years old, single, and has one daughter, aged 4.  Since 2003, Bhoke has gone door-to-door selling ladies clothing. Bhoke works 9 hours a day and currently earns 280,000 Tanzanian shillings a month.

This will be Bhoke’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to obtain this loan to increase her clothing inventory and improve her business.

Bhoke will share this loan with her loan group, which is comprised of 18 total men and women from her community. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Bhoke is seated in the second row behind the woman in the pink shirt. She is wearing a blue dress. The small picture in the corner is a head shot of Bhoke J., the group leader.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing inventory

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 48 year old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working in the agricultural field since 2002. He plants different products depending on the season; tomatoes, oranges, apples, beans, and mint, are a few examples.

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase agricultural supplies for his work. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. Ibrahim is special in his work because he offers good quality products. His clients can be individuals, but mainly, he sells to fruits and vegetables shops. In the picture, we see Ibrahim with his van which he actually uses when he delivers his merchandise to the shops. 

When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties thanks to his experience since he took on his family’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a plot of land next to his and will plant other type of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for his work.

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en:
Mountaha is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mountaha has been selling women accessories from her house for two years. She sells makeup, textiles for sewing, belts and lots more. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise to sell. This is the first time that Mountaha has requested a loan.

When Mountaha first started her work, she didn’t face any difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she likes what she does and especially because she always wanted, from a young age, to sell women’s accessories. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon. Amani has been working as a hair dresser for over a year. She also does makeup and hair removal, and sells beauty products as well. When Amani first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on her business because she likes her work and does it well, since she gained experience while working in a salon. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her salon, including makeup, a new drier, and beauty products. This is the first time that Amani has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Khodour

texts.en:
Khodour is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Khodour has been working as a blacksmith for three years. When he first started his work, he didn’t face any difficulty except making himself known to the public. He decided on this business because of his experience, since he learned it when he was young. He used to watch his dad working and started showing interest in the business. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wires for his work. This is the first time that Khodour has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 56-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Hassan has been working as a car repairman and painter since 1977. He also sells spare auto parts and he changes oil. When Hassan doesn’t work in his garage, he also works as a taxi driver; he is an active man who does his best to improve his family’s financial situation by offering them the best he can. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage which will allow him to improve his work. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassan first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties, since he had a good reputation from his previous work as an employee. He decided on this business because of his experience as a car mechanic. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages, beer, and soda, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Joice is 33 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 6 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Sebit

texts.en:
Sebit J. is currently in the business of selling food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks to sell, like sodas, packed juice, and water. Sebit is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 5 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell, like sodas, packed juice, and water

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D., aged 58, is a retired police officer living in Thies, a city about seventy kilometers from the capital, Dakar. He is married and the father of seven children.

After retiring from the force, Mr. D. began his small trade, primarily in used televisions and fabrics from Mauritania. He has received three prior loans from UIMCEC, one of which was funded through Kiva, and reports that he has re-invested most of the proceeds back into his business.

The small loan of 50,000 FCFA will allow him to cover the transport costs to Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania. He already has the necessary savings to purchase the fabrics.

loans.use: To finance a trip to replenish his stock of fabrics

loans.name: Reta

texts.en:
Reta L. is currently in the business of selling bread in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and vegetables to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

Reta is 24 years old and is married to a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and vegetables  to sell.

loans.name: Fatimata Binta

texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata Binta S., aged 50, is a commercante (small trader) in Thies, a city about seventy kilometers from the capital, Dakar. She runs a small business selling fabrics and cosmetics.

Ms. S. has two sales points: one at her home which she manages herself and the other in the local market where she has an employee in charge. The loan of 500,000 FCFA will allow her to replenish her stock and hopefully increase sales.

Ms. S. has been in the trade for over twenty years and uses her revenues to help her husband meet the needs of their five children and extended family.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store. Lona is 35 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Telezia

texts.en: Telezia is 35 years old and is divorced. She has five children and her children go to school. Telezia S. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is currently in the business of selling charcaol from home, and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.  Esther is 40 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has seven children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house she can rent out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs in order to sit more customers in her restaurant.  Mary is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs in order to sit more customers in her restaurant.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents and 5 unemployed brothers who still go to school. He and his father collaborate to pay for his brothers' schooling. He has been working as a furniture making since 2006. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a compressor and painting tools.

loans.use: buy a compressor and painting tools

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, los 03 ya independientes.

Rosaura, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio D. ventas D. bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe.
