Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 200.00 y empezó comprando 04 paquetes D. gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes D. gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Rosaura, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas D. pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosaura is a member of the community bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province and Department. She is married, is 69 years old and is mother to 3 children, all of whom are now independent. Rosaura is a hardworking woman and a fighter, so she decided to set up her own business selling fizzy drinks in the well air-conditioned environment of her own home. She is the one who runs her business, without any timetable or boss. She tells us that she started out with 200 soles and first bought 4 packs of fizzy drinks. As she saw that things were going well, little by little she invested more. Now she continues to run this business and is known amongst her customers who are neighbours, relatives and friends. With this loan of 3,000 soles she will buy more drinks such as: packs of different flavoured fizzy drinks in different sizes and brands, plus still and sparkling mineral water. Rosaura is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she needed it the most. She is responsible with her repayment schedule and plans to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on fizzy drinks and water for her business

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus M. is 31 years old and married to Siesta Gwiyo who is a housewife. They live in Kilifi town where Onesmus operates in transport service using a motorcycle. He has been in that business for the last year and he is based at the busy Kilifi bus stage.

This loan marks Onesmus' second borrowing and he plans to service his motorcycle by purchasing some new spare-parts. His clients are local area residents in Kilifi town and some of them are quite loyal to his services.

Onesmus is ambitious and hopes to own a PSV matatu (van) in future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motocycle.

loans.name: Musutu Ene

texts.en:
Musutu is widowed and has four children. She provides for her children by herself.

Musutu was introduced to KADET through existing clients.  Musutu has been in the business of selling livestock for thirty years. Musutu sells sheep and sells ornaments she makes.

Musutu's area of business is located within the town in which she resides. She sells her ornaments to curio shop traders. With the extra profits, Musutu will further the education of her children and improve the family's living standards.

Musutu hopes to have a farm and plant and produce plants of high yields as she believes she is very hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase stock of livestock and craft materials

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en: Faysal owns a mini-market since 2001 in his town. He's 33 years old, married with one child. He has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by his shop and buy all type of food products. Today, Faysal is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a refrigerator specialized to present the cold food products.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward C. is 25 years old. He lives in an area called Maweni in Kilifi and operates a food cafe. His business is slowly stabilizing and has been in existence for only one year. 

Edward joined KADET recently and this marks his first loan from KADET to finance his business. With the loan he receives, Edward plans to purchase new cutlery and to also purchase cooking gas to be able to serve his customers better. His clients are mainly workers and business people operating around his cafe. Edward hopes that his business will stabilize well and reach its full potential soon allowing him to generate greater profits so he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase new cutlery and cooking gas

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance M. is 52 years old and married to Samuel, a teacher in Kilifi. They are blessed with seven children. Constance is a business lady and she sells charcoal to customers. She purchases bags of charcoal in wholesale and later sells to the Mnarani residents as a retailer. She has been serving her community well and at the same time generating some profits. She has been in the charcoal business for two years.

This is Constance's second loan. She paid the first one well. With this loan, she intends to purchase more charcoal stock for re-selling.

In the future, Constance hopes to diversify her source of income by opening a food cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal stock for to sell to customers

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy M. habite dans la localité de Camberene et a déjà rembourse deux crédits antérieurs au sein de l’U-IMCEC. Elle est parent bénéficiaire, mariée. Elle évolue dans le commerce de parfum, d’habits, de produits divers, de jus, de glace et de crème glacée. Elle capitalise une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité. C’est sa coépouse qui avait l’habitude de voyager au Mali pour acheter des marchandises qui lui ’a donne l’inspiration qui l’a conduit à choisir cette activité pour gagner sa vie. Madame M. sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer ses produits en vue d’accroitre au maximum ses bénéfices. Actuellement elle constitue un véritable soutien de famille, son mari ne disposant plus de revenus c’est elle qui supporte les charges sociales de la maison.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy M. lives in the Camberene area and has already repaid two previous loans through UIMCEC. She is a parent and is married. She works selling perfume, clothes, miscellaneous items, juice, ice and ice-cream. She has built up 7 years of experience in this trade. It was her co-wife who used to travel to Mali to buy merchandise which inspired her to choose this business as her livelihood. Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for 100,000 frs to stock up on products with a view to maximising her profits. Nowadays she is a real help to her family, her husband no longer has to pay out as it is she who covers household expenses.

With a continuing focus on active participation in the fight against poverty, UIMCEC, with help from lenders, succeeds in supporting people to run their own income-generating businesses, which promotes social and economic development.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital to buy and sell various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Augmenter sa capacité d'autofinancement

loans.name: Moses Ole

texts.en:
Moses is married to Esther and they have six children.

Moses was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he is servicing his first loan. Moses has been in the business of selling livestock for twenty four years. He intends to use this loan to buy more sheep. He will fatten them and sell them for profit. His other sources of income are selling herbs and precious stones.

Moses operates his business within a market in his area of residence. With the extra profits, Moses will buy a piece of land and build rental houses. Moses  wants to educate his six children and establish a family business. 

He describes himself as loyal and hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to puchase sheep which he will fatten and then resell for profit.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 33-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working as a home decorator and specialized in Gypsum board since 2002. He has been involved for the past 13 years in this occupation. Today, Fadi is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a special machine for the Gypsum board.

loans.use: buy a special machine for the Gypsum board

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is 20 years old. She is in the business of selling fish in Kilifi, in a place called Charo Wamae. She has been selling fish for two years to the locals of Charo Wamae and the demand for her fish has been strong.

Margaret joined KADET recently after being introduced by a fellow group member and is glad to now have access to capital in order to help boost her fish business. With the loan, she plans to buy more fish stock and to buy two fish boxes for display.

Margaret hopes to one day build a permanent structure where she can comfortably operate her business.

loans.use: To buy fish stock and two boxes for fish display

loans.name: Ashaa

texts.en:
Ashaa T. is 56 years old. She is a mother of six grown children. Ashaa operates a cafeteria at the Kilifi town bus stage and has been selling food for two years. Her business has been a success because of the high number of workers in her business location and the good service she offers her clients.

Ashaa serviced her first loan from KADET well and is now glad to be borrowing a second one. With this loan, Ashaa plans buy a charcoal cooker, kitchen cutlery and more food stock to meet the needs of her customers.

She hopes to expand her cafe to be able to cater to the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To buy a charcoal cooker, kitchen cutlery and food.

loans.name: Karina Maribel

texts.es:
Karina V. de 39 años, su vivienda esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y el único servicio básico que tiene es luz, su esposo es operador de montacargas con el tiene 3 hijos uno de 18 años que no estudia y de 12 y 10 años que estudian es escuelas particulares. 

Karina empezó con una tienda de víveres, pero decidió mejor tener una actividad que ha ella le gustara como el hacer manualidades, comenzó hacer cursos de manualidades y después de unos años comenzó a trabajar en esto. Ahora ella trabaja desde muy temprano para repartir todas las manualidades que hace como maquetas, adornos, afiches para fiestas, sorpresas etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene en su trabajo son las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar comprar fomix, adornos, pinturas para tener más material disponible para la elaboración de manualidades. En el futuro quisiera tener un bazar y  enseñar a otras personas manualidades para todo evento.
texts.en:
Karina V. is 39. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement, and the only basic service it has is electricity. Her husband is a freight elevator operator. They have three children. One is 18 and does not attend school. The 12 year old and the 10 year old go to private schools. Karina started with a grocery store, but she decided it would be better to have an activity that she likes such as handicrafts. She started taking courses in handicrafts, and after a few years she started to work in this field. She now starts work very early to distribute all of the handicrafts she makes like models, decorations, posters for parties, and surprises, etc. One of the problems she has in her work is the rains. With this loan she wants to buy “fomix” (foam crafts), decorations, and paints to have more available material to make handicrafts. In the future she would like to have a bazaar and teach other people handicrafts for all events.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy “fomix” (foam crafts), decorations, and paints

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El Sr.  Ismael es casado con la señora Lucia tienen un hijo, el cliente nació en Santa Cruz en Vallegrande  el 12 de diciembre en 1985 y aproximadamente 6 años que tienen su propia parcela en la comunidad de Santo Corazón trabajando en la agricultura el solo mantiene los gastos del hogar ya que su esposa es ama de casa, el cliente tiene su propio vehiculo donde su segunda actividad es el servicio de trasporte publico y esto le ayuda tambien en la agricultura ya que con su vehiculo transporta sus productos a los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.

Este crédito será utilizado en la compra de semilla, para el cultivo de Soya. El señor esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza depositada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ismael is married to Sra. Lucia. They have one child. Ismael was born in Santa Cruz –Vallegrande on December 12, 1985. He is engaged in agriculture and has a parcel of land in the community of Santo Corazón that he has owned for approximately six years. Ismael also owns a vehicle that he uses for his second business of providing transportation services. This loan will be used to purchase seeds for soybean cultivation. Sr. Ismael is grateful for the confidence being entrusted in him by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old married man. A father of one child, he has been working as a plumber since 1990 maintaining toilets, faucets and centrA. heating. Joseph plans to enlarge his business productivity and expand it. In order to do so, Joseph is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. tools.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Paulette Isabelle

texts.fr: Paulette Isabelle C. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis un an et demi et y a bénéficié de trois prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle détient une table au marché où elle vend de l'oignon. son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Paulette Isabelle C. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis un an et demi et y a bénéficié de trois prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle détient une table au marché où elle vend de l'oignon. son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mieux développer son activité commerciale

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro es casada, tiene 59 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y dos D. sus hijas que son madres solteras en la ciudad D. Piura, ubicada a tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Trabaja desD. hace 19 años vendiendo comida y bebidas en el mercado Valdivieso D. la ciudad D. Piura. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empeza a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que persibe su esposo como comerciante D. fruta no eran suficientes para mantener a su familia.

El negocio D. Socorro goza D. buena acogida debido a la buena sazón con que prepara los platos que ofrece a diario y al trato amable que ofrece a sus clientes. Socorro planea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos para preparar más platos D. comida así como en la compra D. bebidas gaseosas y cerveza. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por tercera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es instalar un restaurante turistico. Ella es una cliente responsable que, durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando con nuestra Institución, ha demostrado puntualidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Socorro is 59 and married. She lives with her husband and two of their daughters in the city of Piura, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. The daughters are single mothers. She has worked for 19 years selling food and beverages in the Valdivieso Market in the city of Piura. She tells us that she had to start to work in this business because her husband’s income as a fruit seller was not sufficient to support her family. Socorro’s business is popular because of the good seasoning, which she uses to prepare her daily plates, and the friendly treatment she offers her customers. Socorro plans to expand her business with the purchase of ingredients to make more food dishes, soft drinks, and beer. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the third time, for a loan for 1,500 PEN. Her biggest desire is to set up a tourist restaurant. She is a responsible client. During all of the time that she has been working with our institution she has been punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and drinks to expand her food selling business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 51años, es casada y tiene tres hijas. Dos de sus hijas ya son independientes pero Deysi depende de ella. Elisa vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Elisa se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno. Elisa tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de pollipapas (comida peruana que tiene un trozo de pollo y papas fritas) en la puerta del mercado de la ciudad de Urubamba y vende desde las 11 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.  Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Elisa requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos y papas para poder preparar más platos de comida.   
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elisa belongs to the Palccaraqui Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 51, married, and has three daughters. Two of her daughters are independent, but Deysi is dependent upon her. Elisa lives in the Urubamba province in the Cusco department. The city of Urubamba is an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. Elisa gets up very early to do the household chores like preparing breakfast. Elisa has a small business selling “pollipappas” (a Peruvian dish that has a piece of chicken and fried potatoes) in the entrance to the market in the city of Urubamba. She sells from 11 a.m. until 5 p.m. She has been in the business for 15 years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Elisa needs the loan to buy more chickens and potatoes to be able to make more food. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens and potatoes to be able to make more food

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert has owned an air conditioning shop since 1988. He’s a 37-year-old single man. He specializes in selling and repairing air conditioners. Today, Robert is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools and additional spare parts in order to expand his business and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy new tools and additional spare parts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa Se dedica a la venta de pescado, en su propio domicilio, vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, municipio de El Torno, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, el cual le ayuda en los ingresos del hogar, tiene  5 hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, otros en la universidad.
El destino del crédito fue para   aumentar su capital de trabajo, por época de fin de año.
La Sra. Elsa esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa sells fish out of her own home. She lives in the community of Puerto Rico in the city of El Torno. Her husband works as a mason, which helps her with the household expenses. She has five children who are in school, while the others attend university.

This loan will be used to increase her operating capital for the year-end season. Sra. Elsa is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her business

loans.name: Labib

texts.en: Labib is a 27-year-old married man. In 2001, he decided to open his own business. He works in rock sculpture. Today, Labib is requesting to borrow $1,200. With the loan, he will expand his business by buying a pick-up for easier transport to the projects where he works.

loans.use: To buy a pick-up truck

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton es carpintero, y elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, tiene dos hijos pequeños y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
Su taller y casa se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa Armonía de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la capital de trabajo (compra de madera, venesta, clavos y cola)
Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Milton is a carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture as well as general repairs. He has two small children and his wife maintains the house. His workshop and house are located in the Villa Armonia zone of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for working capital, including the purchase of wood, plywood, nails, and glue. This is Milton’s fifth loan with Impro, and he has an excellent record in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood, plywood, nails, glue, etc. for carpentry business

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es:
María Aurelia tiene 49 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito D. la Unión, provincia D. Piura en la región del mismo nombre ubicada a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo

DesD. hace más D. 15 años se dedica a la comercialización D. carnes rojas, D. pescado y D. pollo en el mercadp del caserío Casa GranD., en el distrito D. La Arena. Este negocio constituye la unica fuente D. ingreso con la que saca adelante a su familia por lo que ella se esfuerza todos los dias para sacarlo adelante.

Maria Aurelia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. carne D. pescado para mantener su negocio ya que durante estos meses el precio D. este producto sube en la región donD. vive.

Ella es una mujer responsable, amable y muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su más granD. anhelo es ver a sus menores hijos convertidos en unos profesionales D. éxito.
texts.en:
María Aurelia is a widow; she is 49 years and lives with her two children in the district of Unión, located in Piura Province of the Piura Region, three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 15 years she has sold red meat, fish and chicken at the market in the Casa GranD. settlement, in the district of La Arena. The business is the only income her family counts on to get ahead; therefore, she labors every day to improve it. This is the first time María Aurelia has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. In order to keep her business going well, she requests 500 new soles to invest in fish, as the price of this product has been going up in the area where she lives. María Aurelia is a responsible person, kind and very dedicated to her family and her work. Her greatest wish is that her children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Lucas vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Lucas tiene 52 años, es casado y tiene 7 hijos. Lucas se dedica a la agricultura donde produce verduras, papas, maíz y zapallos. Lucas distribuye en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco sus productos. Lucas y su esposa pertenecen a la asociación de productores de cultivos del “Valle Sagrado de los Incas”, que es bien reconocida en el Cusco. El socio Lucas nos cuenta que cuando no esta trabajando en su chacra se dedica a la construcción de casas.

El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja como albañil y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar mas semillas y después sembrarlas.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucas is a member of “PALCCARAQUI”, the communal bank of the Arariwa Association. He lives in Urubamba Province, department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is three hours away from the city of Cusco. Lucas is 52 years old, married and has 7 children. He works as a farmer and grows vegetables, potatoes, corn and pumpkins. He sells his products at the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco. Lucas and his wife are members of the “Valle Sagrado de los Incas” farmers association, which is a well-known organization in Cusco. Lucas tells us that when he isn’t working on his small farm he works in construction, building homes. He is a hard-working father and has worked as a bricklayer for several years now. He has done well thanks to his efforts and dedication to his work. He has asked for a loan to buy seed for his farm. Lucas is grateful for the opportunity extended to him and promises to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests a loan to buy seeds which he will plant in his farm.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
La Sra. elvira Vive en la localidad el Torno distante a 39 Km. de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, su actividad principal es venta de comida, en su propio domicilio; cuenta con una casa que fue heredada de sus padres, su esposo con el que tienen 5 hijos a su cargo se dedica al transporte, y en su tiempos libre le ayuda en su negocio, el cual es su principal ingresos de la familia.

La Sra. elvira esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Elvira lives in the town of El Torno, which is 39km away from the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She sells food out of her home, which she inherited from her parents. She and her husband have five dependent children. He works as a truck driver, but he helps with her business in his spare time. Elvira’s business is the main source of income for her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her business

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La señora Inés M. desde muy joven ha salido a ganarse el pan de cada día para ella y sus hijos.  Esta señora actualmente vende ropa por encargo cuyo comercio inicio hace más de diez años y por el cual tiene el sustento de cada día.

M. con la poca ganancia que obtenía crio a sus hijos para que sean mujeres y hombres de bien. Por lo cual no ha podido cumplir su sueño que es tener su propia casa ya que ella vive en casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inés M. has been working and earning a living to support herself and her children since she was very young. At the moment she sells clothing by preorder. The business, which she started over 10 years ago, provides her daily income. With her meager earnings, she has been able to raise her children well and set them on the right path. However, she has not been able to achieve her dream of home ownership and she lives at her mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Ndeye Seny

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Seny T. est une nouvelle adhérente de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC de Camberene.	                              
C’est une femme mariée  âgée de 32 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de friperie et boubous de tout genre. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son capital. Madame T. se déplace chaque semaine dans les marches hebdomadaires et a besoin de renouveler son stock. Les bénéfices qu’elle gagne lui permettent d’assurer une partie des dépenses quotidiennes.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Ndeye Seny T. is a new member of the Cambérène branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. She is married and 32 years old. She sells all kinds of second-hand clothes and bubus (African dresses for both women and men) and has five years' experience in this business. Mrs T. applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to increase her working capital. She travels every week to the various weekly trade fairs and currently needs to renew her inventory. Her profit enables her to cover part of her daily expenses. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Aramata

texts.fr: Aramata Mané est une femme âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir obtenu à 16 fois de suite. Elle achète et revend des chaussures et des habits. Son objectif est d'aider à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aramata Mané is a 43-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in PETIT KANDE for eight years and has a good experience of borrowing, having had 16 consecutive loans. She buys and sells shoes and clothes. Her aim is to help out with her family's daily responsibilities and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Santa Ana Sur Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana Sur está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras que desde tempranas horas están en sus labores una de ella es Francisca Emenor C. M.. Esta señora de 54 años se dedica a la venta y compra de maíz producto de gran importancia en Nicaragua porque como dice la canción somos hijos del maíz y la mayoría de nuestros alimentos son a base de este.   

Mientras sus compañeras comercializan otros tipos de producto Martha O. vende ropa de manera ambulante,Martha Teresa Bravo vende muebles de madera y Juana María L. Rodríguez quien junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño taller que da mantenimiento a panaderías, refrigeradoras,aire acondicionado entre otros productos.

Ellas esperan que este año traiga muchas bendiciones y que sus negocios prosperen.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Sur group is made up of four hard working women that start their work from the very early hours of the morning. One of the members is Francisca Emenor C. Martinez. She is a 54 year old woman that sells corn, a product of great importance in Nicaragua. As the song goes "We are children of corn" and the majority of their food staples are corn based.

Her groupmates carry out other types of work. Martha O. sells clothing door to door, Martha Teresa Bravo sells wood furniture, and Juana Maria Lopez Rodriguez, together with her husband, have a small repair shop providing maintenace services to ovens, refrigerators, air conditioning units, among other equipment.

Their hopes for this year are to have many blessings and to see their business prosper.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime tiene como actividad el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para su familia, que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos y su esposa Sra. Ana quien tambien ayuda a su hogar vendiendo ropa por las tardes en el centro de la ciudad.n 

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, compra de llantas y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo.

El Sr. Jaime esta agradecido con Emprender y con Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Sr. Jaime provides urban transportation services by radio taxi. He works every day since this is the main source of income for his family, which consists of his wife and three children. His wife, Sra. Ana, helps with the household expenses by selling clothes during the afternoons in the central part of the city.

This loan will be used primarily to refurbish his vehicle. Jaime will purchase tires and make other minor repairs so that his vehicle will be in optimal condition for developing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & make repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.en: Jocelyne has owned an electronics shop since 2008. She has been involved in this field for the past 10 years. A mother of one child, she opened this small business to help her husband with the family's income. Today, Jocelyne is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. electronic equipment in order to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: To buy additional electronics equipment

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 04 y 12 años de edad en el sector Manuel Seoane de la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El procede de la serranía del país y hace algunos años migró a la ciudad de Piura para trabajar y sacar adelante a los suyos. Se dedica desde hace 08 años a la comercialización de papas. Todos los días se dirige muy temprano hacia el mercado mayorista de la ciudad para luego distribuirlas entre los comerciantes de los mercados minoristas. Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia.

Victorino desea adquirir más variedades de papas para ampliar su negocio y captar más clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo

Victorino es un padre bastante responsable y trabajador, sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima. Su más grande anhelo es hacer mejoras en su casa ya que está construida de material rustico. En la imagen aparece acomodando los sacos en donde distribuye la papa despues de un dia de labor.
texts.en:
Victorino is a 36 year old family man. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 4 and 12. They live in the Manuel Seoane sector of the city of Piura, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He is from the mountains of the country, and a few years ago he moved to the city of Piura to work and get his family ahead. He has been selling potatoes for eight years. Very early every morning he heads to the wholesale market in the city to deliver the potatoes to the retail merchants. This business is the only source of income the family has. Victorina wants to acquire more varieties of potatoes to increase his business and get more customers. For the first time he is asking the Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 PEN that he plans to use to achieve his objective. Victorino is a very responsible father, and he is a hard worker. His neighbors and customers hold him in high esteem. His greatest goal is to make improvements on his house because it is made of rustic material. In the photo he appears arranging the sacks he uses to distribute the potatoes after a day of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes to increase his business

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es:
En una tarde agitada de enero me encontré con cuatro mujeres excepcionales la cual su historia, su trabajo y su jovialidad deja asombrados a muchos. Una de ellas es la señora Josefa Leonarda E. de 55 años quien desde 1980 tiene su propio taller de costura. 

Ella aprendió este oficio desde muy joven ya que antiguamente a la mujer se le enseñaba a coser y aun en la actualidad los centros educativos enseñan este arte.  A la señora Josefa le agradaba mucho este oficio que se dedico a ello y les enseño a sus hijas las cuales le ayudan. Ella invertirá el crédito en telas especialmente para hacer uniformes ya que con la entrada a clases tiene muchos encargos. 

La historia de Celenia C. M. de 53 años es muy parecida a su compañera con la diferencia que ellas es una profesional en bordados y la producción de ropas típicas. Esta señora tiene un pequeño taller de nombre “Bordados Carmen” y una tienda donde comercializa sus productos y artesanías. Ella desea capacitar en la costura ya que siente que necesita mejorar este arte.

Su compañera Patricia Lucia A.  desde los 14 años se dedica a la realización de vestuario ella aprendió de su abuelita y luego se fue perfeccionando. A. desea seguir trabajando, superarse y aumentar su negocio.

Mientras las más joven del grupo con tan solo 23 años Marbell T. D. desde hace cuatro años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante en el mercado de Masaya. Ella desea salir adelante, seguir trabajando y un día tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
On a blustery January afternoon I met with four exceptional women whose history, work, and good humor leave many people astonished. One of them is Señora Josefa Leonarda E., 55 years old, who since 1980 has had her own sewing workshop. She learned this skill while very young since in the past women were taught to sew and still today education centers teach this art. Señora Josefa found this trade very agreeable and began to work at it. She taught her daughters who now help her. She will invest the loan in special materials to make uniforms since with the beginning of classes she has many requests. The history of Celenia C. M., 53 years old, is very similar to that of her companion with the difference that she is skilled in embroidery and the production of traditional clothing. This lady has a small workshop of the name Carmen's Embroidery and a store where she sells her products and handicrafts. She wants to train in sewing since she feels she needs to improve this skill. Their companion, Patricia Lucia A., has worked for 14 years making clothing, having learned from her grandmother. Since then she has been perfecting her skill. A. wants to continue working, improve her skill, and increase her business. While the youngest of the group, Marbell T. D., is only 23 years old she has worked for four years in the business of fruits and vegetables as a mobile seller in the market of Masaya. She wishes to get ahead, continue working, and one day have her own area for selling.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread, decorations, etc. for sewing and fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Awa Dado

texts.fr: Awa Dado S. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle est âgée de 48 ans, et depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE où elle a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien remboursés. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce en achetant et revendant des chaussures et habits. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Awa Dado S. is married with three children and she is 48 years old; for seven and a half years she has been a member of the village bank in PETIT KANDE from which she has had 15 loans, all of which have been repaid without problem. She is developing a small business buying and selling shoes and clothes. Her aim is to contribute to the well-being of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Afde Group No.3

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by 20 entreprenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.  

All five of the women of AFDE Group No. 3 work in the main market of Thies.  Ms. Penda N., 42, is the group's president.  She has been a merchant for 22 years. She sells vegetables.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She lives with her family in the Cité Lamy neighborhood.
The other four members all sell fish, which is transported from the fishing towns along the coast.  Each member will receive a 100,000 credit for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANDREA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS EN LA CALLE 53 DE CHASQUIPAMPA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO CON LA QUE MANTIENE A SU HOGAR, QUE POR CIERTO ES MUY HUMILDE YA QUE SOLO VIVEN ELLA , SU HIJO PEQUEÑO EN UNA SOLA HABITACION POR LA ORILLAS DEL RIO DE OVEJUYO ELLA SOLA MANTIENE EL HOGAR Y EL ESTUDIO DE SU HIJO.
LA SR. ANDREA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea sells fruit along 53rd Street in Chasquipampa in order to support her herself. She is a modest woman who lives alone. Her son lives by himself at his home located on the banks of the Ovejuyo River. She pays for her household expenses and her son’s education.

Sra. Andrea is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Afde Group No. 1

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by 20 entrepenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra M..  

This is the second loan for AFDE Group No. 1 to be financed through Kiva.  Ms. Mame Diarra M., 49, is the president of the AFDE, as well as the sub-group AFDE No. 1.  She sells second-hand clothing in the loumas (weekly markets) around Thies.  As president of the association, she does not have much time to make it to the markets these days, but has a family member take her place.  She is married and has eight children.  
Ms. D., 53, is an experienced tailor.  She has been in the business for over 30 years since receiving her professional diploma.  As a secondary activity, she sells palm oil, peanut paste and coffee.  She says tailoring is her passion, but she must supplement her income for her family of ten.
Each group member will use their 100,000 FCFA to bolster their small commerce.  Ms. Kairé and Ms. Sané sell fresh vegetables.  Ms. D. sews pillowcases which she then sells.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Afde Group No. 20

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by 20 entreprenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar. 
 
Ms. Penda N., 59, is the president of AFDE group No. 20.  Through the influence of her mother, she began selling in the markets almost 30 years ago.  She sells carrots, potatoes, onions and other vegetables.  She has eight children, all of them now adults.  Ms. Maimouna D. is the group's treasurer.  Her activity is traveling to the coastal town of Karay, some km away, to buy fish which in turn she sells in Thies.  Like Ms. N., she has been active in her trade for 30 years.  The other three members of the group are: Aminata D. who sells vegetables, Maty N. who has a small restaurant and Mame Fatou M. who sells fish.  Each recieves an amount of 100,000 FCFA to reinforce their activities.

loans.use: To reinforce her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, Distrito Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 56 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.Las ganas de salir adelante y cumplir parte de sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio la venta de abarrotes, con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico de su hogar, lleva 10 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad y desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando muy buenos clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todos los productos necesaR., que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y también  una refrigeradora para poder conservar los diferentes tipos de carnes para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Hilda, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres del 2000” (Women of 2000), which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín. She is 56 years old, widowed, and the mother of three adult children. Motivated by her desire to succeed and fulfill her dreams, Hilda started her own business selling groceries. With her earnings, she is able to support her household financially. Hilda has been in business for ten years and to date has attracted very good customers. She has regular customers who come to her store on daily basis because she carries all the necessary products that any housewife would need. Hilda welcomes each customer individually with her charming personality.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, cookies, noodles and salt in packets, milk, and also a refrigerator for storing different types of meats. This will enable her to provide better service to her customers. Hilda desires to continue working and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing assistance to women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a refrigerator for her store

loans.name: Garcias Group

texts.es:
El grupo Garcias está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Martha Irene M. de 49 años quien vende frutas y verduras, Claudia M. R. desde hace cuatro años vende frescos y gaseosas y Melania C. se dedica a la venta de verduras.
 
Ellas desean salir adelante progresar y mejorar sus negocios por ello con el crédito compraran mayor cantidad de productos lo cual les ayudara a aumentar el negocio.
texts.en:
The Garcías Group is composed of three hardworking women: Martha Irene M., 49 years old, sells fruits and vegetables; Claudia M. R. has been selling soft drinks for 4 years, and Melania C. sells vegetables. They wish to get ahead, make progress and improve their business, which is why, with the loan, they will purchase a greater quantity of products which will help increase their business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, potatoes, yuca, melon, etc

loans.name: Santa Amalia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Amalia está integrado por tres mujeres que se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas. Cruz V. P. inicio hace tres años con pocos productos pero luego con los préstamos invirtió en mayor cantidad y variedad lo que le permitió mejorar su negocio.

Damaris L. T. vende tomates, papaya, plátanos y melón entre otras frutas de acuerdo a la temporada y Grethel del Carmen P. también vende frutas en el mercado de Masaya de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The Santa Amalia Communal Bank is composed of three women that buy and sell fruits. Cruz V. P. began her business three years ago with few products but later, with the help of loans, she invested in a greater quantity and variety of fruits, which enabled her to improve her business. Damaris L. T. sells tomatoes, papaya, bananas and melons, among other fruits, depending on the season, and Grethel del Carmen P. also peddles fruits in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Rosa es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Rosa vende pescado en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los días sábados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Rosa son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "Fe" ["Faith"]. Rosa is married, she is 30 years old and has three children. Rosa sells fish in the city of Ayacucho's fish market on Saturdays. She purchases her supplies in the city of Lima. Rosa needs a 600 PEN loan to invest in the purchase of fish. Rosa dreams of educating her children and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis E. vive casa de sus padres en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene la profesión de mecánico dental; realiza y refacciona placas dentales. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para su taller de mecánica dental y también para poder abrir un punto viva en su domicilio y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

Es el octavo crédito en IMPRO; su historial de pagos es  muy bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luis E. lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of the city of La Paz. He is a dental technician, and he makes and repairs dental plates. The loan he is requesting is to buy material for his dental technician workshop. Also, it is to be able to open a call center in his home. This way he will increase his income. This is his eighth loan with Impro. His payment history is very good, and he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make dental plates for his dental technician workshop

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: La Sra. Magaly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.Magaly, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, CyZone, Avon y Unique, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. También se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de adornos (mercerías).En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Se siente muy contenta y tranquila con lo que realiza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará productos de catálogos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. Parte del dinero también invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de adornos y regalos.  Magaly, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Magaly is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres del 2000” (Women of 2000), which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín. She is 32 years old, single, and the mother of one dependent child. Magaly is a hardworking woman who possesses a fighting spirit. In order to get ahead by her own means, she started a business selling cosmetics of various lines. These include Esika, CyZone, Avon, and Unique. Magaly does not report to a boss or maintain a set work schedule. Over time she became well known among her customers. She says her business is doing very well. In addition to selling cosmetics to her friends door-to-door, she manages a haberdashery in her home where she offers different types of ornaments. Magaly feels content and at peace with what she has accomplished.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase products from her catalogs such as perfumes, colognes, body and face crèmes, lipsticks, and compacts in order to keep her customers happy. Part of the money will also be used to purchase various types of decorations and gift items. Magaly thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & merchandise for her haberdashery

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 58 años y 2 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las ferias D. la región dos veces por semana en donD. venD. ropa y calzados, en algunas oportunidades compra que venD. en su tienda D. abarrotes que tiene en su casa.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa típica.
El sueño D. Felicitas es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the communal bank "Fe" (Faith). She is married, 58 years old and has two children. Felicitas travels to the markets in the region 2 times a week where she sells clothing and shoes; occasionally she also buys groceries that she sells from a store that she has in her home. Felicitas needs a loan of 1,050 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of traditional Peruvian clothing. Felicitas dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy traditional Peruvian clothing

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y a sus dos hermanos menores de edad en la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su madre es separada y debido a las constantes necesidades por las que atraviesa su familia tuvo que empezar un negocio de venta de cerveza con la finalidad de colaborar en la economía del hogar. Ella vende cerveza en su domicilio a sus vecinos y clientes. Los dias en que su producto tiene mayor acogida son los fines de semana.

Gabriela desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de más cerveza, ya que este producto es muy consumido por sus vecinos en la época de verano, durante estos meses, la región Piura presenta elevadas temperaturas. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven juy responsable y trabajadora. Su más grande anhelo es llegar a convertirse en una distribuidora de cerveza.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 28 years old, single, and lives with her mother and her 2 minor siblings in the city of Piura, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Her mother is separated, and in order to meet her family's needs she had to start a business selling beer in order to contribute to the economic resources of the household. She sells beer from her home to her neighbors and customers. Her products are most in demand during the weekends. Gabriela wishes to expand her business with the sale of more beer. This product is most heavily consumed by her neighbors during the summer season; during these months (Dec. - March) the Piura region has very high temperatures. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the first time from EDPYME ALTERNATIVA for 1,500 Peruvian soles. Gabriela is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. Her greatest dream is to become a beer distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beer to expand her business during the summer season

loans.name: Afde Group No. 19

texts.en:
Afde group No.19 is led by Ms. Maymouna D., aged 50.  Since her husband's retirement, she has been working as a vendor to make ends meet.  Like many women in the market, she sells palm oil and smoked fish.  Ms. Sarr D., aged 40, is the group's treasurer.  She also sells smoked fish, in addition to various vegetables and has been active in the trade for 17 years.  She is married and the mother of five. The other three members of the group are: Fatou Kébé, who has a small breakfast stall, Aissatou N. and Awa N. who sell vegetables.  Each member recieves a loan of 100,000 FCFA to reinforce their activities.

L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by twenty entrepenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.

loans.use: To finance her fish-selling business

loans.name: Faylus

texts.es:
Faylus es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Faylus es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 1 hija, Faylus trabaja junto a su mama que es naturista y preparan medicina natural a base de hierbas, actividad que realiza en su casa.
Faylus necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas y remedios.
Los sueños de Faylus son educar a su hija y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Faylus is a member of the community bank Fe (faith).

Faylus lives with her partner. She is 19 years old and has one daughter. Faylus works with her mother, who is a naturalist and prepares natural medicines based on herbs. She carries out this activity in her home.

Faylus needs a loan of 900 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of herbs and remedies.

Faylus' dreams are to educate her daughter and to advance herself.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase herbs and remedies

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos: Erick tiene 22 años, Jossimar tiene 19 años, José tiene 17 años y Darinka tiene 15 años. Irma vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Irma se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Irma tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de comida. La socia nos cuenta que acomodo una habitación de la casa para el restaurante donde prepara y vende almuerzo. Ya son 4 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Irma requiere el préstamo para ampliar el bar snack de su sobrino Frank, el local esta ubicado en la ciudad de Machupicchu. Irma desea comprar calaminas, mesas, vasos y decorar el bar.
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
(En la foto la socia esta acompañada de su sobrino)
texts.en:
Irma is a member of “PALCCARAQUI”, the communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 51 years old, married and has four children: Erick is 22, Jossimar is 19, José is 17 and Darinka is 15. Irma lives in Urubamba Province, department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is an hour and a half away from the city of Cusco. Irma gets up very early every day to start on her household chores, such as preparing breakfast and sending her younger children to school. Irma owns a small food business. She tells us that she fixed up a room in her house for the restaurant, where she prepares and sells lunch. She has run the business for 4 years, and it has gone well thanks to her effort and dedication. She has asked for the loan to expand the snack bar her nephew owns in Machu Picchu. She would like to buy corrugated iron, tables, glasses and décor for the snack bar. She is grateful for the opportunity extended to her and promises to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule. (One of Irma's nephews is with her in the picture.)

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irma requests the loan to expand the snack bar.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Timotea es soltera, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Timotea vende ropa variada en la feria de Las Americas, actividad que realiza los días domingos. Además Timotea vende hoja de coca que es utilizada por los campesinos con fines medicinales.
Timotea necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Timotea son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Timotea is a member of Fe Communal Bank. She is 45 years old, single and mother of three. Timotea sells a variety of clothing items at Las Americas Fair on Sundays. She also sells coca leaf, which people from the countryside use for medicinal purposes. She has asked for a loan of 1050 soles to buy clothing. Timotea’s dreams for the future are to build her own home and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, trabaja en una consultora y también en el restaurant de comida rápida  “pollos copacabana”.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz; vive en la casa de sus padres, pero es independiente ya que con su trabajo se solventa los gastos de alimentación, estudios y otros.
El crédito será destinado para salud (tratamiento completo de su vista y medición de lentes).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas. Con este crédito le podremos ayudar para que pueda desenvolverse bien en las actividades que realiza.
texts.en:
Enrique works at a consultancy firm and at Pollos Copacabana, a fast food restaurant. He lives in La Paz, in the area called Tembladerani. He lives at his parents' home, but earns his own living and is able to cover his own expenses for food, schooling and other necessities. He will use the loan for medical expenses (eye treatment and prescription for glasses). This is the second time he has requested a loan at Impro. According to his file, he has met his loan payments in the past. We hope that this loan will help him do well in his work and other activities.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover eye treatment and prescription for glasses.

loans.name: Afde Group No. 18

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by 20 entreprenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.  

Ms. Bafou S. is the president of Afde group No. 18.  Aged 35, she had worked at home cleaning and taking care of the house, but she decided about 10 years ago to try her hand at business.  Each member of the group recieves 100,000 FCFA for their activity.  Ms. Ndeye Marie D. and Ms. Die Djitté S. both sell fish, Ms Ngoye S. sells jewelry and clothing and Ms. Rokhaya N. sells juices and breakfast.

loans.use: To reinforce her business

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia, de 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Todos los días, Basilia sale junto a su inseparable triciclo a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, ella se ubica en las afueras del estadio principal de su ciudad, donde tiene muchos clientes. Es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprar más de lo que tenían que comprar.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para implementar una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda atender a sus clientes con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Basilia con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo; a su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Basilia, 44 years old, is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in a rented house, and what she wants the most is to get ahead in life. Everyday Basilia goes out along with her inseparable tricycle to sell her delicious candy. She situates herself outside the main stadium in her city, where she has many clients. She is a very persuasive seller and she always sweet talks her clients into buying more than they were meaning to. What she likes best in her job is chatting with her neighbour saleswomen. She has been working at this activity for 8 years and she considers that the hardest part is having to stand under the ruthless sun every day. For the future she hopes to put some money together and start a general store where she can better serve her clients. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows she has to meet the repayment terms in time. She is a very cheerful and supportive member of her Communal Bank. With the 500 PEN she requested she will purchase more candy to stock up her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (candy)

loans.name: Yoconda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Carmen es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta llamada Multiservicios San José, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de recordatorios.
Los sueños de Carmen son terminar de construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank "Fe" ["Faith"]. Carmen is married, she is 32 years old and has one son. Carmen and her husband own a printing business called Multiservicios San José ["Multiservices Saint Joseph"], in rented premises located in Ayacucho's city downtown area. Carmen needs a 2,100.00 PEN loan to purchase printed cards given by people to friends and relatives as mementos after baptisms, first communions, weddings and funeral services. Carmen dreams of finishing building her home and increasing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of printed cards

loans.name: Yesica Rocio

texts.es:
Yesica C. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña solo tiene luz como servicio básico su esposo es vulcanizador, con el tiene 1 hijo de un año tres meses.

Jessica comenzó hace 2 años atrás vendiendo bolos, hielo, colas para poder tener un ingreso e invertirlo en más productos. Poco a poco tuvo ingresos para poner una pequeña tienda en su casa. Ahora ella vende la libra de carnes a $ 2.5, la libra de pollos a $ 1.5, legumbres por unidad o libras, ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones es que la calle principal no esta pavimentada y las lluvias hacen lodo la calle. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, aceites, colas, jugos para tener más variedad en su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y así poder adecuar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesica C. is 36 years old and she lives in a suburban area located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cane and the only utility she has is electricity. Her husband works in a vulcanizing repair shop and together they have a son who is one year and three months old. Yesica began 2 years ago her business selling candy, ice and sodas to have some income and invest in more products. Little by little she earned enough to set up a small store in her home. Now she sells the pound of meat at $2.5, the pound of chicken $1.5, vegetables by units or by the pound... She works from 7 am to 22 pm every day. One of the main complications of her job is that the main street is unpaved and the rain turns it into mud. With the loan she wants to purchase canned goods, oil, soft drinks and juices to have more variety in her business. In a future she wants to own a house made of concrete and thus have a better business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: canned goods, oils, soft drinks...

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami C. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis le 23 janvier 2007 et y a bénéficié de 06 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle est vendeuse de légumes: carottes, choux, tomates, aubergines, patates etc... au marché de son quartier. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ami C. is a 42-year old woman who is married with eight children. She has been a member of the village bank in PETIT KANDE since 23rd January 2007 and has had six loans, which she has managed well and repaid. She sells vegetables: carrots, cabbages, tomatoes, aubergines, potatoes etc.. at the market in her neighborhood. Her aim is to support her husband in taking care of the family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Mame Ware

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Ware D. est une parente bénéficiaire membre de l’U-Imcec dans la  localité de  Camberene. Elle est âgée de 29ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse mais elle pratique aussi la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plusieurs années. Pour elle c’est  la rentabilité qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité. Les moments  de décompte de ses recettes lui procurent  un très grand plaisir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son commerce de petit déjeuner en achetant les produits de base à des prix plus compétitifs et  qui pourront être stockes. En même temps madame D. désire diversifier ses produits vendus en y impliquant les mèches et les produits pour cheveux. Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettent de supporter certains de ses besoins personnels.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Mame Ware D. is a member and a beneficiary of U-IMCEC (Union des Institutions Mutualistes Communautaires d'Epargne et de Crédit - a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) in the Camberene neighborhood. She is 29 years old, married and has one child. She is a hairdresser but she has also been selling breakfasts for several years. Profitability is what interests her most in her business. The moments when she is counting her income give her great pleasure. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs in order to strengthen her breakfast business by buying the basic products at more competitive prices and stockpiling them. At the same time Mrs D. would like to diversify the products she sells to include hairpieces and hair products. The income she generates from her business will allow her to cover certain of her personal needs. In its ongoing vision to participate actively to the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully helping people to carry out lucrative revenue generating activities, which in turn is contributing to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Tisma Group

texts.es:
María Nelisis C., José de la Concepción Chavarria y Maynor José P. O. decidieron que necesitaban de inversión en su negocio es así que vinieron Adim y conformaron un grupo al cual nombraron Tisma. 

María Nelisis C. tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en venta de ropa por encargo. Ella inicio con este por la ayuda de su comadre (la madrina de sus niños).

Esta joven de 21 años a su corta edad ha experimentado la pérdida de un hijo. Pero aun con el dolor de su perdida la cual se refleja en su mirada llena de lágrimas contenidas al hablar de ello sabe que necesita salir adelante por sus otros dos hijos de tres y un año.
 
Sus compañeros de grupo son conocidos de ella desde hace años los cuales la han apoyado ellos son José de la Concepción Chavarria que vende chinelas y Maynor José P. O. desde muy joven se dedica al destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
María Nelisis C., José de la Concepción Chavarria ,and Maynor José P. O. decided they needed an investment in their business; so they came to ADIM and formed a group which they named Tisma.

María Nelisis C. has a small business that consists of the resale of clothing she has purchased based on orders from her customers. She began this with the help of her midwife (the godmother of her children).

María is a young person, 21 years old, but at her young age she has experienced the loss of a son. Even with the pain of this loss, which is reflected in eyes that fills with tears when she speaks of him, she knows that she needs to get ahead for the sake of her other two children, ages three and one.

She has been acquainted with the other members of the group through the years in which they have supported her. They are José de la Concepción Chavarria, who sells slippers, and Maynor José P. O. who, from a very young age, has engaged in the butchering of hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing clothing

loans.name: Ely

texts.es:
Ely, de 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada junto a su querido hijo y lo que más desea es brindarle un buen futuro.
Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños. Desde muy joven incursionó en este trabajo y ahora tiene su propio taller de confecciones donde elabora prendas infantiles, la cuales posteriormente lleva a vender a su puesto, donde son compradas rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta a Ely de su trabajo es confeccionar prendas para los niños más pequeños, ya que le causan mucha ternura, lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es darle el acabado a las prendas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado y paciencia. 
Para el futuro, espera comprar mejor maquinaria y aumentar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Ely con MFP, está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Ely, 32 years old, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in a rental house with her beloved son and what she most desires is to offer him a good future. Her business is making children's clothes.
