When she was very young, she became involved in this work and now, she has her own sewing shop where she makes outfits for infants, which she then takes to her stall and they are rapidly purchased. What Ely likes most about her work is to make outfits for the smallest infants, becuase they create tender feelings. She has been doing this work for 6 years and the most difficult part is finishing the outfits, which requires much care and patience. In the future, she hopes to buy a better sewing machine and increase her production. This is Ely's first loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time, since she wishes to borrow again in the future. She is a very active member of her communal bank who feels solidarity with other members. With the 1,000 New Sols she is requesting she will buy new materials so she can make a larger quantity of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TEXTILES FOR SEWING INFANT OUTFITS

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato es socio del Banco Comunal Fe.
Fortunato es casado, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Fortunato tiene una peluquería en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Fortunato junto a su esposa se dedican a la medicina natural.
Fortunato necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas.
Los sueños de Fortunato son terminar de construir su casa y comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a member of the communal bank "Fe" (Fe.) He is married, 55 years old and has 6 children. Fortunato has a hair-dressing salon in his home, and he carries out this activity every day. In addition, Fortunato, along with his wife, has a natural medicine business. Fortunato needs a loan of 1,650 Peruvian soles that he will invest in the purchase of herbs. Fortunato dreams of finishing the construction on his house and buying a car so that his son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy herbs

loans.name: Unicas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS  UNICAS POR SIEMPRE esta en su segundo ciclo D. su credito en el primer ciclo sacaron un monto D. 18000 Bolivianos con 12 socias, y actualmente en fecha del 22 D. Diciembre del 2009 se desembolsó un nuevo crédito a 13 socias,  con pagos quincenales y para 12 cuotas, es un banco que tiene un historial crediticia bueno desD. el primer ciclo, toda las socias asisten puntualmente a las reuniones que se realizan en la oficinas a horas 15:00 PM. D. la tarD..

La señora Evelin vive en el Barrio Noel Kemf Mercado en la Zona del Plan 3000 en la casa D. su padre, es concubina y tiene 2 hijos, en la misma casa tiene una venta D. abarrotes, que D. esta manera ella cuadyuba en el bienestar D. su familia tiene muchas perspectivas D. hacerles estudiar a sus hijos y con el primer prestamo invirtio en su tienda mejoro mucho donD. compro 3 estantes y con el segundo credito lo utilizo para la compra D. productos como arroz, fideo, jabon hace,.etc,.etc.

La Señora Ruth que es la presidenta del Banco D. emprendimiento, que  se dedica a la venta D. Ropa interior, compra D. la Feria del Barrio lindo al por mayor y lo venD. anbulando Bario por Barrio y casa por casa y deja al credito D. esta manera invirtio el credito que se lo otorga, segun lo que manifiesta que lo ayudo mucho por que ya no tenia capital por que se lo habia comido y con la ayuda D. la institucion nueva mente recobro su negocio.

La señora Sonia  es una socia antigua que se dedica a la venta D. verduras que lo compra del abasto, ella tiene un puesto en el mercadito  bien venido D. la Villa primero D. Mayo tiene su concubino, dos hijos D. esta manera ella ayuda a su familia sus hijos aun son pequeños, con el segundo credito que se lo otorgo aumento a su capital; ahora ya compra en un volumen mas granD..   							

Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Las Unicas por Siempre (The Only Ones Forever) Enterprise Bank is in its second loan cycle. In the first cycle the 12 members took out a loan of 18,000 bolivianos. The group's current loan was disbursed on December 22, 2009 to 13 group members. They will repay this loan in 12 bi-weekly installments. The bank has had a good credit record since the first cycle. The members are punctual in their attendance at meetings held at the office at 3:00 p.m. Evelin lives in the Noel Kemf Mercado section, the Plan 3000 Zone, in her father’s house. She has 2 children from a common-law marriage. From that house she sells groceries, so as to help support her family. She has plans for her children to study. She invested the first loan in her store, making improvements such as the purchase of 3 shelving units. She used the second loan to buy commodities such as rice, pasta, soap, etc. Ruth is president of the Enterprise Bank. Her business is selling underwear. She buys wholesale at the Barrio Lindo bazaar, then goes house to house through the neighborhoods selling on credit. This is how she spent the loan given her, which was a great help, since her working capital had been used up. With the help of the institution, she recovered her business. Sonia is a long-time member who sells produce she buys from the El Abasto Market. She has a place in the little market in May 1st Villa. She has a common-law husband and two small children. She helps her family this way. She used the second loan to increase her working capital, and she now buys in greater quantities. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in extending credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”,  Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. Margarita, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desde hace 04 años atrás, que viene dedicándose a la  venta de chupetes, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  Nos cuenta que hoy en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Margarita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres del 2000” in the district and province of Lamas, department of San Martín. She is 37, living with her husband and 3 dependent children. Margarita is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling popsicles from her own home. She provides a well-equipped atmosphere for her clients who come by from day to day for her richly-flavored popsicles. She tells us that she is currently very happy because her business is going so well. With this loan of $475 she will buy the ingredients she uses to make her product, such as kilos of sugar, cartons of milk, and the fruits she needs every day for the preparation of the lollypops. She needs an assortment of products in order to win the best clientele. Margarita feels strengthened to keep working and persevering day by day, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in the middle of their circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make popsicles

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: El señor Marvin R. Solís de 35 años tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual por medio de los préstamos ha ido creciendo. El invertirá el préstamo en productos para la venta como granos básicos, champú, jabón, carne, verduras, especies, detergentes etc.
texts.en:
Señor Marvin R. Solís, 35 years old, has a small grocery store which has been growing through loans. He will invest this loan in products to sell such as bulk grains, shampoo, soap, meat, vegetables, spices, detergents, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bulk grains, meat, candy, other basic products

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo, de 62 años, es un hombre que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida. Vive en una habitación alquilado y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Su negocio está ubicado en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca. Él se dedica a la venta de gorras y le va muy bien, aunque sabe que sólo con ese trabajo no le alcanza para mantenerse, así que en sus tiempos libres trabaja en una empresa de estampados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años dedicado al comercio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Hugo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más gorros para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Hugo, 62, is a man who has worked hard throughout his life in order to succeed. He lives in a rented home and what he most desires is to have a tranquil old-age. His business is located in one of the most important markets in the city of Juliaca. He sells caps and his business is going very well, although he knows that this business is not sufficient to support him so in his free time he works for a printing firm. What he likes most about his work is to converse with customers. He has had this business for 10 years and what he considers most difficult is to have to stay in his stand all day waiting for customers. Over time, he hopes that his business will grow and will be able to provide a better income. This is Hugo's first loan with MFP; he knows that he must make the payments on time and he is ready to do this. In his communal bank he is well respected by the other members. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles that he requests he will buy more caps to better supply his sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (to buy more caps)

loans.name: Sda Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA (Seventh Day Adventist) Primary School, Makeni. SDA Primary School, Makeni was founded in 1978 by the SDA Mission to use education as a vehicle for spreading the Adventist message. They train young boys in the morals and ethics of the Adventist Mission.

SDA Primary School suffered a lot of setbacks over the past years. However, with the intervention of Mr. Benjamin K. as the new headmaster at the school, the school has experienced vast improvements. The new administration under the leadership of Benjamin K. has been able to buy benches for classes five and six through school fees subsidies and development funds. The school has also been able to hire two security guards to keep thieves at bay. And for the first time in the history of the school, it has been able to organize athletics for the pupils. This has added popularity and fame to the school.

This will be the second loan SDA Primary School will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. (See their journal update through the following link: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=96443.)

Teachers from this institution, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Benjamin M. K. is the head teacher at the school. Thirty-eight-year-old Benjamin (left) is married to a student and they have one child who is still not of school-going age. Benjamin was born in Makeni city. With his share of the loan, he will buy house-building materials – cement, rods, iron, corrugated tin, etc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Ruben vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Ruben tiene 49 años, es casado y tiene un hijo. Ruben y su esposa Juana se dedican a la venta de verdura, Ellos envían sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado como por ejemplo zapallo, zanahorias, asnapa, lechuga y muchos más. El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y después sembrarlas.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rubén belongs to the community bank PALCCARAQUI of the Arariwa Association. He lives in the Urubanba province of the Cusco region. The city of Urubamba is an hour and a half from the city of Cusco.

Rubén is 49 years old, is married, and has one child. Rubén and his wife Juana sell vegetables. They send their products to the city of Puerto Maldonado; their products include, for example, squash, carrots, aromatic herbs, lettuce, and much more. This community bank member is a hard-working father. He has already worked in this business for several years, and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the effort that he puts into his work.

Rubén needs a loan to buy more seeds and then plant them. He is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan and he promises to make the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more seeds and plant them

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, en la region Piura, ubicado a tres horas y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo labora como pescador, pero como esta actividad no tiene suficiente estabilidad debido a las temporadas de veda, ella tuvo que empezar hace nueve años un negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene instalado un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio y tambien distribuye pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan con anticipación.

Marianela se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio.

Ella es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, sus clientes y vecinos la aprecian mucho y siempre recurren a ella cuando necesitan ayuda. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria e instalar un pequeño puesto de venta en la ciudad de Piura.
texts.en:
Marianela is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their 3 children in the Catacaos district in the Piura region, located 3 hours and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband works as a fisherman, but this activity does not generate enough stability due to the seasons when the government prohibits fishing. Nine years ago, she had to begin a business selling clothing for women, men and children. She has a small store in her house, and she also distributes orders from her customers that she takes in advance. Marianela is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time. She will use the money to buy more products to expand her business. She is a responsible and enterprising woman; her customers and neighbors appreciate her very much and always turn to her when they need help. Her greatest desire is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have a small sales stand in the city of Piura.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina tiene 42 años, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.
Gracias a la venta de gas ha podido salir adelante, ella tiene una planta distribuidora muy grande y sus principales clientes son los restaurantes de la ciudad, donde diariamente deja cerca de 50 balones de gas. Ella trabaja para una empresa de gas, pero es quien maneja la distribución y la cantidad que se vende.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es repartir los balones de gas, ya que muchas veces usa una moto para dejar los pedidos. Lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados balones, pero ya está acostumbrada a ello.
Con el tiempo, espera poner tener sucursales en lugares más céntricos y comerciales en su localidad, y así poder abarcar un mercado más grande.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Segundina con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará más balones de gas para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Segundina is 42 years old, and is a very hard worker. She lives in a rented room and wishes to improve her quality of life. Thanks to selling gas, she has been able to get ahead. She has a large distributing plant and her main clients are restaurants in the city, to whom she delivers nearly 50 canisters a day. She works for a gas company, but is the one who handles the distribution and the amount that is sold. What she likes most about her work is distributing the gas canisters, and often uses a motorcycle to deliver the orders. She has 10 years of experience in her business, and considers the most difficult part to be loading the heavy canisters, although she is already used to it. With time, she hopes to have more branches in more central and commercial areas within her town, and thus to be able to cover a larger market. This is Segundina’s sixth loan with MFP, and she is saving to make her payments on time, as she is very happy with her community bank and does not want to cause problems for its members. With the thousand Nuevos Soles she asks for now, she will buy more gas canisters in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos; Juan de 15 y Sandra de 4 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
A más 5,400 m.s.n.m., en la mina La Rinconada se encuentra el negocio de Martha, ella se dedica a la venta de libros y CDs, los cuales lleva desde la ciudad de Juliaca. Su negocio marcha muy bien y tiene mucha demanda, ya que no tiene competencia y sus clientes ya la conocen y la prefieren.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace muy bien, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en esta zona minera. 
Para más adelante, espera implementar una tienda donde pueda vender con más comodidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Martha con MFP y está muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito, por lo que espera poder pagarlo a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más libros para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Martha, 35, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in a rented house with her two children; Juan is 15, and Sandra is 4. What she wants most of all is to succeed in life. At more than 5,400 meters above sea level, Martha’s business can be found in the La Rinconada mine. She sells books and CDs, which she brings from the city of Juliaca. Her business is going very well, and there is a lot of demand because she does not have competition. Her customers know her and prefer her. On the other hand, what she likes best about her work is selling, and she does it very well. She has been doing this for seven years. The most difficult part is putting up with the intense cold in this mining area. Later, she hopes to set up a store where she can sell more comfortably. This is Martha’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy for the opportunity of the loan, and she expects to be able to pay it on time. In her communal bank she is much loved for the responsibility that she demonstrates. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more books to better set up her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Willam

texts.es:
William, de 42 años, es un padre muy trabajador y sincero, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su querido hijo Raúl, de 8 años, y lo que más quiere es darle unos buenos estudios.
La actividad a la que William se dedica es la elaboración y venta de CDs educativos. En un pequeño taller, implementado en su cuarto, graba los discos, diseña la tapa y la caja donde irán, y así tiene listo todo el producto. Todas las mañanas sube a los autobuses interprovinciales con destino a la ciudad de Azangaro y vende su novedosa y educativa mercadería
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar el estampado a los CDs, pues como él mismo dice “le pone su sello personal”. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que conseguir los discos educativos, ya que últimamente están muy escasos. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos.

Este es el primer préstamo de William con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad, por lo que está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de material para la elaboración de sus CDs.
texts.en:
William, 42, is a hard-working and sincere father. He lives in a rented room with his dear son, eight year old Raúl. What he wants most of all is to give him a good education. William makes and sells educational CDs. In a small workshop, which is set up in his room, he records discs and designs the covers and the cases where they go. That way he has the whole product ready. Every morning he gets on the inter-provincial buses headed to the city of Azangaro, and he sells his original and educational merchandise. What he likes most about the work he does is making the design for the CDs. As he says, “he adds his personal stamp”. He has been doing this for eight years. The most difficult part is having to get the educational discs because they are very scarce lately. Later, he hopes to have a store where he can sell his products more comfortably. This is William’s first loan with MFP. He is very happy for the opportunity of the loan, and he is prepared to make his payments on time. He is much loved in his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN he is requesting to buy a greater quantity of material to make his CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make his educational CDs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La señora Marisol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y es madre de 04 hijas, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Marisol, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, lleva 03 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Poblado Wayku – Lamas, frente a la Plaza Céntrica - Wayku, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son turistas, que vienen de otros países a consumir y apreciar, nuestras  riquezas artesanales. Marisol, se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y dar a sus 02 hijos, una buena educación.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su local artesanal, a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma y la amabilidad que siempre le ha caracterizado. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará artesanías como: adornos, chunchos malcriados, monos, chozas.  Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para confeccionar artesanías como: huairuros, choloques, wuasais, cola artesanal, chuño.Marisol, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de 2000" in the district and province of Lamas, department of San Martín. She is 39 and lives with her spouse and her 2 children who are still dependent. She has been selling handicrafts for 3 years, located in the town center of Wayku – Lamas across from the main plaza. She has a well-equipped shop where she attends to her clients, the majority of whom are tourists who come from other countries to enjoy and purchase our rich handicraft heritage. Marisol is very happy with the work she is doing since she is a very hard-working woman who works every day to achieve her dream of giving her 2 children a good education. She already has a faithful clientele who come to her every day to shop, and she attends them personally with the charisma and friendliness that has always characterized her. With this loan of $725, she will buy local handicrafts such as "adornos", "chunchos malcriados", "monos", and "chozas". She will also use some of the money to buy seeds to create handicrafted pieces called "huairuros", "choloques", "wuasais", "cola artesanal", and "chuños". Today she considers herself a satisfied woman, very motivated to make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her business, as well as helping so many women to want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of handicrafts to stock her shop

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the "Na We Cam" Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each) to enable them to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Ramatu K. on the right is the leader of this group. 50-year-old (approximately) Mariatu is a widow with 8 children between the ages of 12 – 35. For 6 years now, Ramatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fabricated designs). With her share of this loan, she will buy two lengths of white cotton (30 yards make a length), inks, caustic soda, powder and will pay experts to make designs on the white cloth.

loans.use: Buy 2 lengths of white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder, and pay designers

loans.name: Honesty Group

texts.en:
These are member of the 'Honesty' group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to improve their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, these entrepreneurs will be able to attract many more customers, make more sales, and earn more profit. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Bai K. who is second from left. The 27-year-old is single with one primary-school-going child. Bai has been running a Tele-Center for 3 years now. In his Tele-Center, he sells top-up cards for all 5 mobile phone companies–Africell, Commiun, Sierratel, Tigo, and Zain. He also recharges mobile phone batteries for a fee of SLL 1,000 and sells mobile phone accessories like chargers, spare mobile phone batteries, etc. Bai has applied for this loan in order to buy top-up cards and chargers to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy top-up cards and mobile phone chargers

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es: El señor Jose Elmer P. M. tiene 51  años de edad, vive en el Barrio Waspan Norte, es casado y su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio mientras él anda realizando trabajos de albañilería, él tiene una pequeña venta de queso y cosméticos, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 23 años el cual actualmente trabaja y la menor de 14 años que estudia la escuela secundaria, el mayor anhelo del señor P. sería el terminar de edificar su casa, el educar y preparar a su hija menor y poder hacer evolucionar su negocio para que un dia solo depender de el, para esto solicita un prestamo que le brinde los recursos económicos para elevar las ventas y tener mayores ganacias.
texts.en:
Jose Elmer P. M. is 51, and he lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. He is married, and his wife helps him tend the business while he is doing his work as a bricklayer. He has a small business selling cheese and cosmetics. They have two children. One is 23 and is currently working. The younger one is 14, and she goes to high school. Mr. Peralt’s greatest desires are to finish building his house, to educate and prepare his youngest daughter, and to be able to develop his business so that one day they can rely solely on the business. That is why he is requesting a loan to give him the economic resources to increase sales and have greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese

loans.name: Teresita Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Teresita, inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, abarrotes en general, leña, verduras, frutas, ropas.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Martha que es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además se dedica a L. agricultura en sus tierras D. L. selva.

Mientras que Diana es soltera, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Diana venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo sus ventas son al por mayor y menor. Diana tiene proyectado aperturar un restaurante.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,550 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, papeles, leña, carne, ropa variada, frutas, verduras. 

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio propio, aumentar sus ingresos y comprar mas exhibidores para su tienda.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Teresita begins its second cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses such as food sales, general store, firewood, vegetables, fruits and clothing. As an example, Martha lives with her partner, is 36 and has four children, her general store is in her house and she sells general merchandise, vegetables, meat, she also works in agriculture in her lands located in the jungle. Diana on the other hand, is single, 30, has two children and sells beauty products through catalog, her sales are both retail and wholesale. Diana has a project to open a restaurant. The members need different loan amounts in soles currency such as $300, $600, and $1,050 for a total of $8,550 soles in loans from the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in purchasing rice, sugar, paper, firewood, meat, assorted clothing, fruits, vegetables. The members’ dreams are that their children become professionals, have a business of their own, increase their income and purchase more displayers for their store.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, paper, firewood, meat, assorted clothing, fruits, vegetables

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora María Magdalena Terrasas es una madre de familia que sola ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es divorciada además es una cliente distinguida de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente había solicitado un crédito para la compra de material para la elaboración de piñatas ya que le habían encargado un pedido grande, y sus pagos siempre se realizaron con puntualidad, por tal motivo nuevamente esta tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas material para la elaboración y venta de sus piñatas.
texts.en:
Señora María Magdalena Terrasas is the head of her family, struggling alone to get her family ahead since she is divorced. She is a distinguished client of our institution, having previously taken a loan to purchase materials to create piñatas for which she already had a large order. She always made her payments punctually, and now she is applying for this current loan in order to purchase more supplies for the creation and sale of her piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for the creation and sale of piñatas

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión se  formó en la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el viaje hacia Cumbe  la naturaleza nos regala una hermosa  vista  de la belleza de su tierra en su estado natural, sus habitantes mayores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería ya que los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad o al extranjero en busca  nuevas y mejores fuentes de empleo. Nuestras socias son personas muy amables y buscan lo mejor para mejorar su situación económica.

La señora  María V. es una de las socias nuevas  del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión, vive en el Sector la Floresta en la  parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 30  años y es madre soltera de una niña de diez años que no es reconocida por el padre, la casa en la que habita es de sus padres y aporta un poco económicamente a los gastos del hogar.

María se dedica a la cría de vacas, borregos, cuyes, pollos, éstos  los vende en la feria de su parroquia los días miércoles, también entrega su producción de  leche a los carros lecheros que pasan por allí.

Invitada por una  amiga formó parte del banco comunal y éste es su primer crédito en la fundación, con el va a comprar una vaca lechera.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Libia Enríquez es otra de las socias nuevas  del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión,  ella vive en la parroquia  Cumbe con sus cinco hijos y su esposo que se dedica a la construcción de casas, juntos han logrado construir su casa propia.


Nuestra socia comparte su tiempo entre los quehaceres del hogar y la cría de cuyes y borregos, y con el crédito solicitado va a invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, pagar  deudas por la compra de útiles escolares que adquirió para el ingreso a clases.

Su sueño es dar a sus hijos una educación de primera hasta que lleguen a ser profesionales porque considera que la educación es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión ["New Hope"] was created in the Cumbe parish. This area is located about 30 minutes from Cuenca city. In the trip to Cumbe nature gifts us with a splendid view of the beauty of this land in its natural state. Its older inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock breeding, while the younger ones moved to the big city or abroad in search of new and better forms of employment. Our Bank members are very nice women and they look for the best possibilities to improve their economic situation. Ms. María V. is one of the new members of the Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión. She lives in the Floresta sector of the Cumbe parish. She is 30 years old and she is a single mom of a ten years old girl that the father would not own. She lives in her parents' home and she contributes a little to the household expenses. María breeds cows, sheep, rabbits and chicken. She sells these in the weekly parish market on Wednesdays. She also delivers her milk production to the milk carts that pass by. She was invited by a friend to take part in the Communal Bank and this his her first loan with the foundation. With it she will purchase a milk cow. Her dream is to have a house of her own. Libia Enríquez is another new member of the Communal Bank Nueva Ilusión. She lives in Cumbe parish with her five children and her husband, who works in construction. Together they have built their own home. Our member shares her time between the household chores and breeding rabbits and sheep. With the requested loan she will invest in her children's education and pay back some debts she owes for the purchase of school material she bought for them to start their classes. Her dream is to give her children a first rate education until they become white collar workers because she considers that education is the best inheritance she can leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Ntowor Group

texts.en:
Ntowor is a group of five borrowers, led by J. S., who live and work in Westpoint, a very poor neighborhood near downtown Monrovia, Liberia. J. is 42 years old and married with five children aged 15-30. He also cares for his siblings. J. is a 7th grade dropout who had to leave school early because he couldn't afford to pay school fees.

J.’ business is a hardware shop. He buys building tools and materials such as locks, nails, glue, wood planks, etc. at wholesale and then sells them to the residents of Westpoint in a small shop. He has been running his business for 20 years. His dream is to expand his business and build a proper storefront. J. sells from a table in the street now. J. is requesting a loan to buy more hardware and building materials to serve his customers in Westpoint. With the profits from his business, he dreams of sending his children to school so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy hardware and building supplies for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco B. V., tiene la edad de 45 años, es soltero, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 18,20 y 21 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de novillas de engorde, ya que el está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así cuando las venda obtener una ganancia.Aparte del negocio del ganado, él se dedica a la agricultura, también a los cerdos y pollos de engorde. Es la primera vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Francisco B. V. is 45, single and has three children that are his number one priority. The childrens' ages are 18, 20 and 21. The loan is to purchase calves to raise them, as he is sure that he can take good care of them and obtain a profit when they are sold. In addition to the cattle business, he also works in agriculture, as well as raising pigs and chickens. This is the first time that he requests a loan from FUDECOSUR, he mentions that the credit committee has helped him a lot, because thanks to their help he has been able to get ahead with the different projects that he has planned, he is happy with the services that they provided. He hopes that in the future he can be able to provide his children with a better quality of life and economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Calves

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El señor Fausto es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le había otorgado un crédito para mejora de su vivienda y sus pagos fueron muy puntuales ahora esta tramitando un nuevo crédito para terminar la construcción del portal del frente de su casa.El es pensionado y labora para un centro comercial en el area de empacador.
texts.en:
Señor Fausto is a distinguished client of our institution who was previously granted a loan to improve his home, and his payments were always punctual. Now he is applying for a new loan in order to complete the construction of the front patio of his house. He is a pensioner who also works as a packer in the commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete the front patio of his house

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes G. a la edad de 27 años posee una pulpería que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación en la que ofrece productos perecederos así como granos básicos, gaseosas, leña entre otros, de este modo puede solventar los gastos y educación de sus tres hijos menores.
Solicita el crédito con CEPRODEL ya que quiere agrandar un poco más su negocio para darle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes G. is 27 years old and manages a grocery store in her home. She offers perishable products, as well as basic grains, soft drinks, firewood, and other items. This enables her to cover her household expenses and pay for the education of her three dependent children.

Mercedes is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can expand her store a little bit and provide her family better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana C. es una cliente distinguida de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le había otorgado un crédito para un asunto medico y sus pagos se pagaron siempre con puntualidad, actualmente esta solicitando un crédito para mejora de su vivienda para pintar su casa y remodelar el cuarto de baño, para una mayor comodidad de su familia. Ella labora para una empresa como operadora y su esposo el señor Luis Eduardo Limon también trabaja para una fabrica como empleado desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
Señora Adriana C. is a distinguished client of our institution who was previously granted a loan for a medical matter, and her payments were always made punctually. Currently she is requesting a loan to improve her home by painting the house and remodeling the bathroom, for the increased comfort of her family. She works for a company as an operator, and her husband Señor Luis Eduardo Limon has also worked in a factory for the last 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint for her house and to remodel the bathroom

loans.name: Adith

texts.es: La Sra. Adith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5:00pm. Lleva 8 años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Adith, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Adith is a member of the Las Chankas Communal Bank, in the Lamas district and province, San Martín department. She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are her dependents and currently students. The fighting spirit that is her nature, along with her desire to succeed by her own means, have served her in setting up her own business. She sells anticuchos (spiced meat kabobs) in the area near her home, and has become well known to her customers. She states that things are going well with her business. She starts selling each day at 5:00 p.m. She has been in this business for 8 years and is happy with the work. With this 1,000 sol loan, she will buy supplies, such as bags of rice, eggs, chickens, and offals for her anticuchos, as well as cooking utensils, to as to offer quality service. Adith is happy and content in her work and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for its contribution to her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: El Control (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Control se encuentra ubicado en el sector de Punta Corral a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una comunidad  donde se puede disfrutar a cada paso de su belleza natural,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales.

Carmelina R. es socia del banco comunal El Control, vive en el sector de Punta Corral, tiene 45 años de edad, se divorcio de su primer compromiso  hace 18 años por la irresponsabilidad de su cónyuge  con quien procreo 5 hijos que se encuentran entre 26 y 20 años de edad todos trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar,  ahora tiene un nuevo compromiso del que concibió cuatro hijos de 16,14,13 y 10 años, entre sus hijos mayores y su esposo  mantienen el hogar,  su actual esposo trabaja como oficial de construcción, con el esfuerzo de toda la familia han logrado construir su casa propia.

Carmen  es comerciante vende verduras que ella misma cultiva y cuando le falta adquiere a los mayoristas en el mercado de la Feria Libre los miércoles, sábados y domingos, lleva veinte años en ésta labor  y nos comenta que a veces se vende toda la mercadería pero otras no y  tiene que regresarse casi con todo. 

Ya formo parte del banco comunal hace cuatro años pero se retiro y  regreso hace dos ciclos por los beneficios que ofrece  la institución,  los prestamos le han beneficiado para sacar a su familia adelante y el  nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir  en  la compra de semillas y verduras como tomate, cebolla, zanahoria, etc., hasta que pueda cosechar sus productos.

Su sueño es ver a todos sus hijos  estudiar y que se superen  día a día.

Mary M. tiene 26 años  es una socia muy alegre de su  banco comunal, ella  vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral  con su hijo de cuatro años y su esposo que  trabaja como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá y ayudan a los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia comparte su tiempo entre ser madre, ama de casa, esposa y criar chanchos para venderlos en la feria libre del ganado o a sus vecinos de la comunidad, este es su primer ciclo en el banco comunal y con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar crías de chanchos, afrechillo y vitaminas para su crianza.

Su meta es incrementar su criadero de chanchos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Control” is located in the region of Punta Corral, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of Cuenca. It is a community where people can enjoy its natural beauty. The inhabitants of this area grow crops and raise animals in order to earn a living.

Carmelina R. is a member of the Communal Bank “El Control” and lives in the region of Punta Corral. She is 45 years old and divorced her first husband after 18 years of marriage because of his irresponsibility. They had five children who range in age from 20 to 26 years of age. They all work and help with the household expenses. Carmelina and her current husband have four children (ages 16, 14, 13, and 10). The older children and her husband help with maintaining the household. Carmelina’s husband works as a construction supervisor. As a result of the efforts of the entire family, they have been able to build their own home.

Carmen is a vegetable merchant who grows her own produce as needed when she is not able to acquire merchandise in bulk. She sells at the open air market on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Carmen has been in this business for twenty years and says that sometimes she sells all of her inventory and other times has to return almost everything. She joined the Communal Bank four years ago, but she left the group and returned for the last two loan cycles offered by the Institution. The loans have benefited her family and have helped them get ahead. She will use her new loan to purchase vegetable seeds to grow tomatoes, onions, carrots, etc. Her dream is to see all of her children study and improve day after day.

Mary M. is one of the more cheerful members of her Communal Bank. She lives in the region of Punta Corral with her four year old son and her husband who works as a mason. They do not have their own home, so they live with her mother and contribute toward the household expenses. Mary divides her time between being a mother, wife, and homemaker. She raises pigs to sell at the livestock fair and to neighbors in her community. This is the first loan cycle that she is participating in with the Communal Bank and will use her loan to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins. Her goal is to raise more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for various agricultural businesses

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa Pérez es esposa del señor Leopoldo Regalado y son clientes distinguidos de nuestra institución ya que han tenido dos créditos anteriormente para mejora de su hogar y son muy responsable para sus pagos, el labora para el gobierno y ella tiene un pequeño negocio de abarrotes. Y están tramitando por tercera ocasión para la mejora de su vivienda ya que desea impermeabilizar el techo ya que por la temporada de lluvia se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Pérez is the wife of Mr. Leopoldo Regalado. They are distinguished clients of our institution who have previously taken out two loan in order to improve their home, and they are very responsible with their payments. He works for the government, and she runs a small grocery store. They are applying for a third home improvement loan. They now wish to waterproof the roof because it has deteriorated due to the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La señora María Leticia G. es casada con el señor Roberto Vega Moreno quien labora para un taxi donde el es propietario; ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, son clientes distinguidos de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se les había otorgado un crédito para cambiar el techo de su casa colocando una losa de concreto, actualmente esta solicitando para la impermeabilización de su hogar ya que con esta temporada de lluvias se ha deteriorado el techo.
texts.en:
María Leticia G. is married to Roberto Vega Moreno. He works as a taxi driver, and is the owner of his own taxi company. She has a business selling second hand clothes. They are distinguished clients of our institution. They previously received a loan to change the ceiling on their house and install a concrete slab. She is currently requesting a loan to waterproof her home because this rainy season has deteriorated the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of her house

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 46-year-old woman. She is married with five kids who are all in school. Hannah is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard to provide her kids with a quality education for better careers in the future. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to save more to finance her kids’ school fees. Hannah has been in business for 15 years now.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lesbia Mayerly

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Mayerly P. C., de 30 años de edad, es casada y su esposo le apoya en el negocio, ellos tienen 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 4 años todos estudian, la señora P. es técnico de refrigeración desde hace 5 años, uno de los mayores sueños que posee la señora P. es el lograr tener su ropia casa y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos un negocio en donde ellos se abran paso hacia una vida laboral, ella inicio su negocio con el capital que ganaba como asalariada en la Curacao (Tienda de Electrodómesticos), poseteriormente y con el trabajo insesable, la señora pudo independizarse y lograr montar su propio negocio, pero ahora ha planeado inyectarle un mayor capital para la compra de marteria prima e instrumentos para trabajar con mejor agiliddad, comodidad y seguridad en su taller de refrigeración, con esta ayuda la familia pordría cambiar la manera de vivir y subsisitir ante los grandes desafíos que enfrentara con sus hijos debido a la edad de adolecencia que atraviesan actualmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesbia Mayerly P. C. is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 11, 9, and 4) who are enrolled in school. Her husband helps with her business. Lesbia has been working as a refrigeration technician for the past five years. One of her biggest dreams is to own a house and provide her children with a business where they will be able to work.

She started her business using capital she saved from her salary working at “Curacao” (an appliance store) and eventually became independent. Now that she has built her business, she has plans to inject more capital so that she can purchase materials and instruments so that she can work more efficiently, comfortably, and securely in her repair shop. With the help of her family, she has been able to achieve this lifestyle change. Her children are approaching adolescence, so she has to deal with those challenges as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & materials for her refrigeration business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children. Currently all her children are in school. She sells smoked fish. She started her fish sales 20 years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She also sells sachet mineral water. Her children sell the water chilled in an ice chest by the roadside when school is closed. She has a high customer base as a result of her moderate prices and her good reception towards her customers. She requests a loan to upgrade her stock of fish and buy some new bags of water. She dreams of giving her children a quality education using the proceeds from the business and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquingue (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La señora  María O. es socia del banco comunal Maluay este banco esta formado por mujeres emprendedoras que buscan día a día la superación personal y familiar, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Maluay a  unos 30 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca donde la mayoría de su población se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y papas.

María se encuentra casada y ha procreado dos  hijos que se encuentran de 10 y 7 años actualmente están cursando la educación primaria en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja elaborando estucos (cielos rasos para tumbados de casa), con su esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia

A más de los quehaceres del hogar  María se dedica a la cría de  pollos y chanchos, esta actividad realiza desde que era pequeña y lo  aprendió de su familia. Sus animales los comercializa a los negociantes que van a su comunidad y con la venta de éstos aporta económicamente y ayuda a su esposo en la atención del hogar.

Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y se entero de los beneficios que ofrece la  institución por su sobrina;  con el crédito que reciba va a comprar pollos, maíz, y vitaminas para su crecimiento y sacar adelante su pollería.

Su mayor sueño es darles el mejor estudio a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales. 

María C. es  otra socia del banco comunal Curiquinge tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco, tiene 56 años, casada y madre de seis hijos, cinco de ellos adultos que formaron sus propias familias, ella vive en la comunidad Conchan de Milagros con su hija de 15 años y su esposo que  trabaja en el arte de la construcción y gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Este es su primer crédito y  con el espera comprar arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, jabón, caramelos, pan, colas, etc. para abastecer su pequeña tienda en la que atiende desde las 06H00 a 21H00 todos los días, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas que las vende cuando tiene algún apuro económico.

Su sueño es que su hija siga estudiando hasta que logre su titulo profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. María O. is a member of the Maluay Communal Bank, which was formed by a group of enterprising women who try every day to improve themselves and their families. The bank is located in the community of Maluay, which is about 30 minutes away from the city of Cuenca. The majority of the residents grow corn, beans, and potatoes.

María is married and has two children, ages 10 and 7, who attend elementary school in her community. Her husband prepares stucco used on the ceilings of houses. With great effort, María and her husband built their own home.

In addition to her household chores, María raises chickens and pigs. Her family taught her this skill when she was a young girl. The animals are sold to traders who pass through her community. The sale of these animals provides financial support and helps her husband focus on their home.

This is her first loan from the Foundation. She learned about the benefits offered by the Institution from her niece. With this loan, she will purchase chickens, corn, and vitamins for the growth and success of her chicken farm. Her greatest dream is to provide her children with the best education and see them become outstanding professionals.

María C. is another member of the Maluay Communal Bank. She has established good friendships with all of the other members. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of six children, five of whom are grown and have their own families. María lives in the community of Conchan de Milagros with her husband and 15 year old daughter. Her husband is a construction worker. Thanks to their efforts, María and her husband were able to build their own house.

This is her first loan and she plans to buy rice, sugar, coffee, oil, soap, caramels, bread, colas, and other products in order to restock her small store, which is open every day from 6am to 9pm. In addition, she raises chickens to sell whenever she faces financial difficulty. Her dream is for her daughter to continue her studies until she is able to earn a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Intiquilla Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIQUILL.” situado en L. ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito D. Huanchac a 15 minutos D. L. plaza central D. esta ciudad. 

Nuestros socios tiene más D. 3 años en este banco comunal, ellos son 15 miembros activos, los cuales comparten sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, L. mayoría se dedica a L. artesanía, estos socios necesitan el dinero para L. compra D. materia prima para L. elaboración D. sus trabajos hechos en arcillas, otro grupo pequeño D. socios solicitan el dinero para comprar ropa al por mayor D. L. ciudad D. Lima y traerL. a vender a L. ciudad del Cusco, L. cual no tiene fábricas D. ropas, otros dos socios necesitan el préstamo para pequeños gastos en el hogar hasta que el sueldo D. jubilados que tienen por ser docentes les llegue y D. este modo estar pagando poco a poco su deuda.

Nuestros socios agradecen y les hacen llegar  un enorme abrazo y los mejores deseos para este nuevo año y se comprometen n cumplir con los pagos D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the “IntiquilL.” Communal Bank, which is in the city of Cusco, Huanchac District, and located 15 minutes away from the main city square. This Communal Bank has been in existence for more than three years and currently has 15 active members. They participate in different commercial activities, but the majority sells handicrafts. These members need funding to buy raw materials for making works of clay. Another small group of members needs a loan to buy clothing in bulk. Two other members are requesting funding to help pay small household expenses. They are retired school teachers who are using this as an opportunity to gradually pay off their debts. The members are appreciative and wish to offer a big hug and best wishes for the New Year. They promise to complete their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, supplies, and merchandise for their various businesses

loans.name: Julia Yamilet

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa en el departamento de Chinandega, muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar la señora Julia S. teniendo su propio negocio de tienda general donde ofrece granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, comestibles, bebidas, entre otros.
Ella es madre soltera y con un hijo en edad escolar al que debe de brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo en la compra de los granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz y aceite. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Julia S. lives in the city of Chichigalpa in the Chinandega region and works tirelessly tending her grocery store where she sells staple items like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, groceries, drinks, etc. She is a single mother of a school-aged son and wants to be able to provide the conditions necessary for his proper development. She will use the loan to invest in merchandise including rice, beans, sugar, corn, and oil. She hopes that the loan will be granted and she will be able to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, corn, and oil

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Rosa M. vende todo tipo de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma a diario desde las Cuatro y media de la madrugada elaborados en su casa y con el fin de comercializarlos en el mercado a diario.
Ella se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y por llevar siempre el sustento a su casa de habitación. La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de materia prima como aceite, arroz, frijoles, entre otros. Al obtener el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque aumenta sus ventas en el mercado ofreciendo más platillos de comida.
texts.en:
Every morning at 4:30 Rosa M. begins preparing a variety of foods in her home to later sell at Chinandega's central market. Rosa is very hard-working and always takes care of her household's needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients including cooking oil, rice, and beans. Obtaining the loan will help her increase her sales by increasing the amount of food she can offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe se encuentra en la parroquia del mismo nombre, se caracteriza por sus artesanías, aquí que la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, y las personas jóvenes en su mayor parte han migrado al exterior por brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Este banco esta conformado por  mujeres luchadoras que se dedican a la agricultura,  cría de animales y a la elaboración de artesanías, actividades que han realizado desde que eran muy niñas y ha quedado como un legado familiar.

Laura V., vive en el barrio San Antonio en  la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, con quien ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 14, 13, 10, 8 años de edad, tiene casa propia que le fue heredada por sus padres pero su hermano hipoteco la casa para poder salir del país hacia los Estados Unidos llegando allá se olvido de la deuda por lo que su casa ahora se encuentra en remate, ahora tiene sus cosas en otro lugar y solo dejó la cama para cuidar la casa  hasta que la vendan.

Laura se dedica a la cría de animales pollos y cuyes actividad que realiza desde que se caso y los vende en la comunidad, también lava ropa y limpia casas ajenas ya la gente la conoce y a veces trabaja en esta actividad tres días a  la semana.

Se encuentra trabajando con los  prestamos de la fundación hace seis años invitada por su cuñada. Los préstamos le han beneficiado para su negocio de pollos y  con el préstamo que reciba de la institución comprará más pollos, maíz y vitaminas  para su crecimiento.

Su sueño es llegar a recuperar su casa o poder construir otra.

La señora María T. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe hace seis años  invitada por una amiga que ya no se encuentra en el banco,  mantiene una buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, ella vive el barrio San Antonio una comunidad del cantón Cumbe, tiene 47 años,  se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 28, 25, 22, 21, 16 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven en el exterior, solo uno de ellos  le ayuda económicamente,  su esposo también se encuentra en el exterior y con el esfuerzo de todos construyeron su casa propia.

 Ella se dedica a la cría de animales cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos los compra para engordarlos y los vende en la feria libre del  ganado, esta actividad  la  realiza hace mucho tiempo y le ha permitido estabilizarse un poco  económicamente.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va a pagar  los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos comprándoles uniformes nuevos y algunos libros que les hace falta, y con lo poco que le quede va  a comprar unos pollitos para criarlos.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos aprovechen el esfuerzo que realiza y que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Communal Bank is located in the village of the same name, which is known for its handicrafts. The majority of the population works in farming and cattle ranching and most of the young people have moved abroad to provide a better future for their families. The members of the bank are very industrious and work in farming, raising animals, and making crafts. They were raised with these activities and have maintained them as family traditions. Laura V., lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Cumbe and is 32 years old. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. They have five children, ages 17, 14, 13, 10, and 8. She lived in her own home, which she inherited from her parents, but her brother mortgaged it to be able to go to the United States. Once arriving in the States, he forgot about his debt and now the house is going to be auctioned off. She currently has her belongings in another location and only her bed remains in the home, taking care of it until it is sold. Since being married, Laura has raised chickens and guinea pigs to sell in her community. She also washes clothing and cleans houses, and often does this work three days a week. She was introduced to the foundation by her brother-in-law and began receiving loans six years ago. The loans she has received have helped her develop her chicken business, and she will use the current loan to purchase more chickens as well and corn and vitamins for their proper development. Her dream is to get her home back or to be able to build another. María T. has been a member of the Cumbe Communal Bank for six years. She was invited into the group by a friend who is no longer a member. She is good friends with the members of the group and is 47 years old. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Cumbe and is married. She has five children, ages 28, 25, 22, 21, and 16. Her two oldest children are married and live abroad, but only one of them helps her financially. Her husband is also abroad and his hard work has enabled them to build their own home. María raises guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs. She buys them to fatten up and sells them at the livestock fair. She has done this for quite some time and it has provided her some financial stability. She will use the funds from this loan to pay her children's school fees, purchase new uniforms, and some books that they need. She will use the remaining money to purchase some chicks to raise. Her biggest dream is that her children benefit from her efforts and finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, corn, and vitamins

loans.name: Reyna Francisca

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Reyna E. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras comercializadas por ella misma entre las que se encuentran: limones, chiltomas, repollos, cebollas, tamarindo, zanahorias, piñas, entre otros.
Su negocio lo inició hace 8 años  con la ayuda de su mamá y hoy en día ha logrado desarrollarlo cabalmente. Ella dice que en estos momentos las frutas y verduras que más está buscando la gente son: zanahorias, chayotes, papas, tomates, repollos y rabanos. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en dicha compra y así continuar ampliando la venta para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna E. is a direct seller of fruits and vegetables in the Chinandega Central Market. She sells lemons, sweet peppers, cabbages, onions, tamarind, carrots, and pineapples, among others.

She began her business 8 years ago with her mother’s help and has thoroughly developed it to where it is today. She claims the vegetables that people are most interested in buying right now are: carrots, chayotes, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, and radishes. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these vegetables so that she may increase her sales and thus benefit herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar la señora María Ofelia llevando a cabo su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son ofrecidas en el mercado a diario desde tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años y se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para obtener la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y leña y es por esta razón que espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
María Ofelia has made and sold tortillas in Managua's Wholesale market for 14 years. Her daily work schedule starts very early in the morning. She has relied on Ceprodel to get raw materials needed in tortilla-making. She currently needs funding to buy corn and firewood so she hopes that her loan request will be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II” situado en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac a 15 minutos de la plaza central de esta ciudad. 

Nuestros socios son 14 miembros dentro de este banco comunal, ellos alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, la mayoría de los socios se dedica a trabajos independientes,  una socia trabaja en un hostal es recepcionista y también tiene en casa un pequeño negocio ella vende leña al por mayor, otra socia tiene una tienda abarrotes y solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder implementar su tienda, otro socio es mecánico y solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su taller, otro socio hace hornos de arcilla y barro, el solicita el préstamo para comprar su materia prima, otra socia vende en un pequeño puesto en la esquina de su barrio todos los días anticucho (trozos de carnes y papa, estilo parrilla), ensartados en palos, otra vende queso, otro socio tiene una librería y otro trabaja como ayudante de cocina en la municipalidad, otra socia vende cosméticos por catálogos, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios y otros para comprar productos y vender algo extra a parte de sus respectivos trabajos.

Nuestros socios agradecen y les hacen llegar  un enorme abrazo y un cordial saludo y los mejores deseos para este nuevo año y se comprometen n cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members all belong to Cusco's “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II” communal bank, which is in Huanchac neighborhood, 15 minutes from Cusco's main square. There are 14 members, each with his/her own commercial activity; most of the members are independent businesspersons. For example: one member works as a receptionist in a hostel but also has a small firewood sales business at home. Another member has a small grocery store and requests funding to buy stock items for it. Another member is a mechanic and needs funds to buy tools for his shop. Another member has clay and mud ovens and needs funding to buy raw materials. Another member has a small, corner stand where she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled meats and potatoes). Another is a cheese merchant, one has a bookstore, and another works for the city as a kitchen assitant; another member sells catalogue cosmetics. All of them need funding to invest in their various commercial activites and some to buy products to sell as a source of extra income besides their regular jobs. The members are grateful and send an enormous hug and warm greeting to everyone for the New Year and pledge to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, supplies, and merchandise for their various commercial activities.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora E. R., vive en el Barrio Marginado de las Laureles Norte, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos de las edades de 32, 30, 27 25, 24 y 19 años de edad, todas estan casadas y viven de forma independiente, por tanto ahora su prioridad es terminar la construcción de su casa. La señora  E. se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa de capa y variedades para el hogar, tiene 4 años de trabajar consiguiendo clientela para su tienda y dentro de las dificulatades que ha enfrentado han sido los problemas económicos que atraviesa el país, con ayuda de su marido ha logrado surtir su tienda, pero ahora necesita  de un capital mayor para la compra de ropa y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada escolar, con esta inversion podría recuperar el capital de manera rapida y generar mejores utilidades que le beneficien a toda la familia para poder alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora E. R. lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is married and has 6 children, ages 32, 30, 27 25, 24 and 19. All of her children are married and live independently, so her current priority is finishing construction on her home. Maria sells shoes, clothing, and other household items. She has been developing her shop and building a customer base for four years and among the difficulties she has encountered are the economic problems in her country. With her husband's help, she has been able to supply the shop, but now she needs more working capital to purchase clothing and shoes to take advantage of the new school year. This investment in merchandise will enable her to repay her loan quickly and generate more income. This will provide her family more financial security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Pitalla Group

texts.es: El grupo pitalla está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Antonia del Carmen M. quien vende gaseosas en su casa de habitación, María Auxiliadora M. F. comercializa granos básicos y Jeissel María B. se dedica a distribuir cosméticos comerciales.
texts.en:
The pitalla group is made up of three working women; they are: Antonia del Carmen M. who sells sodas from home, Maria Auxiliadora Mejia F. who commercializes basic grains and Jeissel Maria B. who is dedicated to the distribution of commercial cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase soda

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia C. C., tiene la edad de 45 años, está  casada, y tiene seis hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 27,25,23,19,9 y 6 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia  a una plantación de 1.5 hectareas de café que posee. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Cecilia trabaja  desde hace muchos años a la agricultura sobre todo a la siembra de granos básico, al café y un poco a la ganadería.
