Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.


About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Cecilia C. C., is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Her children are her first priority and are ages 27, 25, 23, 19, 9 and 6. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her 1.5 hectare coffee plantation. She wants to be able to provide for the adequate maintenance of her crops, which will result in better production and therefore more income. This is not her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the opportunities they have provided. Cecilia has worked in agriculture for many years. She has primarily grown staple grains and coffee, and has done some cattle raising. In the future, she hopes to provide her family a better quality of life with more financial stability. She also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for coffee crops

loans.name: Fernanda Estefania

texts.es:
El banco comunal Totoracocha, esta formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad que enamora por su Centro Histórico, su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, se encuentra bañada por cuatro ríos y es una ciudad sin igual, nuestras socias mujeres luchadoras que  siempre buscan la manera de brindar a su familia un mejor futuro.

Fernanda T.  es una de las socias mas jóvenes, con apenas 19 años  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo con el banco comunal, los préstamos recibidos de la Fundación le  han beneficiado para comprar la  mercadería para su negocio ya que  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo  de ropa en el mercado 10 de Agosto en su  puesto de venta, lleva cinco años  en esta actividad  y nos comenta que las ventas han bajado un poco pero espera que pronto todo vuelva a la normalidad, labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. 

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar blusas, casacas, pantalones, ropa interior, calentadores y más para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su meta es tener un local más grande  con un stock surtido de ropa y superarse cada día más.
texts.en:
The Totoracocha communal bank is in Cuenca, a city that you fall in love with because of its historic city center, its culture, traditions and gastronomy. It is bathed by four rivers and is a city unlike any other. The members are hard-working women who are always seeking ways to improve their family's life for a better future. Fernanda T. is on the the youngest members; she's only 19. This is her third loan cycle with the bank. Previous loans have been used to buy merchandise for her clothing stall in the 19 de Agosto market. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and she tells us that sales have fallen a bit but she hopes they will return to normal soon. She works from 8 until 6. The funding will be used to buy blouses, jackets, pants, underwear and leg warmers and more for women, men and children. Her goal is to have a larger, better-stocked stall so that she can improve more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, jackets, pants, underwear, leg warmers.

loans.name: Jenny Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Totoracocha se conformó en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad que enamora por su Centro Histórico, su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, la belleza de sus ríos  que pasan por el centro de la ciudad nos brindan un paisaje sin igual, Este banco lo integran mujeres luchadoras, visionarias dispuestas a salir adelante mediante la capacitación y emprendiendo en sus negocios propios para formar parte de la población económicamente activa.

Jenny Quintuña  tiene 25 años es soltera, vive  con sus padres en casa propia en esta hermosa comunidad de Totoracocha, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde su casa todos los días lleva cuatro años en esta actividad por lo que ya tiene su clientela fija.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el dinero obtenido por préstamo  le  ha servido para comprar la mercadería para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y el  nuevo préstamo que  reciba de la institución va a comprar  pantalones, blusas, camisetas, camisas, etc., para tener un stock surtido para damas, caballeros y niños.


Su meta es de engrandecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The Totoracocha communal bank was formed in Cuenca, a city that enchants with its historic city center, its culture, traditions and gastronomy. The beauty of the four rivers that flow through the city center offer a unique vista. This bank is made up of hard-working, visionary women willing to get ahead in life through training and their own businesses in order to form part of the economically active population. Jenny Quintuña, 25, is single and lives with her parents in their own home in this beautiful community of Totorachocha. She sells clothing in her house every day; she has been in this line of work for 4 years so she has a regular client base. This is her second loan cycle. Her previous loans have been used to buy merchandise to fill orders from her customers. The new funding will be used to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, shirts, etc. in order to have varied stock of men's, ladies', and children's clothing available. Her goal is to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth D. M., tiene la edad de 25 años, está  en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 3 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Elizabeth también trabaja  desde hace muchos años  en la agricultura (granos básico y café) y también con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years of age, lives with her partner, and has one son who is her greatest priority. He is three years old. She wants a loan to buy cattle, her idea being to have cattle that produce both milk and meat. She wants to keep her livestock properly so that she can get the best possible profit when she sells them. This is not the first time that she has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that they have always offered her. Elizabeth has also worked for many years in agriculture (grains and coffee) as well as with livestock. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future, and she hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian es casado y su actividad del cliente es el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para su familia, que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos y su esposa quien tambien ayuda a su hogar  realizando pequeñas bolsas a macrame que despues las vende.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, compra de llantas, cremallera, cambio de juntas omocineticas, rodamientos y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Christian is married. His activity as a client is urban passenger transport via radio taxi. He does this every day and it is the main source of income for his family. His family is made up of his three children and his wife who also helps her household by making small macrame purses which she later sells. The loan is mainly to be for the re-conditioning of his vehicle. It will be for the purchase of tires, a rack, homokinetic joints, bearings, and other minor repairs. He will then be able to keep the car in optimal condition to carry out his work. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REPAIR OF VEHICLE, PURCHASE OF TIRES, RACK

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
El Sr. Celestino Es cliente antiguo en nuestra institución, su actividad es la panificación, realiza panes de distinta variedad  en un horno casero realizado de adobe como lo hacian en epocas pasadas, dice el señor Celestino que es mas practico y economico , con lo cual junto con su esposa  han criado a sus hijos, y a pesar de su edad sigue trabajando. Vive en la localidad de puerto Rico Municipio de El Torno.

El destino del crédito fue para aumentar su capita de trabajo ya que por un accidente se descapitalizo y esta recuperando su negocio
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Celestino is a long time client of our institution, he is a baker and makes different varieties of breads in a homemade oven built from adobe as they used to make in the past. Celestino says that he is most practical and thrifty and, together with his wife, this is how they have raised their children. Despite his age he is still working. He lives in the Puerto Rico locality in the municipality of El Torno. The purpose of the loan was to increase his working capital as capital was withdrawn by accident and he is rebuilding his business. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given through the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASE WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Rogelio  nació en Cochabamba en octubre en 1958 actualmente vive en Santa cruz en San Carlos aproximadamente 2 años, el trabaja como agricultor actividad principal.

El Señor trabaja junto con su familia en la agricultura y luego comercializa sus productos en el mercado de la zona, el es muy trabajador y responsable viene de una familia bin unida y el esta agradecido por el financiamiento para la reparación de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Rogelio was born in Cochabamba in October 1958 and now has lived in Santa Cruz, San Carlos for the last 2 years. He primarily works as a farmer. He works with his family growing produce then selling it in the local market. He is a very hard, responsible worker that comes from a very unified family. He is grateful for the loan that will help him to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. 
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza, sus vecinos son sus principales clientes, pero también distribuye para eventos sociales en su localidad.
Paralelamente, Bacilio trabaja realizando planos arquitectónicos, porque es arquitecto de profesión y es una de sus grandes pasiones. En el negocio de la venta de cerveza su principal apoyo son sus hijos, quienes le ayudan con el transporte de las cajas, mientras él cuida de cada detalle de la venta. Esta actividad le ha resultado muy rentable y quiere seguir mejorando sus ventas para el progreso de su familia.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete –nuevamente- a ser puntual en sus todos pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más mercadería en cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
Bacilio, 51, lives with his wife and three children in his own house. He has sold beer for the last 15 years; his customers are, for the most part, his neighbors. However, he also distributes to social events in his locality. In addition, Bacilio draws architectural plans because he is an architect and this is one of his great passions. His children are his main help in his beer-sales business; they help carrying the cases while he watches over every detail of the sales. This has turned out to be quite a profitable business and he wants to continue to improve his sales so that his family can progress. This is his third loan with MFP and he commits, once again, to repay in a timely fashion. The funds he is requesting now will be used to buy more cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 27 años, vive con su hijo de 10 años en una casa arrendada.
Su principal actividad es la venta de los productos que ella misma siembra en sus tierras de cultivo, y las de sus familiares. La comercialización la hace en otras ciudades, y el capital del país, donde viaja los fines de semana, y en otras oportunidades su madre le envía la mercadería por encomienda para que ella pueda ofertar a su clientela una variedad de productos frescos. 
El sueño de Elva es tener una bodega donde no sólo venda verduras y hortalizas, sino también todo tipo de productos comestibles de primera necesidad. 

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está convencida que es muy positivo trabajar en coordinación con el banco comunal al que pertenece. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá más verduras y hortalizas para repotenciar su capital de trabajo y también comprará sacos de abono para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Elva, 27, lives in a rented house with her 10-year-old son. She sells vegetables that she, herself, grows on her farmlands. She sells in other cities and in the nation's capital where she travels on weekends. On other occasions, her mother sends her the merchandise so that she can offer her customers a variety of fresh products. Elva's dream is to have a store where she won't sell just vegetables, but also all kinds of food products and basic needs items. This is her third loan with MFP and she is convinced that it is very positive to work in collaboration with her communal bank. The funds requested now will be used to buy more vegetables to stock her business; she will also buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next potato planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and natural fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 7 años tiene una bodega que implementó en L. casa D. su tía. Trabaja todos los días, y por L. tarD. cuenta con L. ayuda D. una D. sus hijas mayores.
Esther está siempre pendiente D. surtir su tienda con los diversos productos comestibles que más le solicitan sus clientes y  vecinos. D. esta manera, garantiza las ventas en su negocio, elL. desea tener una tienda más amplia y mejor surtida, por lo que seguirá luchando e invirtiendo en su negocio.

Esta es L. tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, además está muy contenta D. ser parte D. un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete – nuevamente - a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en L. compra D. más mercadería para su tienda, productos tales como leche y panetones.
texts.en:
Esther, 36, lives with her husband and 4 children in her own house. For the last 7 years she has run a grocery store that she set up in her aunt's house. She works every day and can count on help from one of her older daughters in the afternoons. Esther is always careful to stock her store with the food items that her customers and neighbors most want. This way, she insures sales. She hopes to have a larger, better-stocked store so, she continues to work and invest in her business. This is her third loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank and pledges, once again, to be very punctual with her payments. The funds requested on this occasion will be used to buy stock items, like milk and panetones (a festive Italian yeast cake flavored with candied fruit peels and raisins), for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items, like milk and panetones, for her store.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica en las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, tiene extensiones de terreno donde cultiva los principales productos de su zona; como la papa, maíz, arveja, habas y cebada; pero también siembra alfalfa para la alimentación de sus vacas y toros.
La venta de animales la realiza en la feria ganadera de su localidad, también ofrece la leche que sus vacas producen. 
Jaime desea seguir trabajando en su establo y en sus tierras agrícolas, “hasta donde le sigan sus fuerzas”, menciona, pues es lo que quiere dejarles en herencia a sus hijos.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y se siente muy contento de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de madera para la mejora y ampliación de  su establo.
texts.en:
Jaime is sixty years old and lives with his wife in their own house.

He has been growing crops and raising livestock for twenty years. He has stretches of land where he grows the main products of his area, such as potatoes, corn, peas, beans, and barley, but he also grows alfalfa to feed to his cows and bulls.

He sells his cattle in the local livestock market, where he also offers for sale the milk from his cows.

Jaime wishes to keep working in his cowshed and agricultural fields "for as long as he has his strength", he says. These are also what he wants to leave to his children.

This is the third time he has had a loan from MFP, and he is very happy to continue working with his community bank. The money that he is requesting today will be used to buy lumber to improve and extend his cowshed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his cattle sheds

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Iván tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica al arado. Su trabajo consiste en preparar los terrenos de cultivo  con la ayuda de sus toros. Su trabajo es de todos los días, de acuerdo a los pedidos de alquiler que tiene, su mejor época es durante la siembra, y de acuerdo a cada producto tiene fechas determinadas. Su hermano mayor es quien le ayuda y le asesora en para este trabajo, y por ello se siente muy contento, porque ya es independiente económicamente.
Su meta es seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día más, para ello próximamente empezará a dedicarse a la ganadería.

Esta es la tercera vez que accede a un crédito con MFP, él ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual en sus pagos, es parte de un banco comunal y continuará con esta misma actitud responsable en esta oportunidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de un torete para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
Iván, 21, lives in his parents' house with them and his siblings. For the last 3 years he has worked contracting himself out to plow fields with his team of bullocks. He works every day depending on the number of requests for service that he has. His best time is during planting seasons and, according to each type of crop, he has set dates. His older brother gives him help and advice about his work. Iván is happy because he is independent economically. His goal is to continue to grow and improve every day and, to accomplish this, he plans to start cattle raising soon. This is his third loan request from MFP. He has shown himself to be a very punctual person with regard to his payments. He is a member of a communal bank and intends to continue with this responsible attitude in this new opportunity. The funds requested will be used to buy a bullock to raise for future sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bullock.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana M. se ha destacado en la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento en el que se esfuerza a diario para obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.

Ella es una persona muy dedicada al trabajo y siempre está pensando la manera de ir mejorando poco a poco. La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de naranjas dulces para ofrecerlas en el mercado y de esta manera generar las utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Ana M. has excelled in the activity of selling fruits and vegetables, having her own business in which she works daily in order to obtain income to sustain her household. She is a person who is very dedicated to her work and is always thinking about ways to gradually improve. The reason that she requests this loan is to buy sweet oranges to offer them for sale in the market and in this way generate earnings for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de carne. Para ello, trabaja junto a su esposo en un camal cercano a su casa, donde matan los animales y cortan las partes para su venta, la cual realizan (al por mayor) en el mercado mayorista de su localidad.
Todos estos años de experiencia le han servido para brindar una mejor calidad de su producto y expandirse a nuevos lugares de venta. 
Luisa y su esposo seguirán trabajando arduamente en esta tarea, porque es rentable y porque les proporciona el sustento económico familiar.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y se siente muy contenta de ser parte de un banco comunal, donde persevera por un trabajo solidario. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de más animales como toretes y ovejas para la venta de su carne.
texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their children. For more than 10 years she has been selling meat. To do this, she works with her husband in a slaughterhouse close to their house, where they kill the animals and cut the parts for sale. The meat is then sold (wholesale) in the wholesale market in their area. With all of these years of experience they can provide a better quality product and expand to sell in new places. Luisa and her husband will continue to work hard at this trade, because it is profitable and because it provides the family's economic livelihood. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she feels very content to be a part of a communal bank where the members persevere and work in solidarity. The money that she requests now will be used to buy more animals such as bulls and sheep in order to sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos Vive en casa familiar,  en la localidad de puerto Rico municipio de El torno, distante 39 Km de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, su actividad principal es la servicio de mototaxista en la comunidad, también tiene  como profesion  educador, es soltero con mucha ganas de seguir superándose, por lo cual el destino del crédito fue para aumentar y comprar un vehiculo, y a si poder construir su propia vivienda y formar un hogar. 
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his family home en the town of Puerto Rico in the El Torno district, about 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He runs a motorcycle taxi service in his town; he is also trained as a teacher. He is single and really wants to improve his life; that is why he is requesting this loan in order to purchase a vehicle to eventually build his own house and form a home. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in him by offering him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada.
Sus principales actividades son la agricultura y ganadería en los terrenos que sus padres le han heredado. Allí cultiva los principales productos de su tierra; como la papa, por lo que cada día está pendiente del crecimiento de las plantas, para evitar las plagas o alguna otra dificultad que pueda atender a tiempo y no perjudique su cosecha.
Olga comercializa sus productos en los principales mercados de las ciudades más cercanas a su localidad. Hasta el momento ha visto que su trabajo le ha generado buenos ingresos, por lo que se desea convertirse en una gran productora de papa, y distribuir al por mayor. 

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y ha comprobado con su propia experiencia las ventajas de acceder a un préstamo para mejorar sus actividades económicas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Olga is 25 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband and son.

She is primarily dedicated to agriculture and cattle farming on the lands she inherited from her parents. Here she cultivates her country’s staple crops, such as potatoes. She pays close attention to her plants on a daily basis in order to avoid pests and other problems that she can control before they ruin her crop.

Olga sells her products in the main markets of the cities close to her farm. To date she has received a high return on investment. Therefore she wants to become a major potato producer and sell her potatoes wholesale.

This would be her second loan with MFP and she has proven, through her own experience, the advantage that a loan can have on improving her economic activities. She is requesting a loan so that she may purchase sacks of manure and fertilizer for the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes L. C. de 51 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Prolongación Graú – Parcona – Ica vive con su esposo el sr. Juan Medrano Cabezas ellos tienen 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y aportan en casa solo uno tiene 15 años y estudia en el colegio San Luis Gonzaga de Ica.
La sra se dedica a la venta de verduras picadas embolsadas empezó vendiendo tubérculos ya tiene en este negocio 14 años trabaja desde las 5.00 am hasta las 12.00 pm en el mercado Toledo y en las tardes se dedica a picar la verdura para el día siguiente su esposo es maestro de construcción y ambos con su trabajo han logrado construir su vivienda y ahora cuentan con una ahorro y desean invertir en la compra de una mototaxi que le permita darle una mejor estabilidad a sus hijos quienes trabajan eventualmente en construcción y en alquiler de mototaxi por eso ellos están haciendo un esfuerzo ya que desean que sus hijos sigan adelante y su mayor sueño es que su hijo menor logre estudiar una carrera que le permita defenderse mejor en la vida.
La sra es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora al igual que su esposo ellos gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes dicen que son bien trabajadores y de esa manera han sacado adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes L. C. is 51 years old; her house is located in Prolongación Graú – Parcona – Ica and she lives with her husband, Juan Medrano Cabezas. They have 3 children, 2 of whom are of-age and help support the family, and one son who is 15 years old and studies in the high school, San Luis Gonzaga of Ica. Mercedes sells chopped bagged vegetables. She started selling tubers 14 years ago; she works from 5:00am until 12 pm in the Toledo market and in the afternoons she chops vegetables to sell the following day. Her husband is a master of construction and together with his job they have constructed their house and now have some savings they would like to invest in the purchase of a mototaxi, which would allow them to provide more stability to their children who will eventually work in construction and mototaxi hire. For this they are trying very hard; they want their children to progress forward and their greatest dream is for their youngest son to study a career that will allow him to have a better life. Mercedes is a very enterprising woman and a fighter like her husband. They enjoy good references from their neighbors who say they are good workers and in this manner have achieved progress for this children.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora Luisa G. se dedica a la venta de perecederos tales como naranja agria, naranja dulce y limones las que son ofrecidas por ella misma en el M.. Ella inició este negocio desde hace 25 años y hoy en día ha logrado mejorarlo gracias a sus esfuerzos.

El crédito que ella está solicitando es para la compra de naranjas agrias, naranjas dulces y limones para continuar comercializándolas y de esta manera suplir las necesidades del negocio y por ende las de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa sells perishable goods such as seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons, which she herself sells in the market. She started this business 25 years ago, and to this day has been able to improve it thanks to her efforts.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons so that she can continue marketing them and, in this way, meet the needs of her business and hence also of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seville oranges, sweet oranges, and lemons

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos Vive en  el domicilio de su madre, en el municipio del el torno, tiene un lote en el cual va a construir, y así tener su propio hogar, es soltero con mucha ganas de superación, Tambien desea estudiar y seguir trabajando en su actividad que es el auto transporte de personas, cuenta con su propia herramienta de trabajo.
El destino del crédito fue para la reparación de su vehiculo, que se encontraba ya en mal estado.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his mother's home, in the municipality of El Torno. He has a lot on which he is going to build, and in this way have his own home. He is single, with a strong desire to succeed. He also wants to study and to continue working in his trade, which is providing transportation (taxi) services. He owns his own vehicle. This loan will be used to repair his vehicle, which is currently in very bad condition. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. José Julio C. M. de 48 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres quienes han fallecido hace 2 años al ser afectados por el terremoto esto esta ubicado en Los Aquijes – Ica vive junto con su hermano con quien comparte gastos de la unidad familiar.
El Sr. Se dedica desde hace 10 años al transporte antes trabajaba para una empresa de transporte posterior a eso se logro comprar su camioneta que ahora la trabaja realizando trabajos de Taxi - Carga (mudanzas, traslado de mercadería y otros) de lunes a sábado de 6:30 am hasta las 3:00 pm en Prolongación Grau – Ica.
El tiene 3 hijas quienes viven con su madre por motivos familiares se separo de ella desde hace 4 años dos de sus hijas son mayores de edad y trabajan independientemente solo una se encuentra preparándose para la universidad y él le apoya en sus gastos ya que desea que su hija logre ingresar y sea toda una profesional.
El Sr. es bien responsable goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos solicita el financiamiento para poder tramitar su brevete que se encuentra vencido y que no le permite trabajar normalmente.
texts.en:
José Julio C. M. is 48 years old and lives in his parents' house. They died 2 years ago during the earthquake that was located in Los Aquijes. He lives with his brother, with whom he shares the household expenses. For 10 years he has worked in transportation. Prior to this he worked for a transportation company; later he managed to buy the truck that he now uses to provide taxi-cargo services (for moving, transporting merchandise, etc.) He works Mondays through Saturdays from 6:30am until 3pm in the area of Prolongación Grau in Ica. He has 3 daughters who live with their mother, as he has been separated from her for 4 years. Two of his daughters are adults and work independently and the third is preparing for the university; he supports her with her expenses since he would like for his daughter to enter the university and become a professional. Jose is very responsible and enjoys good references from his neighbors. He requests financing to be able to renew his driver's license, as it has expired and he is not allowed to work without it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenditures related to transportation business

loans.name: Paula Elvira

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Paula M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad de venta de aguacates, limones, zapotes,entre otros ofrecidos ambulantemente en una canasta que a diario carga donde coloca estos productos y se moviliza en el mercado.

Su trabajo es muy cansado por la razón de que vende ambulantemente por las calles del mercado exponiéndose a la fatiga producida por el sol y al cansancio de caminar todo el día. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de aguacates, limones y zapotes para continuar con la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paula M. fully dedicates herself to the sale of her fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market of Managua. She sells avocadoes, lemons, sapotes, and apples, among others. Her job is very demanding as she sells her wares throughout the market streets and often succumbs to fatigue caused by constant exposure to the sun and she gets tired from walking all day long. She is requesting this loan to purchase more avocadoes, lemons, and sapotes (a soft, edible fruit) so she can continue selling these and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento FLORIDA esta conformado por la señora Rosmery  quien tiene como actividad pensión solo almuerzos al medio día ubicado en su domicilio y tambien promotora D. joyas por catalogo

La señora Roxana  es la tesorera quien se dedica al comerio en general tambien es pasanakera D. viveres y la señora Jenny quien es la secretaria D. actas cuya actividad es la producción D. pasteles queques y bocaditos en su mismo domicilio.  Estas tres señoras son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por Diez  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas ya que no cuentan con garantia personal para poder sacar un prestamo individual. Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 20% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio ambulando y no cuenta con domicilio propio son madres y padres  D. familia  muy trabajadores que el negocio es el unico ingreso con el cual mantienen el hogar, son personas que se componen dentro del comercio y es por eso que se garantizan para este primer crédito.				
				
Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Rosmery is a board member of the Emprendimiento Florida Bank. Her job is offering food (lunches only) in her house at midday. She also sells jewelry from a catalogue. Señora Roxana is the treasurer; she is a businesswoman, acting as an intermediary for suppliers. Señora Jenny is the secretary; she makes pies, cakes, and snacks in her own home. These three women are in charge of the bank which is maD. up of ten people who are joint guarantors because they cannot get personal guarantees for individual loans. A majority of the members have their own permanent businesses; the other 20% sell merchandise in the streets. They do not have their own homes. They are hardworking mothers and fathers whose only income to support their families is from this work. All are familiar with business, and for this reason they are being awarded their first loan. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in agreeing to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años intensificó sus labores ganaderas, vendiendo animales (vacas y toros) en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Asimismo, vende la leche de sus vacas después de ordeñarlas por las mañanas. Paralelo a esto, cultiva papa, quinua, trigo y maíz, los que vende al por mayor en el mercado de abastos de su ciudad.
Para estas tareas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que es la principal actividad económica para su familia, por lo que uno de los planes de Pedro es sembrar pastos y forraje para alimento de los animales que piensa adquirir en el futuro, a fin de tener un establo ganadero. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, se siente contento de ser un nuevo integrante en su banco comunal y está muy deseoso de participar activamente con su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para los pastos con los que alimenta a sus animales, pues de ello depende su buena producción de leche y peso, para su venta.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. For two years he has been stepping up his livestock breeding work, selling animals (cows and bulls) in the livestock markets in his town. He also sells the milk from his cows after milking them every morning. Parallel to this, he grows potatoes, quinoa, wheat, and corn, which he sells wholesale in the wholesale food market in his city.

For this work, he counts on the help of his wife, since it is the main business for the family, so therefore one of Pedro's plans is to plant grass and forage for feeding the animals that he thinks he will buy in the future, in order to have livestock stable.

This is the first time that he has a loan with MFP, he is happy to be a new member of his community bank and is very eager to actively participate with his group. The money that he is requesting will be used for the purchase of fertilizers for the grasses, with which he will feed his animals, since he depends on them for good production of milk and weight to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the farming of grasses

loans.name: Zoila Albina

texts.es: La señora Zoila Albina G., nacio en la ciudad de managua hace 41 años tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos vive en Costa Rica y el otro trabaja con ella en la administración de su propio negocio, el cual es un Kiosko de comida en el Colegio Inmaculada Concepción de María desde hace 10 años, la dificultad que la señora ha enfrentado a lo largo de estos años han sido la falta de financiamiento adecuado a sus necesidades, lo cual la limita en el desarrollo de su negocio, el mayor anhelo que la señora tiene planificado por el momento, es la construcción de una pared que divida los cuarto, esto le traera mayor privacidad y respeto entre la familia. Con el prestamo comprara materiales de construccion para iniciar con los palnes de reparacion del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila Albina G. was born in the city of Managua 41 years ago. She has two children, one of which lives in Costa Rica, and the other works with her in the administration of her own business, which has been a food stand in the Inmaculada Concepción de María school for 10 years. The difficulty that Sra. G. has faced along the years has been the lack of adequate financing for her necessities, which limits the development of her business. The biggest wish that she has planned for the moment, is the construction of a wall that divides the room, which will give better privacy and respect amongst the family. With the loan she will buy construction materials to begin the plans to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a member of a communal bank consisting of 20 members in Cusco.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Prudencia is married and lives in Cusco.  She has seven children.  The two oldest children are now university students, one of whom is studying to become a math professor. 

Prudencia runs a small food distribution business in Cusco which she started five years ago.  She buys cheeses and meats in the Chumbivilcas province (a remote and poor region south of Cusco), which she then sells in Cusco.  Prudencia is requesting a loan to invest in her business and to help with her son’s tuition payments.

Prudencia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Prudencia is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: to buy meat and cheese to sell and to pay for tuition

loans.name: G.s. El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Esfuerzo lo conforman Ninosca Mercedes y Andrea Maritza esta no es la primera vez que solicitan financiamiento, ya que han logrado mantener su record crediticio para mejorar con sus negocios. Estas Señoras son muy trabajadoras, por lo que cada día se interesan en mejorar en sus negocio, tienen diferentes actividades económicas pero a pesar de esto ambas se unen para mantener a sus familias y además para seguir manteniendo activos sus negocios que son la base más importante para sus negocios ya que tienen a sus clientes y no quieren perderlos por no ofrecerles lo que le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para cada uno de sus productos. Los deseos de ellas es mantener sus negocio y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Esfuerzo (The Effort) is made up of Ninosca Mercedes and Andrea Martiza. This is not the first time they are requesting financing, since they have succeeded in maintaining their credit record in order to improve their businesses. These women are very hard-working and therefore every day they are interested in improving their business. They have different businesses, but in spite of this, they both stick together in order to maintain their families, as well as to continue maintaining the assets of their businesses, which are the most important base for their businesses, since they have customers and they don't want to lose them by not offering what their customers are requesting. The loan is for the purchase of the raw materials that are necessary for each of their products. Their wish is to maintain their business and improve every day.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
LA SRA MIRIAM VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR DE SUS SUEGROS , TIENE UNA TIENDA EN ALQUILER DONDE REALIZA LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS , CERVEZA Y OTROS. LA CLIENTE ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA  LA CUAL SOLICITO EL CREDITO PARA INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL YA QUE NECESITABA SURTIR EL NEGOCIO QUE TIENE ELLA SOLA MANTIENE EL HOGAR.						
						
ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Miriam lives in her in-law's home and rents a small store where she sells drinks, beer, and other goods. She is a very humble, simple woman and has requested this loan to provide the necessary capital to supply her shop. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in her to offer her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Laura Lastenia

texts.es:
la señora Laura Lastenia R. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Angel Funez Santos, tienen 04 hijos. 
Laura se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace 4 años, vende tacos, enchiladas, platanos fritos y arroz curtido.
desea invertir el prestamo en refrescos y jugos, Laura es una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, dice que esta trabajando para pagar el estudios de sus hijos.
su sueño es ver que todos sus hijos cuando esten adultos sean profesionales.
 
desea que Dios derrame muchas bendiciones a todas las personas del mundo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura Lastenia R. is 32 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Angel Funez Santos, and together they have 4 children.

For four years Laura has sold sweets. She sells tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, and curtido with rice. She wants to invest the loan to purchase soft drinks and juices. Laura is a hardworking person who yearns to succeed. She says she is working to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals when they become adults.

She wants God to lavish many blessings on people all over the world.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of soft drinks and juices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a member of a communal bank in Cusco consisting of 20 members.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Janet lives with her partner and two daughters (aged 9 and 3) in Cusco. 

Janet owns and runs a furniture store in the Santiago district of the city of Cusco, which she started two and a half years ago.  She learned the trade from her parents, who also own a furniture store.  From her extensive experience in the furniture business, Janet knows that February and March are good months during which to sell mattresses, as these are typically the months when most newcomers arrive in Cusco. With the loan she is requesting, Janet plans to buy mattresses and bedding to sell in her store and hopes to increase her earnings.

Janet appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Janet is pictured with her 3-year-old daughter.

loans.use: To buy mattresses and bedding to sell in her store

loans.name: Luz De Bendicion 3 Group

texts.en:
Mabel, 23, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz de Bendicion (Light of Blessing), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Mabel is a single mother of three and runs a nail salon from her home in Los Alcarrizos. Los Alcarrizos is a community on the outskirts of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Those living in the Dominican Republic have no access to running potable water, and electricity and healthcare are unreliable at best. Despite these difficulties, Mabel is taking out this loan, her first with Esperanza International, in hopes of improving her life and the lives of her children.

Specifically, Mabel will be using this loan to purchase equipment for her nail salon. She hopes to make something of herself through her work while giving “a future to her children so they can become useful to society”. She hopes to one day buy an inverter for her home; power outages are a daily occurrence in the Dominican Republic (if one has power to begin with), and an inverter would give her family power when there is no electricity. Mabel has high hopes for her nail salon, and with your loan she can attain those hopes. Thank you for lending to Mabel and the Luz de Bendicion group!

loans.use: Beauty supplies, nail equipment

loans.name: G.s. Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: La señora Manuela de Jesús, Yesenia del Socorro y Marcia es también integrante del grupo solidario Ana Virgen Noble, La señora Yesenia del tiene 30 años y se dedica  a la elaboración de tortillas, esta actividad la realiza con otros miembros de su familia que le ayudan a elaborar. Ella posee tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella es casada, por lo tanto para el ingreso del hogar su esposo también aporta, ya que trabaja como ayudante de albañilería. Las 3 son personas muy luchadoras y lo más importante trabajadoras anteriormente ya habían solicitado financiamiento por lo que han reconocido que ha sido de gran ayuda para sus familias y para sus negocio. Actualmente solicitan este nuevo financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para cada una de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Señora Manuela de Jesús, Yesenia del Socorro and Marcia are jointly liable members of the Ana Virgen Noble group. Señora Yesenia, age 30, is engaged in making tortillas. She carries out this business with other members of her family, who help her make them. She has three young children and is married. Her husband also contributes to the household income since he works as an assistant bricklayer.

The three members are very energetic and, most importantly, hardworking. Previously they have applied for financing which they have recognized has been of great help for their families and for their businesses. Currently they are applying for this new loan which will be for working capital that will be used for the purchase of raw material for each one of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wilmer Orlando

texts.es:
el sr. Wilmer C. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Madrial en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Valle.
Wilmer se dedica a la venta de productos como ser rasuradoras, cremas, pastas dentales, controles remotos universales, tijeras. dichos productos los vende de forma ambulante en colonias y caserios cercanos en donde el vive.
Wilmer ahorita necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, ya que tiene poco inventario y las ventas cada ves se estan poniendo mejor.
su meta a corto plazo es poder tener un local en donde pueda poner su negocio.
el necesita el credito para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilmer C. is 27 years old, lives in the town of Madrial in the city of San Lorenzo, Valle. Wilmer's business is the sale of products like razors, creams, toothpaste, universal remote controls, scissors. He sells these products door to door in neighborhoods and hamlets near where he lives. Wilmer currently needs a loan to buy merchandise wholesale because his inventory is low and his sales have been getting better and better. His short-term goal is to be able to open a physical store for his business. He needs this loan to be able to help his family prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothpaste, razors, creams, batteries, universal remote controls, scissors, and soap.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es:
Bolívar Hernández A., tiene la edad de 56 años, es casado, y tiene 6 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 36,34,26,20,17 y 10 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.El desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es un minisuper que lo creó hace tres años. 
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bolívar Hernández A. is 56 years old and married with 6 children, who are his greatest priority. His sons are 36, 34, 26, 20, 17, and 10 years old respectively. He wants this loan to buy inventory for his general store. He wants his business to be sufficiently stocked to allow his sales to increase and therefore increase his income. He started his mini-supermarket business three years ago. This is the first loan he will receive from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy to receive this opportunity from them. His wish for the future is to be able to offer his children and his wife a better quality of life and greater economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás tiene 23 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años empezó a dedicarse independientemente a las tareas agrícolas, siembra quinua y arveja. Las habilidades que ahora tiene son debido a que desde niño las aprendió de sus padres. Su trabajo es más intenso durante la época de la siembra y/o cosecha, pues desde muy temprano prepara sus tierras de cultivo, abonando y fertilizando sus plantaciones, además de cuidarlas de posibles plagas. Posteriormente, debe esperar pacientemente el momento de la 
Cosecha. Para el futuro, Tomás quiere extender sus terrenos de cultivo para aumentar su producción.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es un socio con larga trayectoria en su banco comunal, pues ha demostrado un trabajo constante y responsable. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Tomás is 23 years old, lives with his mother and his siblings in his parents' house. Two years ago, he independently decided to start farming quinua (a grain) and peas. He knew how to farm because had learned from his parents. His work is much harder during planting and harvesting seasons, but since he was very young he has been cultivating the land - fertilizing his plants and ridding them of possible pests. Previously, he has had to wait patiently for the harvest. In the future, however, Tomás wants to expand his farmland in order to increase production. This is his fourth loan from MFP. He has a long history as a member of his communal bank and has demonstrated that he is a consistent and responsible worker. The money he is seeking now will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer for the next time he plants his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo Antonio tiene  44 años de edad, es casado. El señor Reynaldo tiene un negocio de brindar el servicio de triciclo, por lo que él siempre está buscando la manera de salir delante de la forma más humilde y trabajadora todos los días sale con la esperanza de que obtendrá más clientes. el  dio inicio a su negocio hace 4 años con muy poca clientela por lo que al inicio no tenía mucha experiencia y se cansaba muy rápido anteriormente él no tenía un triciclo propio y esto le resultaba mucho más difícil ya que no ganaba lo suficiente y lograba mantenerse con lo necesario pero poco a poco fue ahorrando y así fue el compro su propia triciclo con mucho esfuerzo. El solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mantenimiento como pinturas, llantas, toldo entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo Antonio is 44 years old and is married. Mr. Reynaldo has a business providing rickshaw services, and he’s always trying to get ahead in life in the most humble and hard-working manner; he goes out every day with the hope of getting more customers. He started his business 4 years ago with very few customers since he did not have much experience and he would get tired very quickly; he did not have his own rickshaw, and it made it very difficult to make much money, just enough for basic necessities. Little by little he was saving and he bought his own rickshaw with much effort. He is requesting a loan for working capital to provide maintenance such as paint, tires and canopy among other things. His wish is to make improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a communal bank in Cusco consisting of 20 members.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Maria is married and lives with her husband and three sons in Cusco.  Her two oldest sons are university students. 

Maria owns and runs a general goods store in the city of Cusco.  She sells rice, oil, sugar, flour, some fruits and vegetables, snacks, beverages and beer.  She makes the most money selling soft drinks and beer as these have relatively higher profit margins, and she sells a lot of both.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store and also to help pay for her sons’ education.

Maria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos, cliente antigüo (4ta Secuencia), padre de familia de 3 hijos todos independientes, separado hace mucho tiempo, trabaja con su propio micro bus en la Línea 38-39-85 dependiente del Sindicato  DE TAXIS y COLECTIVOS 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE desde el 2003. a la fecha. Tiene su casa propia producto de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Trabaja a diario desde las 5:00am hasta las 23:00pm su trabajo es muy exigente y sacrificado por lo que demanda mucha responsabilidad. Responsabilidad que asumió desde muy joven aprendió a conducir a la edad de 15 años trabajo como taxista y luego con la ayuda de sus padres logro adquirir su  propio vehiculo. Hoy en día el trabaja para  asegurar su vejez y el futuro de sus hijos si es que necesitaran de el en algún momento. Talvez mas adelante piensa en conformar otra familia si es que el tiempo se lo permite.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Marcos is an old Emprender customer (currently in his 4th loan cycle); he is the father of 3 grown children who have lived apart for quite some time. He has worked driving his own micro-bus on the 38-39-85 Line in the Sept 24 taxi and bus syndicate since 2003. He has his own home which he built through his hard work and effort. He works every day from 5 am to 11 pm; his work is very hard and takes significant sacrifice on his part but he is very responsible. He learned such discipline and responsibility when he was young as he learned to drive when he was 15; he worked as a taxi driver and later, with his parents' help, he was able to buy his own vehicle. Now he works to ensure he has enough money in his old age and to help provide for his children if they need his support in the future. He may also want to form another family in the future if he has time. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in him to provide this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la región, esta actividad la realiza en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es vendedor independiente. Milagros forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su comida y posterior venta.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de una cocina a carbón y en la compra de productos e insumos para la preparación de su comida.	La meta de Milagros es tener un restaurante, ya que ella vende en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Milagros is a very respectful woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 36 years old and has 3 young children. She works selling regional food from the porch of her home. Her husband works as an independent salesman and supports her in her work. Milagros has been part of the "Talented Women" village bank for the past year; the first loan she received was for $100 and she invested it in ingredients for her food sales. Now she needs $200 which she will invest in purchasing a charcoal stove and in ingredients for her food. She would like to eventually have a restaurant since she now sells her food on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a charcoal stove and ingredients for food

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Consuelo O. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Nueva Caucara en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con su familia.
Gloria se dedica al comercio, vende cepillos de dientes, focos de mano, baterias, focos para casas, tijeras, corta uñas etc. estos productos los vende ambulantemente en diferentes barrios y colonas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, los fines de semana vende su producto cerca del mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
ahora necesita el credito ya que no tiene mucho producto y este se le esta vendiendo rapido, desea comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor. 
con las ganancias que tenga desea ir remodelando su casa poco a poco y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria Consuelo O. is 35-years-old. She lives with her family in the Nueva Caucara neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Gloria has a business selling toothbrushes, flashlights, batteries, lights for houses, scissors, nail clippers, etc. She sells these products as a street vendor in different neighborhoods and areas of the city of San Lorenzo. On the weekends, she sells her product near the city market of San Lorenzo. She needs a credit because she doesn't have much product left because she is selling it quickly. She hopes to buy more merchandise wholesale. With the profits, she would like to remodel her home little by little so she can give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries, flashlights, toothpaste, toothbrushes, lights, scissors, and nail clippers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 1 año, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 07 hijos, 3 de ellos son dependientes. Ella estudió primaria incompleta,  se dedica a la venta de comida.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de artículos de abarrotes, tiene una pequeña tienda.

Modesta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar los víveres para la preparación de los paltos que ofrece.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su capital y crecer como empresaria.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Modesta has been a member of the “Generación 2000” communal bank for one year. She lives in the Santa Rosa district of El Collao province, in the Department of Puno. She is 45 years old and married with 7 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on her. She has an incomplete primary education. She works selling food, and she also has a small shop where she sells grocery items. Modesta reports that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement organization, for 500 Peruvian new soles, she was able to buy the ingredients for the dishes she offers. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles, which will allow her to buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her capital and expand her business. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 54 años, vive con su  esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Tiene 30 años de experiencia trabajando arduamente brindando el servicio de construcción civil, para ello cuenta con sus propias herramientas y hace todo tipo de construcciones, instalaciones eléctricas y de agua potable. Por tal motivo, en su zona lo conocen como una persona muy responsable y con mucha calidad en sus labores.
Pero Víctor no se queda atrás, pues cuando los trabajos de construcción son escasos, se sustenta con la agricultura, ya que tiene unos terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y ha demostrado ser muy colaborador y puntual en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más herramientas para su trabajo; como puntales, tablas, clavos, desarmadores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old; he lives with his wife and their 2 children in his own home. He has 30 years of experience working hard providing construction services. He has his own tools, and he does every kind of construction, including electrical installations and potable water. For this reason he is known in his area as a person who is very responsible and who does quality work. But Victor will not get left behind, because when construction work is scarce he sustains himself with agriculture, since he has some fields where he cultivates potatoes and corn. This is his 3rd opportunity to take a loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated that he is very cooperative and punctual in his communal bank. With the money he requests now he will buy more tools for his work, such as struts, boards, nails and screwdrivers, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction tools and materials

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is member of a communal bank consisting of twenty members in Cusco. The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s Daughters”).

Fernando is a graphics and Web designer and in the past two years has also begun renting out the lower level of his home to commercial tenants. Due to some recent medical expenses, Fernando has been unable to pay for all the required maintenance and improvements of his rental property. He is therefore requesting a loan to be able to meet all his obligations as a landlord. He hopes in the future to be able to further improve the property and attract higher rents.

Fernando appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of his rental property

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
la sra. Digna A. tiene 61 años de edad, vive en la Aldea el Chaparral, Langue Valle. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños. Digna vende blusas, trajesitos para niños, ropa interior de dama y niños, faldas, camisas de vestir, camisetas,  fajas etc.
tiene su puesto en el mercado municipal de Langue. 
nos comento estar muy feliz ya que siempre esta vendiendo ropa, y este negocio le genera ganancias para poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
Digna necesita el credito para comprar mas variedad de ropa. este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos ya que ella es una persona de edad y no puede realizar otro tipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Digna A. is 61 years old and lives in the village of El Chaparral in Langue Valle. She sells brand-new clothes for ladies, men and children. She sells blouses, little suits for kids, underwear for ladies and children, skirts, dress shirts, t-shirts, girdles, etc. She has a stall in the municipal market of Langue. She shared with us that she is very happy since she is always selling clothes and her business generates enough profits to cover her household expenses. Digna needs the loan to buy more variety of clothes; this business is her only source of income since she is an elderly person and she cannot do any other type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes: shirts, blouses, underwear, skirts, t-shirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene la edad de 48 años. Actualmente es casada Solamente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de ella es una pulpería esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años cuando ella empezó a vender fue porque laboraba como docente y el salario no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Ya que siempre le ha gustado el negocio y además sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, pan, galletas entre otros. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Julia is 48-years-old. She is married and has 2 children. She has had a small grocery store for 6 years. She started to sell groceries because when she worked as a teacher, her income wasn't enough to cover her family's expenses. She has always liked this business, and it lets her take care of her children. Now she is requesting financing that she will use to purchase candy, natural juices, basic grains, bread, cookies, etc. Her biggest wish is to expand her business in such a way that will let her improve her family's economic situation and offer her children the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, natural juices, basic grains, bread, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El Señor Diego se dedica al transporte publico(Taxi) dentro del radio urbano de la ciudad, desde hace 5 años,como cliente de la Institucion el Señor  Diego al transcurrir del tiempo desde que es cliente  ha demostrado responsabilidad con la institucion,actualmente se ecuentra en su en su tercer ciclo, el vive en casa de sus abuelos a  los que asiste cuando es necesario.						

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Diego works in public transportation as a taxi driver around the city. He has been a client of the institution for five years. In the time that he has been a client Diego has demonstrated responsibility with the institution. He is currently in his third cycle. He lives in his grandparents’ house, and he helps them when they need it. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given to him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and a battery

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Aurelio D. S. tiene 36 años de edad, su esposa es la sra. Maria S. Mejia, quien se dedica al cuidado de sus 3 hijos, mientras Marco vende achineria en el mercado municipal de Langue, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, esta actividad le a servido para sostener su familia. su meta es comprar su propio puesto en el mercado municipal.
aqui es dificil conseguir un puesto pero tiene fe en que pronto lo va a conseguir.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mejores ganancias.
tiene que viajar para poder comprar su mercaderia y esto le dificulta a el ya que cuando lo hace compra poco y tiene que estar viajando mas seguido y esto le ocaciona mas gastos. por tal razon necesita el credito para comprar mas mercadia.
texts.en:
Marco Aurelio D. S. is 36, and his wife is Maria Santo Mejia. She devotes herself to taking care of their three children while Marco sells home items and novelties in the Langue municipal market. He has been in this type of business for three years. It has served to support his family. His goal is to buy his own stall in the municipal market. It is difficult to get a stall here, but he has faith that he will soon do it. He needs the loan to buy more merchandise and get better earnings. He has to travel to be able to buy his merchandise. This is difficult for him because when he buys, it is a small amount. Then he has to travel again soon, and this causes more expenses. That is the reason he needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy porcelin decorations, glass decorations, soaps, soft drinks, light bulbs, batteries, candles, and picture frames

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria del Transito tiene 36 años. Ella es cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que es una mujer que siempre se ha preocupado por sus pagos y es muy responsable.  Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y mantener a su familia. Inicio este negocio por cuenta propia porque necesitaba un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia por lo que viaja a mangua para comprar sus productos en donde le resulte más favorable. ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes para caballeros que es lo que le solicitan en pedido.
texts.en:
Maria del Transito is 36. She has been a client of the León Fundación since 2000. She is a woman who has always taken care of her payments, and she is very responsible. She sells clothes. She is a woman who likes to work and support her family. She started this business on her own because she needed an income to support her family. She travels to Managua to purchase her products where she finds better buys. She needs the loan to buy items like pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits for men. These are the items asked for when orders are made.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Ferminda

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Ferminda D. A. tiene 28 años de edad y vive en union libre con el señor Pascual
Mejia, ambos son comerciantes y venden ropa desde hace 3 años, tienen un hijo.
el sueño de ellos es hacerse de su propia casa ya que en estos momentos no tienen casa propia.
Maria esta solicitando el credito para comprar mercaderia. en estos momentos su negocio esta creciendo todos los meses, esta vendiendo mas todos los dias, pero necesita dinero para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor asi tendra mas ganancias. 
ahora esta comprando poco y a un precio mas alto esto hace que no tenga muchas ganancias.
se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo. 
necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Ferminda D. A. is 28 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Pascual Mejia. They are both traders and have been selling clothes for 3 years. They have one child. Their dream is to build their own house since they don't have one now.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy merchandise. These days, her business is growing every month, and she is selling more every day. She needs money to buy more merchandise wholesale, so she can have a higher profit. Now she's buying few clothes and at a higher price, which means her profits are low. She feels happy because her business is growing. She needs a loan to help her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear, shirts, blouses, suits, panties, socks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Lucero” esta representado por la señora Cecilia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales son  alegres y muy trabajadores como lo demuestran en sus puestos de venta de comida, cosméticos, ropa, empanadas, pan, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y asaditos en sus barrios. Pese al gran nivel competitivo ellas siempre tratan de salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y el bien estar de sus hijos. El destino del crédito es la ampliación de sus negocios con la adquisición de más mercadería para su venta  e insumos para los socios dedicados a la venta de comida, algunos de los miembros utilizaran el préstamo para la refacción de sus viviendas y tiendas. En cuanto a la experiencia los socios ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad de créditos individuales, por lo que no cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pero han demostrado ser gente muy activa y entusiasta en las reuniones preliminares por lo que la Fundación Agrocapital les da la oportunidad de un apoyo económico para que puedan mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank "Lucero" (Bright Star) is represented by Cecilia, and made up of 12 members who are happy and hard-working, as they show in their stands selling food, cosmetics, clothing, empanadas, bread; groceries in their neighborhood stores; and barbecue in their neighborhoods. In spite of the high level of competition, they always try to succeed since they are responsible for the support and well-being of their children.
